Title: Manifestacja deputata chorągwi pancernej przeciwko starszym lubelskim względem niemożności realizacji asygnacji skarbowej
Manifest: Jan Piętkiewicz towarzysz i deputat chorągwi pancernej Jana Tarły wojewody sandomierskiego manifestuje przeciwko Moszkowi, Jakubowi Zelikowiczowi rabinowi z Bychawy, Lejzorowi Abramowiczowi starszym lubelskim oraz Żydom z Krakowskiego Przedmieścia w Lublinie Jakubowi Oszarpanemu, Herszkowi Szlomowiczowi, Hejzykowi Bełżyckiemu i Moszkowi Slomie Kielmanowiczowi, w sprawie niewypłacenia asygnacji skarbowej na sumę 218 złp
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)

Title: Protestation by the companion of the of the armoured cavalry unit against the elders of Lublin concerning the unpaid orders of payment of the Jews from Kock
Manifest: Józef Starobiński, a companion and plenipotentiary of the armoured cavalry unit of the Starost of Mostów, protests against the land elders of Lublin: Józef from Kozienice, the rabbi of Opole, Wigdor Irsz from Kraśnik, Zelik, the rabbi from Janowiec, and Wigdor from Zwoleń. These land elders, sued to the Radom Tribunal concerning the unpaid money for the cavalry unit, made a settlement and issued two orders of payment of 340 złp for the Jews from Kock, but when he tried to cash them, the local Jews there refused to pay the due money.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)
Reference Number: APL, CLRMO 274, s. 216rv

Surnames: Józef z Kozienic, Starobiński Józef, Wigdor Irsz, Wigdor ze Zwolenia, Zelik z Janowca

Title: Protestation of the elders from Bełżyce against the rabbi of Opole
Manifest: For fear of the unjustified necessity to pay the military deputy the tax which has already been paid, Lejba Szmulowicz and Izrael Jonia protest against [Jasef] Józef the rabbi of Opole and also the land elder of Lublin, concerning the excessive poll tax imposed in the second tariff sent to the Treasury, inflated by the sum of 90 złp. In the first tariff presented to the Crown Treasury, Bełżyce was not specified by the land elders because the tax of 1,300 złp was paid by the town in a different way, directly on the basis of the presented orders of payment.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)
Reference Number: APL CLRMO 340, s. 165v-166r, APL CLRMO 342, s. 142rv
Surnames: Izrael Jonia, Józef z Opola, Lejba Szmulowicz

Title: Treasury ordinance for the deputies of the poll tax for the Jews of Greater Poland
Manifest: As a result of the “Jewish poll tax” established by the 1703 constitution of the Lublin diet, Grand Crown Treasurer Jan Przebendowski publishes the ordinance for deputies with assignations for Greater Poland Jews. He orders them not to demand the paying of the tax for specific communities from the main kahals (Kalisz, Krotoszyn, and Leszno) but to go with assignations directly to those communities instead. The deputies should show the assignations to the land elders beforehand. Land scribes are obliged to show the deputies the way to each community so they can execute the issued assignations. He forbids the Poznań rabbi to engage in the procedure of creating the allocation by land elders. Jews from minor kahals (partykularze) should cover the costs of provisions of each deputy with his horses (8 zlotys altogether). In addition each deputy should be paid 30 zlotys as a compensation of other expenses of their trip. Deputies as soldiers were supposed to be under hetman jurisdiction. Przebendowski forbids the landlords to protect those Jews who are avoiding paying the poll tax.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 313, s. 32rv
Surnames: Józef Szmaja, Przebendowski Jan Jerzy
Notes:
Tyt.: Deklaracyja skarbowa i ordynacyja względem ichmościów panów asygnatariuszów powiatów i Żydów wielkopolskich. Do oblaty w księgach
grodzkich kaliskich podał 29 I 1704 Józef Szmaja syndyk kaliski.

Title: Approval by the Crown elders of the documents of Zachariasz Peltowicz
Manifest: Court entry by the Crown Jewish elders at the Jewish assembly in Konstantynów, confirming the validity of documents belonging to Zachariasz Peltowicz. In the first, dated 15 IX 1745, Erszko Majerowicz committed himself to leave the stall after Zachariasz pays him 15 “red” zlotys. In the other one, Opole rabbi Józef, a Lublin land elder, confirmed that the first document was genuine.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)
Reference Number: APL, CLRMO 314, s. 41v-43v, APL, CLRMO 316, s. 90v
Geographical Names: Cracow (Kraków), Greater Poland, Konstantynów, Kremenets, Liuboml, Lublin, Nowy Korczyn, Opole Lubelskie, Poznan (Poznań), Tarnogóra, Zamosc
Surnames: Abraham Chaimowicz, Abram Józefowicz, Józef Abram Gierszonowicz, Józef Segalanda, Józef Senderowicz, Lewek Kahana, Moszek Berek Lewkowicz, Moszek Pinklas Chaimowicz, Szymon Doktorowicz, Wolf Segalanda, Zachariasz Peltowicz

Title: Consent for Chaim Abrahamowicz in the office of Lublin land rabbi
Manifest: Antoni Lubomirski, the Lublin voivode, appoints Chaim Abrahamowicz as the rabbi of Lublin, giving him jurisdiction over Jews from Lublin and the entire Lublin voivodeship and freeing him from paying taxes and debts required of the Lublin kahal. The voivode reserves himself the right to consider appeals of rabbinical decrees.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)
Reference Number: APL, CLRMO 325, s. 593r-594v
Surnames: Chaim Abrahamowicz, Lubomirski Antoni, Szymon Doktorowicz, Zamoyski Jan Jakub
Notes:
Tyt.: Instrumenti super munus rabinatus per illustrissimum principem Lubomirski palatinatum Lublinensem infideli Chaim Abrahamowicz collati
oblata. Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich lubelskich 27 VIII 1753 podał Szymon Doktorowicz syndyk generalny Żydów koronnych.

Title: The appointment of Abram Chaimowicz as the speaker of the Council of Four Lands
Manifest: Karol Sedlnicki, Treasurer of the Crown, appoints the Jew Abram Chaimowicz, a senior merchant of Lublin, as the speaker of the Crown Jews, seeing as the Jew Abram Józwowicz of Leszno has served his term. The latter is to officially step down from the post during the upcoming assembly.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)
Reference Number: APL, CLRMO 325, s. 590rv

Notes: Oblata w księgach grodzkich lubelskich w dn. 27 VIII 1753 przez Szymona Doktorowicza syndyka generalnego Żydów koronnych.

Title: Appointment for the office of speaker of the Jewish assembly by the commissar of the Crown Treasury
Manifest: Kazimierz Granowski, starost of Radom, commissar of the Treasury, delegate to the Jewish assembly in Jarosław appoints, in accordance with the Treasury appointment [of May 22 this year], Abram Chaimowicz of Lublin as the general speaker of the Crown Jews. He requests all Jews, qahals, synagogues, land elders, county elders, trustees, appraiser and dispensers to execute all decisions made by the newly appointed speaker, particularly where taxes are concerned.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)

Notes: Oblatował w księgach grodzkich w dn. 27 VIII 1753 r. Żyd Szymon Doktorowicz syndyk synagogi lubelskiej i wszystkich Żydów koronnych. https://www.szukajwarchiwach.gov.pl/jednostka/-/jednostka/2669739?_Jednostka_delta=200&_Jednostka_resetCur=false&_Jednostka_cur=4&_Jednostka_id_jednostki=2669739

Title: Letter by the Crown Treasurer to the elders of the voivodship of Lublin concerning the inflated poll tax for the Jews from Firlejowszczyzna
Manifest: Jan Ansgary Czapski, the Grand Treasurer of the Crown, admonishes the elders of the voivodship of Lublin because in their tariff they inflated the poll tax disproportionately when compared to the number of inhabitants: on the impoverished 24 Jews, farmers from the town (suburb) of Firlejowszczyzna near Lublin (the so-called Słomiany Rynek [Straw Market]) they imposed the tax of 400 złp, and in the last few years even 700 złp; and he orders a proportionate reduction of this tax.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)
Reference Number: APL, CLRMO 280, s. 178v-179v, APL, CLRMO 281, s. 1281, 1282

Manifest: Józef Strzałka cześnik nowogródzki, deputat chorągwi pancernej miecznika koronnego Antoniego Benedykta Lubomirskiego manifestuje przeciw gminie lubelskiej w sprawie niedopuszczenia do egzekucji należności na podstawie asygnacji podskarbiego koronnego Karola Odrowąża Sedlnickiego z dn. 18 X 1758 r. na kwotę 662 złp i 25 gr.

Title: Universal of Crown Treasurer Marek Matczyński on collecting the poll tax from the Jews of Bełz voivodeship and the Chełm land
Manifest: Grand Crown Treasurer Marek Matczyński forbids the nobility of the Bełz voivodeship and Chełm land to protect Jews from local villages and towns and to prevent to collect general poll tax by Crown treasury assignation holders (deputies) under the threat of a suit by the Crown prosecutor in the Crown tribunal. In the case of the failure to provide the required amount, the deputies may seal synagogues, sequestrate Jewish goods, and imprison the debtors.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Belz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie bełskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 1, op. 1, sp. 284, s. 58-60
Surnames: Matczyński Marek, Moszko Lewkowicz
Notes: Moszko Lewkowicz, the beadle [shammes] of the Zamość community, introduces on 10 January 1691 in the Bełz castke court records books. Probably wrong year (1691 instead of 1690).

Title: Lawsuit to the tax tribunal against the elders of the voivodeship of Lublin concerning the incorrect order of payment
Manifest: Józef Starobiński, a companion and deputy of the armoured cavalry unit of Teodor Szaniawski, the son of the Lithuanian Master of the Hunt, sues the elders of the of Lublin Voivodeship, especially Abraham Chaimowicz, a merchant from Lublin, to the tax tribunal in Radom due to the damage inflicted to the Crown Treasury and the cavalry unit, by placing in the 1735 annual tariff the amount of 300 złp for the town of Łysobyki (the Rzewuskis estates), in which not a single Jew remained.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)

Title: Contract between the land elders and the archdeacon of Sandomierz
Manifest: A contract between Sebastian Kokwiński, the archdeacon and official of Sandomierz, and the land elders [of the Jewish self-government] for 14000 złp in gold, guaranteed by the Jewish communities in a separate inscriptions. Jews pledge to pay the Chapter of the Sandomierz collegiate church a yearly rent of 7% (980 złp) for music. In order to facilitate the payment of the rent, the elders of Sandomierz and Opatów communities are obliged to deliver the rent.
Archive: Sandomierz Diocesan Library
Reference Number: BDS, AKKKS 76, s. 84r-85v, BDS, AKKKS 75, s. 1r-2v [kopia]

Manifest: Treasury appropriation issued by Marcin Zamoyski, voivode of Lublin, administrator of the Crown Treasury, and Jan Plaskowski, clerk of the Crown Treasury, for Kazimierz Zapolski, chamberlain of Sieradz, deputy of Poland to the Moscow Treaties, for the amount of  425 Polish zlotys, paid by Poznań Jews from the Jewish poll tax installment of May 1684 (with the annotation and the signature of K. Zapolski about its payment).

Title: Universal of Jan Andrzej Morsztyn, Crown Treasurer
Manifest: The Grand Treasurer of the Crown, Jan Andrzej Morsztyn, informs that the convocation Sejm imposed on all Jews in the Crown over 10 years of age a general poll tax, which should be paid in accordance with the provisions of the constitution, and not according to the tariff from 1662.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)

Title: Declaration of the former land elders of Wielkopolska
Manifest: Joachim Smol, Mendel Herc, former land elders of Great Poland [Wielkopolska] and Marek Józefowicz, land scribe, manifest that they were ready to carry out the sentence of Rafał Leszczyński, the Kalisz voivode, between the former land elders and the current land elders of Wielkopolska and the elders of Kalisz and Leszno, and to carry out (by their commissioners) settlement of accounts (calculation ) in Kobylin, but the other party did not want to do it.

Title: Stanisław Krogulecki's declaration against the marshal of the Ruthenian lands regarding the land rabbi
Manifest: Stanisław Krogulecki  Czerwonogrod voivodship judge, manifests against Berek Rabinowicz, Marshal of the Ruthenian Voivodeship, and Major Herszkowicz Horodeński, regarding the usurpation by the latter title of the general (land) rabbi of the Ruthenian Voivodship against the rescript of August II, the instruction of [Jan Stanisław] Jabłonowski, the Ruthenian Voivode, and the decision of the Jewish congress in Przemyślany of October 6, 1752, according to which Chaim Symchowicz was to hold the office of the general rabbi of the Ruthenian Voivodeship indivisibly.

Title: Protective universal of Jan III Sobieski to Crown Jews
Manifest: King Jan III Sobieski confirms the resolutions of the Grodno diet of 1679 to Crown Jews and forbids collecting from them any taxes established at noble dietines. He also forbids suing them in courts other than the voivode court or court of assessors.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie)
Surnames: Icko Aronowicz, Icko Lewkowicz, Jan III Sobieski, Mojżesz Markowicz, Szuka Stanisław Antoni
Notes: Tyt.: Pro parte infidelium Iudaeorum Regni litterarum Sacrae Regiae Maiestatis protectionis oblatae. W księgach grodzkich chełmskich ekstrakt z akt grodzkich warszawskich, oblatowany 20 VI 1681 przez syndyka Żydów koronnych Mojżesza Markowicza, oblatowali 9 VII 1681 starsi chełmscy Icko Aronowicz i Icko Lewkowicz.

Title: Documents concerning the poll tax from the Kalisz and Poznań Jewish land elders
Manifest: The assignment of Adam Mikołaj Sieniawski, Grand Hetman of the Crown, Voivode of Bełz, for Felicjan Grabski, standard-bearer of Łęczyca, for 2,000 zlotys from the Jewish poll tax to the Jews of Kalisz and Poznań, as remuneration for the commissioner's function in the hibernation commission for the year 1706, Warsaw, March 21, 1707; and receipts from Jan Malski and Stanisław Poleski for Samuel Markowicz, the scribe general of the Jews of Wielkopolska, on receipt of assignments to individual communes of the Greater Poland Land, Kalisz, 2 September 1707, i.e. to Łęczyca 400; Strykowa 150; [..]char 500; Gabin 150; Kowal[?]; Brześć Kujawski 500; Lubraniec [1?].

Title: Declaration of Olyka Jews against Fiszel Lejbowicz
Manifest: Michel Moszkowicz, the syndic [shtadlan] of the Ołyka kahal, manifests against Fiszel Lejbowicz, the scribe general of the Crown Jews, as well as the rabbis and [land] elders, regarding the failure to meet the conditions of the law granted by Jan III and August II to the Ołyka community, that every three years a Jewish council [sejmik] should be convened in Ołyka, and also no tax resolutions were adopted without the signature of the rabbi and the elders of Ołyk. Fiszel, after issuing the universal on 3 April 1703 by [Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski], the castellan of Kraków, not only did not convene the sejmik, but issued an allocation for several hundred zlotys to Ołyka, to the detriment of the community.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Reference Number: Archiv Jugo-Zapadnoj Rossii izdavaemyj Kommisseju dlja razbora drevnich Aktov, cz. V, t. I, Akty o gorodach, Kijev 1869, s. 206-208 [Na podstawie ks. grodzkiej krzemienieckiej 1612, k. 139]
Surnames: Fiszel Lejbowicz, Michel Moszkowicz
Notes: The manuscript does not exist anymore. See. M.Schorr, Organizacya Żydów w Polsce: (od najdawniejszych czasów aż do 1772 r.), Lwów 1919, p. 77.

Title: Decree of the infamy of the treasury tribunal in Radom in the case between the Czartoryskis and the land elders of the Ruthenian Voivodeship
Manifest: Decree in absentia of infamy imposed on Berek Rabinowicz and his son-in-law Lejba Rabinowicz and other land elders of the Ruthenian voivodeship regarding the prevention of the execution of the condemnata (decree of absentee banishment) in the case between them and August Czartoryski and his wife Maria Zofia [Zofia Maria], Ruthenian voivodes, Kaluga starosts and the elders of the community in Kałusz for excessive burden and impoverishment of the Jewish communities in Kałusz, Brzeżany, Skole, Narajów and Przemyślany. The execution was carried out by A.J. Dąbrowski, Podstoli of Płock, sub-delegate of the Żydaczów castle court, in front of Berek Rabinowicz's tenement house in Brody on November 28, 1761. Berko, refusing the execution, allegedly said [fragment in Polish], that in Konstantynów, in 1760, the land elders concluded an agreement with the community in Kałusz, setting the amount of the poll tax at 2,200 zlotys. In 1761, the elders did not collect it because the Jews from Kałusz wanted to pay in tynfs, counting 38 groszy each, which was inconsistent with the so-called reduction of money [monetary regulation]. He assured that they would conclude a settlement with the Kałusz commune during the next Lviv contracts.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Potockich z Łańcuta
Reference Number: AGAD, Archiwum Potockich z Łańcuta 4378, s. 14-25
Geographical Names: Berezhany, Brody, Kalush (Ukraine), Konstantynów, Lviv (Lwów), Narayiv (Ukraine), Peremyshliany (Ukraine), Radom, Skole
Surnames: Berko Rabinowicz, Czaroryska Zofia maria, Czartoryski August Aleksander, Dąbrowski A.J., Lejba Rabinowicz
Notes:
Extract from court files with wafer seal.
The act of execution was entered into the Lviv castle court records on May 17, 1763. The decree also contains the content of the summons of April 5, 1761, which was presented in the Lviv castle court records on May 7, 1763.

Title: Protest by the nobles of Podolia against the Crown Treasury
Manifest: The voivode of Kijów, Józef Potocki, the voivode of Podolia, Stefan Humiecki, the voivode of Bełz, Stefan Potocki, Crown Guard Józef Potocki, general starost of Podolia, Jan Kątski, Steward of Latyczów, Karol Maksymilian Kruzer, Delegate to the Tribunal from the Podolia voivodeship and Pantler of Latyczów, and Stanisław Telefus, deputy voivode of Podolia, and Michał Podczaski, Pantler of Latyczów, Samson Bombek, on behalf of the nobles of Podolia, protest against the Treasury unlawfully penalizing the Jews of Podolia. The Treasury, rather than punishing those Jews who illegally import wine from Hungary, sees it fit to tax all Crown Jews, including those of Podolia, who the protesters claim do not traffic in wine.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)
Reference Number: APL, CLRMO 221, s. 158rv
Surnames: Bombek Samson, Humiecki Stefan, Janicki Mikolaj Rola, Katski Jan Stanisław, Krasnowski, Kruzer Karol Maksymilian, Podczaski Michał Kazimierz, Potocki Józef, Potocki Stefan, Telefus Stanisław Piotr, Tokarzewski Antoni
Notes: Published: Sejm Czterech Ziem. Źródła, do druku przygotowali J. Goldberg i A. Kaźmierczyk, Wydawnictwo Sejmowe, Warszawa 2011, s. 320, 321.

Title: Ugoda starszych kaliskich z deputatem chorągwi
Manifest: Komplanacja [ugoda] podpisana przez Stanisława Ostrowskiego deputata chorągwi [Feliksa Aleksandra Lipskiego] wojewody kaliskiego ze starszymi powiatu kaliskiego, w której zobowiązali się dostarczyć za cztery tygodnie od daty zawarcia ugody asygnacje do miasteczek powiatu na kwotę 1300 złp. Z kolei Ostrowski zobowiązał się oddać wówczas asygnację skarbową na kwotę 4000 złp (zgodnie z treścią dokumentu pozostawało 975 złp do wypłacenia, nie żądać żadnego dodatkowego wynagrodzenia ("kontentacyi") i wydać pokwitowanie Żydom.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 309, s. 82rv
Surnames: Lispski Feliks Aleksander, Marek Korzennik, Ostrowski Stanisław

Title: Resolution of the Jewish council in Toruń
Manifest: The Złotów poviat elders gathered at the regional council in Toruń established the amount of the tariff and pledged to hand it over the Złotów elders under the threat of execution. At the same time, they resolved that they were subordinate to the Złotów community only as regards tax matters.

Title: Relacja o nałożeniu aresztu sądowego na Żydów podczas sejmiku ziemstwa chełmskiego
Manifest: W czasie obrad sejmiku starszych ziemstwa chełmskiego (m.in. Żydów z Chełma, Zamościa, Tyszowców, Hrubieszowa)  odbywających się w Grabowcu w domu Irsza, woźny sądowy Jan Bodakowski w obecności Antoniego Romanowskiego i Jakuba Robakiewicza na rekwizycję Michała Szackiego prezbitera i instygatora diecezji chełmskiej, oraz kantorów Łukasza Manachowicza kościoła skierbieszowskiego i  Macieja Leśniowskiego kościoła grabowieckiego nałożył areszt sądowy na osoby karczmarzy i arendarzy żydowskich ze wsi Wielkie Oczy, Dub, Zawalów, czyniąc odpowiedzialnym za ich stawienie Irsza Piotruszkę marszałka ziemstwa chełmskiego [chełmsko-bełskiego], Żyda hrubieszowskiego.

Title: Libertacja starszych ziemskich chełmskich i bełskich dla Żydów cieszanowskich
Manifest: Tłumaczenie libertacji starszych ziemskich województwa bełskiego i chełmskiego (Irsza Nachymowicza z Hrubieszowa, Abramka z Bełza, Mendla z Lubomla, Icko Szmojłowicza z Tyszowców, Aarona Moszkowicza z Tomaszowa Lubelskiego) dla Żydów z Cieszanowa. Ponieważ Żydzi cieszanowscy zawarli ugodę ze starszymi ziemskimi, na mocy której mieli oni płacić 1100 złp pogłównego żydowskiego  rocznie od 1698 r. w dwóch ratach po 550 złp, w zamian za to starsi ziemscy obiecali, że Żydzi cieszanowscy nie będą płacić więcej nawet w przypadku podniesienia podatku królewskiego.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv

Title: Pozew do sądu ziemskiego chełmskiego dla starszych ziemskich chełmsko-bełskich względem niewypłaconych sum wyderkafowych
Manifest: Ojciec Mielewski przeor lubelskiego konwentu bonifratrów (Zakon Szpitalny Świętego Jana Bożego) i Bernard Kuberski prokurator generalny prowincji bonifratrów, Ludwik Burnet kantor szpitalny kościoła św. Michała Archanioła i prepozyt kościoła św. Ducha, mieszczanin Kazimierz Miczowski wdowiec po zmarłej Agnieszce Miczowskiej obywatelce Lublina  pozywają do sądu ziemskiego chełmskiego, na sesję za 2 tygodnie od daty położenia pozwu, Józefa Bławatnika, Moszka Juzwowicza, Zelka Irszowicza, Moszka Rabinowicza starszych ziemskich chełmskich i syndyka gminy chełmskiej oraz Marka Kaimowicza i Wulfa Chaimowicza Pietruszkę z Hrubieszowa, Judkę i Izraela z Lubomla [starszych ziemskich chełmsko-bełskich] tudzież dwóch mieszczan, braci Franciszka i Kazimierza Uszów i ich rodzeństwo, względem legowanych przez testatorkę i zapisanych na gminie chełmskiej sum wyderkafowych (testament sporządzony w Lublinie i oblatowany w księgach grodzkich lubelskich 5 IV 1742, podpisany 6 IX 1742, łącznie 1000 złp legatu) 300 złp dla konwentu bonifratrów lubelskich, 400 złp dla kościoła św. Ducha w Lublinie, 100 złp za odprawianie mszy świętych za duszę testatorki w w/w kościołach, od których sum powinny byli Żydzi wypłacać kościołom prowizje, lecz na sumy nałożony został areszt przez Uszów, uniemożliwiając tym samym spłatę zadłużenia.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie)
Reference Number: APL, KGCH 139, s. 633v-634v
Surnames: Burnet Ludwik, Izrael, Judka, Józef Bławatnik, Kuberski Bernard, Marek Kaimowicz, Miczowska Agnieszka, Miczowski Kazimierz, Mielewski, Moszek Rabinowicz, Moszko Juzwowicz, Usz Franciszek, Usz Kazimierz, Wulf Chaimowicz Pietruszka; Wulf Pietruszka, Zelko Irszowicz
Notes: Relację o złożeniu pozwu do ksiąg grodzkich chełmskich zdał 19 XII 1742 woźny Jan Niedźwiedziński.

Title: Manifestacja starszych ziemskich chełmsko-bełskich przeciwko Ludwikowi Podhorodyńskiemu i Ignacemu Sadowskiemu w sprawie wyroku sądu zjazdowego
Manifest: Starsi ziemscy chełmsko-bełscy i hrubieszowscy oraz lubomelscy Abram Judkowicz, Nochim Irszowicz, Wulf Pietruszka, Izrael Jankielowicz manifestują przeciwko Ludwikowi Podhorodyńskiemu pisarzowi ziemskiemu włodzimierskiemu jako sędziemu i Ignacemu Sadowskiemu staroście słonimskiemu dziedzicowi miasta Przewały w sprawie niekorzystnego i szkodliwego dla nich wyroku kondescencji (sądu zjazdowego) wyznaczonego dekretem trybunału skarbowego radomskiego w sprawie pomiędzy nimi a starostą słonimskim o jakoby nadmierne obciążenie Żydów z Przewał. Podhorodyński dopuścił świadków starosty, osoby nieznające dobrze sprawę, i odrzucił obronę starszych, że do Przewał należą okoliczni Żydzi, którzy zwyczajowo obchodzą swoje święta w tamtejszej synagodze i dokładają się do sumy 200 złp w ułożonej dla Przewał taryfie, w skutek czego doprowadził wbrew prawu do ukarania starszych ziemskich  na sumę 500 grzywien oraz kolejnych 1000 zgodnie z dwoma kondemnatami
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie), Horodlo castle court files (Księgi grodzkie horodelskie)

Manifest: Jan Błoński skarbnik żytomierski, towarzysz chorągwi husarskiej Augusta Czartoryskiego wojewody ruskiego pozywa do trybunału skarbowego radomskiego Józefa Chaimowicza hrubieszowskiego, marszałka, Zelika Irszowicza chełmskiego, Hersza Abramowicza lubomelskiego, Helo Haskowicza bełskiego, Nochima Szmujłowicza tarnogórskiego i innych starszych ziemskich ziemi chełmskiej i województwa bełskiego oraz Haima Szmula, Wolfa Safira i innych starszych i Żydów sieniawskich w sprawie wyznaczenia w swoim dyspartymencie za rok 1750 zawyżonej kwoty na Żydów sieniawskich (o 210 złp) wbrew ugodzie zawartej w Konstantynowie w dn. 5 VIII 1748 r. i aprobowanej przez podskarbiego koronnego, narażenie deputata na koszty i straty etc.

Title: Umowa między ziemstwem chełmsko-bełskim a kahałem w Tyszowcach w sprawie pogłównego i sum wyderkafowych
Manifest: Ajzyk Józefowicz Żyd bełski, marszałek ziemstwa chełmsko-bełskiego i Nochim Szmujłowicz z Tyszowców, Wolf Mendlowicz z Narola starsi ziemscy bełscy oraz  Zelik Erszkowicz z Chełma, Herszek Abramowicz z Lubomla, Marek Doktorowicz z Hrubieszowa, starsi ziemscy chełmscy zawierają umowę ze starszymi kahału w Tyszowcach Berkiem Ickowiczem, Lejzorem Szmujłowiczem, na mocy której starsi ziemscy chełmsko-bełscy oświadczyli, że nie będą już za starszych tyszowieckich wypłacać rocznej prowizji od głównej sumy wyderkafowej (którą wypłacać powinien kahał w Tyszowcach), a w zamian starsi ziemscy uwalniają kahał w Tyszowcach od obowiązku odprowadzania podatku pogłównego żydowskiego i realizacji zaległych asygnacji skarbowych. Ponadto kahał tyszowiecki zobowiązany został spłacić zaciągniętą przez ziemstwo sumę wyderkafową 500 złp brygidkom sokalskim i prowizję roczną 100 złp [od wyderkafu zabezpieczonego na dobrach Dzierążnia] p. [Annie] Węgleńskiej miecznikowej buskiej, a także zaspokoić roszczenia starosty wieluńskiego [Wojciech Męciński]. Umowę zawarto ze względu na 1) konieczność zapłaty sum dłużnych wierzycielom opiewających na 6.000 złp (dla brygidek z Sokala 540 złp, [Bogumiłowi] Pawłowskiemu towarzyszowi chorągwi pancernej wojewody bełskiego [Antoni Michał Potocki] w związku z asygnacją podskarbiego wielkiego koronnego [Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki] i dekretem trybunału radomskiego  1800 złp, Świdzińskiemu towarzyszowi buławy polnej koronnej [Jan Klemens Branicki] 2377 złp, p. Rączce 300 złp, p. Janiszewskiemu 270 złp, p. Łepkowskiemu 90 złp, p. [Franciszkowi Salezemu] Potockiemu krajczemu koronnemu prowizji za 2 lata od sumy 3.000 złp-623 złp), 2) ulokowania tej łącznej kwoty na kahale w Tyszowcach [pożyczonej od kościoła w Rachaniach przez starszych ziemskich celem spłaty zobowiązań] w postaci wyderkafu, zapisanego przez Rostkowskich starostów tyszowieckich "na różaniec" kościołowi rachańskiemu, z roczną prowizją 7% płatną przez kahał w Tyszowcach [a faktycznie płaconą przez ziemstwo].
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Grabowiec castle court files (Księgi grodzkie grabowieckie)
Reference Number: APL GRRMO 233, s. 287rv
Geographical Names: Belz (Bełz), Busk, Chełm (Chelm), Hrubieszow (Hrubieszów), Liuboml, Narol, Rachanie, Radom, Sokal, Tyszowce, Wieluń

Title: Settlement between the communities of the Zamość Entailed Estate and the Chełm-Bełz region
Manifest: The Chełm-Bełz and Zamość Entailed Estate elders agreed to settle disputable issues in the arbitration court, to which they appointed their arbitrators. The Chełm-Bełz elders appointed Szmojło, the rabbi of Hrubieszów, and Fiszel, the scribe of the Crown Jews. The Zamość Entailed Estate Jews appointed Szmul, the rabbi of Szczebrzeszyn, and Juda Hirszowicz, an Opatów Jew. The superarbitrator was Irsz Bolochowski from Rzeszów. If the representatives of one of the parties did not appear on the court date, then Fiszel could unilaterally order them to pay the poll tax by the tariffs previously arranged by the Crown elders. There would then be no possibility to refuse or change the assessment, to which the Crown treasurer agreed. The parties agreed on the date of the meeting in Żółkiewka on 15 May 1721. No more than four representatives of each party could come to the arbitration court sitting.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Horodlo castle court files (Księgi grodzkie horodelskie)
Reference Number: APL, Horodelskie RMO 43, s. 1046-1048
Geographical Names: Chełm (Chelm), Cracow (Kraków), Horodło, Hrubieszow (Hrubieszów), Lublin, Opatow, Rzeszów, Szczebrzeszyn, Volodymyr-Volynsky (Włodzimierz Wołyński), Zamosc
Surnames: Aaron Szmul, Dawid Doktorowicz, Fiszel Lewkowicz, Heszel Rabinowicz, Hirsz Jakubowicz Bolechowski, Irsz Zelikowicz, Irz Piotruszka, Izral Mośko, Juda Hirszowicz, Lejba Aronowicz, Pinkas Zelik, Szmojło, Szmul Szmerlewicz

Manifest: Protestacja Aleksandra Noniatyckiego sługi Samuela Lipskiego stolnika kijowskiego przeciw Fajbiszowi z Hrubieszowa, Moszkowi i Irszowi z Turobina, Lejbie z Opatowa, Jakubowi i Fajbiszowi z Lubomla, Zelikowi z Chełma, Karpelowi z Tarnogrodu, a także całej synagodze województwa bełskiego i ziemi chełmskiej w sprawie nieoddania długu. Title: Resolution of the elders of the Chełm land and the Bełz voivodeship establishing the office of scribes and explaining the procedure for receiving tax deputies
Manifest: The elders of Chełm-Bełz, gathered at the regional council in Waręż, appointed the land scribes: Irsz Samsonowicz, the general scribe of the Crown Jews and Gerszon Doktorowicz, the scribe of Bełz, the responsible for issuing tax allocation to deputies for individual kahals of the land, based on an allocation bearing the countersignature of the land rabbi. The scribes were obliged to keep tax books registering contributions for individual kahals, as well as to settle financial accounts and determine the size of tariff for each community, taking into account the need to repay loans drawn by the lands. The land elders declared that the land marshal had no right to interrupt the scribes or demand money from them, and they themselves promised to take their dispositions into account. The elders stated that the scribes are not subject to any poviat contributions, and the assignees and the noble creditors who have claims to lands should not enforce them on scribes. In the event of the non-fulfillment of tax assignments by the communities, the aggrieved military deputies should demand from the scribes the issuance of new, substitute assignments only when they have proved that the previous amounts had not been paid to them. It was agreed that the salary of scribes and the costs incurred would be included in the account of tax receivables of the land submitted to the Crown Treasury, which was approached for approval of the resolution.

Title: Resolution of the Chełm-Bełz elders on the finances of the land
Manifest: Chełm-Bełz elders, gathered at the regional council in Grabowiec, accepted the estimate of the expenses of the land for the year 1751/1752. The total sum of the anticipated expenditures of 25,214 zlotys consists of commissions from the wyderkaufs drawn from the clergy and nobility; the cost of returning the assessment to the Crown Treasury; the annual salaries of the marshal, land elders, and rabbis from the main cities (Chełm, Luboml, Bełz, Hrubieszów); the costs of coming to the regional council (only for one delegate from the community); and the salaries of two scribes and the salaries of servants. Under the threat of being removed from office, land officials were prohibited from signing assignments for sums other than those in the adopted estimate, and the procedure for settling debts of individual kahals in the land was established.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Grabowiec castle court files (Księgi grodzkie grabowieckie)

Title: Asekuracja starszych ziemskich chełmsko-bełskich dla P.M. Miączyńskiego wojewody czernihowskiego
Manifest: Starsi ziemscy ziemi chełmskiej i województwa bełskiego zobowiązują się do zwrotu pożyczonych 3000 złp (w tym 2000 bez prowizji) oraz pozostałych długów [Piotrowi Michałowi] Miączyńskiemu wojewodzie czernihowskiemu, które zobowiązują się zwracać w ratach po 1040 złp rocznie, ustalając prowizję na 10 % rocznie od pożyczonych kwot. Te 1040 złp Miączyński ma odbierać od kahału maciejowskiego [obecnie Łuków], swego dziedzicznego miasta. Jednocześnie zobowiązują się, że w swoich dyspartymentach uchwalanych na kolejnych sejmikach nie obciążą Żydów w Maciejowie kwotą większą niż wspomniane 1040 złp. Podpisani: Ajzyk rabin wodzisławski, wiernik ziemi chełmskiej; Hersz Abramowicz starszy ziemski z Lubomla; Icko Hajzyk starszy z Bełza; Wulf Beniumen z Rubieszowa [Hrubieszowa] starszy; Nachman starszy z Tyszowiec.

Title: Innotescencja  sądu kapturowego chełmskiego w sprawie niezapłaconego wyderkafu jezuitów krasnostawskich
Manifest: Innotescencja (pozew) sądu kapturowego ziemi chełmskiej i powiatu krasnostawskiego na wniosek Jana Reutha przełożonego (superiora) rezydencji jezuitów krasnostawskich, w którym obwieszcza o nałożonej karze banicji na starszych kahałów ziemi chełmskiej i województwa bełskiego [oraz Ordynacji Zamojskiej] tj. Irsza Chaima Zelkowicza z Chełma, Beniamina Lewkowicza z Zamościa, Lewka Ickowicza z Szczebrzeszyna, Majera Józefowicza z Turobina, Berka Majerowicza z Chełma, Manu Jakubowicza z Bełza, Szmula Moszkowicza z Lubomla, Irsza Moszkowicza z Hrubieszowa, Icka Wulfowicza z Tarnogrodu, Mendla Zrowicza z Tyszowiec w związku z niestawieniem się na wyznaczony termin sądowy w urzędzie grodzkim chełmskim (20 III 1697) i niewypłaceniem przez nich jezuitom sumy 32 000 złp pożyczonej na wyderkaf, od której pozwani zobowiązali się wypłacać do rąk superiora  kwartalnie roczną prowizję i nakazuje stawić się na kolejny termin sądów kapturowych.

Title: Aprobata kontraktu arendownego Żydów horodelskich przez starszych ziemskich chełmskich
Manifest: Starsi ziemscy chełmscy zebrani na sejmiku żydowskim [nie podano miejsca] zaaprobowali kontrakt na trzyletnią arendę podatków od żydowskich arendarzy (1685-1688) zawarty pomiędzy Żydami horodelskimi Chaimem Ickowiczem i Józefem Abrahamowiczem, a niedotrzymanie umowy przez którąś  ze stron obwarowali klątwą i wysokimi grzywnami.

Title: Ordynacja wojewody bełskiego dla Żydów województwa bełskiego
Manifest: Konstanty Krzysztof Wiśniowiecki wojewoda bełski potwierdza dawne prawa i zwyczaje Żydów województwa bełskiego oraz ustala zasady funkcjononowania urzędu podwojewodzińskiego i sędziego żydowskiego w związku ze spaleniem wszystkich praw i przywilejów podczas pożaru Bełza. Nakazuje m.in., aby Żydzi kahału bełskiego wraz z rabinem przygotowali rejestr miejscowości województwa z wysokością należnej dorocznej pensji wojewody (500 złp),  podwojewodziego (130)  na dzień św. Marcina [11 XI]. Dragoni, którzy mieli zbierać podatek, winni być utrzymywani przez Żydów. Żydzi mieszkający w województwie nie mają apelować do sejmików czy kongresu Żydów koronnych, a do sądu wojewody.

Title: Dekret trybunału radomskiego w sprawie przeciw starszym ziemskim chełmskim
Manifest: Dekret infamii trybunału skarbowego radomskiego (wraz z publikacją wyroku przez woźnego)  w sprawie przeciw starszym ziemskim chełmskim  Szlomie Moszkowiczowi chełmskiemu, Hajzykowi Szmujłowiczowi biłgorajskiemu, rabinom, Moszkowi Józwowiczowi, Heszelowi Majorowiczowi, Zelkowi Hirszowiczowi, Zawelowi Szymonowiczowi starszym ziemskim chełmskim na podstawie pozwu z 10 IV 1748 r., w którym starsi ziemscy bełscy, gmina i dziedzic Tartakowa Franciszek Salezy Potocki krajczy koronny oskarżali ich o dwukrotnie wydanie dyspozycji z lekceważeniem starszych ziemskich bełskich i wydanie dwóch asygnacji skarbowych do Tartakowa.

Title: Manifestacja przeciw starszym ziemskim bełskim i chełmskim
Manifest: Wincenty Mietelski manifestuje w imieniu Antoniego Bętkowskiego przeciw Moszkowi chełmskiemu, Irszowi Pietruszce hrubieszowskiemu, Chaimowi Ickowiczowi tartakowskiemu, Szmujło Michałowiczowi lubomelskiemu, Abramowi Irszowiczowi Pietruszce bełskiemu, Mendlowi Froimowiczowi tyszowieckiemu, Wolfowi Mendlowiczowi narolskiemu, starszym ziemskim województwa bełskiego i ziemi chełmskiej w sprawie niewykonania swojej asekuracji i niewypłacenia sumy Bętkowskiemu w dniu 20 II, w zamian za to wystawili asygnacje do dóbr Tyszowce i Narol.

Title: Declaration of the elders of the Chełm kahal against the elders of the Chełm and Bełz land
Manifest: The elders of the Chełm kahal declare against the land elders of Chełm, Bełz, Hrubieszów, Luboml, Tyszowce, and Narol, that, the land elders did not take into account the bad condition of the community and did not inform them that they had entered into wyderkauf contracts with nobles and the clergy, requiring Chełm Jews to pay the commission on these sums. They also declare that the land elders had embezzled the money borrowed on behalf of the land, and that they covertly put together the allocation, without giving any tax deduction to Chełm Jews.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie), Krasnystaw castle court files (Księgi grodzkie krasnostawskie)

Notes: Do akt grodzkich krasnostawskich podał 3 XI 1745 r. niewierny Daniel Szendorowicz syndyk synagogi chełmskiej

Title: Treasury ordinance for deputies of Jewish poll tax
Manifest: Grand Crown Treasurer Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski orders deputies with treasury assignations to go to Jewish land elders who will prepare for them the tax allocation for each community in towns and townlets according to a regulation on the head tax and an additional hiberna tax that was passed at the Grodno diet in 1693. Only afterwards will deputies be able to go and collect money from particular towns and townlets. Each community with a treasury assignation should pay provisions of 2 zlotys per day for each deputy and his servants (but no more than 4 persons). Moreover, each deputy will receive from the community 30 zł per day for fulfilling their duties. The grand treasurer forbids deputies to force any other payments from Jews.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv, Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv, The State Archive in Lublin, The State Archive in Poznan (APP)

Title: Acknowledgement of the elders of the Ruthenian voivodeship regarding the repayment of the wyderkauf and the poll tax in Lesko community
Manifest: The elders of the Ruthenian voivodeship concluded a contract for wyderkauf with Józef Ossoliński, the Crown court standard-bearer and the starost of Sandomierz, for the sum of 20,000 zlotys from which the annual commission was to amount to 10% to be paid by Lesko kahal.This amount was to be added to the sum of the Jewish poll tax. However, considering its impoverishment and settlements with the community in Baligród,the elders of the voivodeship reduced the amount of tax for Lesko Jews to 400 zlotys and for Baligród Jews to 250 zlotys. After 15 years, the kahal in Lesko was obliged to pay 2,300 zlotys annually, and Baligród 100 zlotys of tax. In return, the authority of the Lesko community over its villages was confirmed, along with the community’s right to fill the office of one of the Ruthenian land elders and to participate in land congresses.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv

Title: Universal of August Czartoryski, voivode of Ruthenia, appointing Chaim Symchowicz as the rabbi of Lviv and as the general land rabbi of Ruthenia
Manifest: August Czartoryski, Ruthenian voivode and general starost, confirms Chaim Symchowicz in the office of the rabbi of Lviv and gives him the Ruthenian land rabbinate for three years, equipping him with judicial powers over Lviv and Lviv poviat Jews and freeing him from paying debts and taxes required of the Lviv kahal.

oblata. Do oblaty w księdze sądu kapturowego województwa ruskiego, ziemi lwowskiej i powiatu żydaczowskiego podał 5 IV 1764 Michał Dzieliński.

Title: Universal of Jan III Sobieski to Jews of the Bełz voivodeship and Chełm land
Manifest: As a result of numerous supplications of complaint against the current land elders and rabbis of Bełz voivodeship and Chełm land, King Jan III Sobieski, dismisses them from their offices and orders the appointing of a special committee (with two delegates from each town) led by Chona Markowicz. The committee’s task is to settle the bills of the current elders and introduce order in the land.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv

Title: Settlement between the Lipsk and Narol elders on community income sharing
Manifest: Lipsko and Narol kahal elders concluded an agreement on the income from the lease of the so-called krupka, i.e. the consumption tax paid jointly by Jews from both communities for butchery and commercial activity. It was established that two scribes, one from each community, were to supervise the proceeds from this tax. Likewise, the poll tax should also be levied together with the funeral tax on rural leaseholders. Income from these taxes should be spent on the Jewish poll tax, followed by the repayment of debts. The city that does not keep the contract should pay 150 marks to the castle and the land elders.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv

Title: Register of expenses and income of the marshal of the Ruthenian land for the years 1722-1725
Manifest: Marek Becalowicz, the marshal of the Ruthenian land, entered in the court files the register of his expenses and income for the years 1722-1725, which he incurred and obtained in connection with fulfilling his duties as marshal.

Title: Selection of documents from the trial between the Jews of the Sandomierz economy and the Ulanów kahal held before the Radom tribunal
Manifest: The plenipotentiaries of the Sandomierz economy (royal private estates) and the Ulanów kahal submitted a list (summary) containing 26 documents from the years 1747-1750 with attachments (including decrees of the congressional courts, agreements concluded between parties, decrees of the rabbis of the Zamość Entailed Estate, and poll tax allocations created by Zamość land elders). The Jewish leaseholders from the Sandomierz economy wanted to separate from the Ulanów kahal with the intention of joining the Rozwadów kahal. They did not want to pay a salary to the rabbi of Ulanów, nor the lodgings for the cantor and shames, nor commission on loans taken by the Ulanów kahal, nor to co-finance travel costs to Zamość, repair the cemetery, or deliver wax for candles to the synagogue. For some of the leaseholders, it was difficult to go to Ulanów, on the other side of the San River. The Ulanów kahal cast curses on the disobedient Jews from the Sandomierz economy and forbade them from using the local synagogue. Jews from economy estates were dissatisfied above all with the amount of poll tax imposed on them. The provisions of the preliminary settlement concluded in Nisko (1748) in the presence of the Tarnogród rabbi and four arbitrators, setting the poll tax for economy’s Jews at 615 zlotys, were questioned by the Ulanów kahal.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Kameralne

Surnames: Duchnowski Stanisław Franciszek, Flemming Jerzy Detloff, Hoffman Jerzy, Kostecki Tomasz, Mańkowski Franciszek

Title: Decrees on Jewish councils settling a dispute between communities in Leszno and Osieczna
Manifest: Rabbis and land elders of Greater Poland gathered in the Jewish regional council in Raszków on November 23, 1680, settled the dispute between the Jewish communities in Leszno and Osieczna regarding the conditions for selling meat in Leszno by Jewish butchers from Osieczna. 1) Jews from Osieczna, after the appropriate oath, were released from the annual fee of 70 zlotys, which they paid in exchange for the right to sell meat in Leszno. 2) Osieczna Jews were allowed to sell meat in Leszno every day except Friday. 3) Leszno Jews were ordered to show a document regulating the sale of meat to Christians at the market in Leszno by Jews from Osieczna. 4) A list of fees was established, which should be paid by Jewish butchers from Osieczna to the Leszno kahal: 6 gr per each half-carcass sold; 2.5 gr per each cattle, for the purpose of a Jewish hospital in Leszno. The annulment of a court fee in the amount of 3 gr per item was promised by land elders to Jews from Osieczna, if the bills submitted by the Jews from Leszno did not show the need to pay such a fee to the local landowner. The land rabbi of Poznań confirmed the provisions of the Raszków decree at the regional council in Zduny on 29 III 1718.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Wschowa castle court files (Księgi grodzkie wschowskie)
Reference Number: APP, Wschowskie Gr. 215, s. 197r-198v

Notes: Tyt.: Oblata decretorum Judaicorum pro parte synagogae Osiecznensis. Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich wschowskich tłumaczenie na jęz. polski 1 III 1753 podali Mosiek Choryński i Józef Falbierz starsi gminy w Osiecznej i Szymon Jakub ławnik tejże gminy.

Title: Decree of the Council of the Four Lands regarding the dispute between the communities of Leżajsk and Tarnogród about the affiliation of lease-holders
Manifest: The tribunal of rabbis during the Council of the Four Lands sitting in Jarosław, settled the dispute concerning the belonging of the leaseholders and innkeepers from the villages of Piskorowice, Tarnawiec, and Brzyska Wola to the benefit of the community in Leżajsk. The arguments of Tarnogród elders that the abovementioned villages, disconnected from Leżajsk and joined to Tarnogród, should pay taxes to this community, were refuted. Two elders of the Leżajsk kahal were obliged to take an oath to prove the affiliation of the unlawfully separated minor kahals. Court judgments issued by the Tarnogród kahal regarding these leaseholders and innkeepers were cancelled. From then on taxes were to be paid according to the disposition of the elder of the Leżajsk kahal.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Przemysl castle court files (Księgi grodzkie przemyskie)

Surnames: Aron Gerszonowicz, Berko Majorowicz, Izak Icik, Jakob, Jakob Szyja, Judka Doktorowicz, Szyja Hesiel
Notes: Tyt.: Oblata decretorum pro parte Judaeorum Lezayscensium. Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich przemyskich tłumaczenie na jęz. polski podali 5 XI 1724 Judka Doktorowicz i Aron Gerszonowicz starsi leżajscy. Por. ibidem, s. 268, 269.

Title: Tax exemption of the Greater Poland Jews for the Jews from Mława
Manifest: The Greater Poland elders, in connection with the costs of building a new synagogue incurred by the Mława Jews, prohibited the community of Maków Mazowiecki from imposing on them and their subordinates the Jewish fees and taxes. In return for confirming the affiliation of its minor communities, the Mława community was obliged to pay the ordinary tariff in accordance with the assessment of the poll tax prepared by the land.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)

Notes:
W aktach grodzkich kaliskich oblatował Marek Abramowicz Mławski starszy mławski w obecności Abrama Dawidowicza syndyka kaliskiego
15 II 1752.

Title: Protective universal of the Sub-chancellor of the Crown Bogusław Leszczyński to the Jews of the Greater Poland voivodeships
Manifest: Bogusław Leszczyński, the sub-chancellor of the Crown and general starost of Greater Poland, in connection with the lawlessness spreading in Greater Poland (an example of which was the murder of several Jews from Leszno) and also the need to provide an income from the poll tax to the treasury, grants protection to the Jews of Greater Poland voivodeships and guarantees safe passage and transportation of goods on roads, including Jewish poll tax collectors.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Castle court files of Gniezno
Reference Number: APP, Gnieźnieńskie Gr. 141, s. 320rv
Notes: Do oblaty w aktach grodzkich gnieźnieńskich podali 28 VI 1659 Samuel Słoma i Jakub Żydzi gnieźnieńscy.

Title: Settlement between Chełm elders and the elders of the Bełz voivodeship aiming at ending their disagreement
Manifest: The elders of Bełz and Chełm made a settlement under the deposit of 100 ducats, according to which the Bełz elders abandoned seeking separation from the land. Because the Bełz elders paid a commission from the amount of 5,500 zlotys to the Bełz Dominican Nuns, they received a relief in poll tax of 150 zlotys. In the case of the tax exemption of 2,000 zlotys it was decided that it will be judged by the court of rabbis of the main cities headed by the rabbi of Bełz. Chełm elders pledged to help the Bełz kahal elders in its disputes with subordinate communities. It was agreed that in order to assess poll tax in the land, the land marshal residing in the land of Chełm would be obliged to summon Bełz elders to come to the designated city 8 days before the set date. In the event of their refusal, the poll tax tariff for the Chełm-Bełz land would also be valid without the signature of Bełz elders. By way of exception, Bełz elders were allowed to have an appraiser at the Jewish council in Jarosław in 1729. Disputes over the poll tax between the Bełz community and the Jews from Jarczów and between the Chełm and Tarnogóra communities were to be judged by land rabbis. In turn, Chełm elders were to settle tax disputes between the Bełz community and the remaining communities of the Bełz voivodeship formed during the Tarnogród Confederation.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Grabowiec castle court files (Księgi grodzkie grabowieckie)
Reference Number: APL, Grabowieckie RMO 118, s. 719-724
Geographical Names: Belz (Bełz), Chełm (Chelm), Hrubieszow (Hrubieszów), Jarczow, Uchanie, Uhnów

Notes: Tyt.: Complanationis certae inter infideles Judaeos Chełmenses et Bełzenses oblata. W księgach grodzkich bełskich 29 VIII 1736 oblatował Moszko Majorowicz.

Title: Deklaracja trybunału radomskiego zabraniająca Żydom koronnym dzierżawy ceł i handlu niektórymi towarami
Manifest: The Radom treasury tribunal forbids Crown Jews to violate statutes and constitutions (of years 1538, 1565, 1667) and the previous treasury resolutions from 1718-1719. The treasury tribunal also forbids Crown Jews to lease customs and to hold offices in customs administration. He also forbids the collection of private customs (per item or passing a bridge or causeway), trade in forbidden goods (wine, horses and oxen), and the use of protection for private purposes.
Archive: The National Archives in Krakow, The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Files of the city of Krakow (Akta miasta Krakowa), Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)

Surnames: Mikułowski Remigiusz, Ulanowski Józef
Notes: Oblatowano w aktach grodzkich poznańskich 1 VII 1721; B: ANKr, AMKr (Consularia Cracoviensia Inscriptiones 1717-1728) 476, s. 893-895. Deklarację trybunału skarbowego radomskiego oblatował w księgach radzieckich krakowskich 21 VII 1721 woźny Józef Ulanowski.

Title: Protestation of Poznań elders and Kalisz land elders regarding the murder of Jewish merchants
Manifest: Jakub Ber and Józef Szocher, Poznań elders, Samuel Jakubowicz, Kalisz land elder, and Lewek, the land syndic of Kalisz, along with the widow Ita and son Daniel from Poznań, protest against peasants and servants from the villages of Jasienna, Duszna, and Dziekanowice, accusing them of murdering two Jewish merchants going to the Gniezno fair on a public road on 1 September 1647.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Castle court files of Gniezno
Reference Number: APP, Gnieźnieńskie Gr. 139, s. 613r-614v.

Notes: Tyt.: Judaeorum protestatio. W aktach grodzkich gnieźnieńskich oblatowano 4 IX 1647.

Title: Protective universal of King Michał Korybut Wiśniowiecki to Crown Jews
Manifest: As a result of the persecution of Jews by some people who spread accusations that Jews were secretly corresponding with enemies of the Commonwealth and acting against the country, King Michał Korybut Wiśniowiecki guarantees personal and property safety to Crown Jews, especially during fairs and markets, and orders Crown clerks to severely punish false informants and the instigators of disorder in accordance with the law and with the Proszowice dietine resolution.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)

Notes: Tyt.: Oblata litterarum SRM pro parte Iudaeorum. Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich poznańskich 9 IX 1673 podał woźny Stanisław Kozłowski.

Title: Universal of Crown Treasurer Jan Andrzej Morsztyn on the poll tax of Crown Jews
Manifest: Grand Crown Treasurer Jan Andrzej Morsztyn informs tax collectors that according to the diet constitution of 1673, Crown Jews are exempted from paying other taxes due to the fact that the Jewish poll tax of 105 thousand zlotys was levied on them. Therefore they shall not pay the general poll tax despite the printed instruction in which they were mentioned as taxpayers according to the 1662 tariff.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)

Title: Resolution of the regional council of the Zamość Entailed Estate
Manifest: The rabbis of the Zamość Entailed Estate gathered at the regional council in Łukowa, called by the widow of the Crown treasurer, Anna Franciszka from Gniński Zamoyska, decided: 1) to set the poll tax and tariff tax charged on Jewish male property owners and married tennants as 30,006 zlotys; 2) to exempt from the poll tax rabbis, their children, and sons-in-law who deal with with usury, cantors, syndics, shamesim, the general scribe, and poor Jews receiving alms; the property tax (symplowy) tax depends on the wealth of the Jews; 3) the poll tax registers will be handed over to the Crown scribe and land scribe; 4) to appoint Irsz, a Zamość Jew as the scribe of the Ordynacja; 5) to approve treasury assignments; 6) to stop the repayment of debts until a settlement through the rabbi of Lviv is reached between the Ordynacja Jews and Jews of the Chełm-Bełz region; 7) to set the date (18 May 1701) of the next regional council to arrange new tariffs; 8) in the period between the councils, the jurisdiction in matters between Jews and elders of the kahal will be carried out by a mixed court consisting of a rabbi and an elder ordained by the main kahals of the Ordynacja and a rabbi representing the defendant community; 9) to determine that the elders can not grant a tax exemption without the council of the rabbis of the Zamość Entailed Estate; 10) to set a weekly allowance for elders and rabbis who came to the regional council from the arrival of the marshal; 11-12) to prohibit rural Jews from evading the payment of tax and cattle slaughter, and to order them to go to the city on holy days; 13) to prohibit Jews from moving to other communitiess without obtaining a certificate on tax payment; 14) to resolve to send deputies to Zamość to obtain confirmation from the heiress and to talk to the scribe.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Sąd Komisarski Zamku Zamojskiego
Reference Number: APL, Sąd Komisarski Zamku Zamojskiego, sygn. 5, s. 22r-25v

Notes: W aktach komisarskich wpisany 15 I 1700.

Title: Ordinance of Grand Crown Treasurer Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski on Kalisz Jews
Manifest: Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski orders deputies with assignations for the Jews of the Poznań and Kalisz poviats to go to land elders for the allocation first and then to collect the tax from the particular communities according to the allocation and not to demand from Kalisz Jews a higher amount than the one included in the allocation.

Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)

Title: Confirmation for the Zamość land elder
Manifest: The Zamość elders confirm the fact that Mendel Chajkowicz was appointed as a land elder [of the Zamość Entailed Estate], that he owned property and a shop in Zamość.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Zamosc Tribunal (APL)

Notes: W księgach Trybunału Zamojskiego oblatował 24 I 1766 Icko Lewkowicz.

Title: Resolution of the Radom treasury tribunal for Crown Jews
Manifest: The Radom treasury tribunal appealed to the provisions of the 1717 constitution and forbade the voivodes to violate the prerogatives of the Crown treasury in matters concerning the Jewish poll tax. He forbade them to designate the place for Jewish councils and to elect rabbis in the communities of their voivodeships.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv, The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Koscian castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kościańskie), Lviv castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lwowskie)

koronnych oblatował 26 VII 1752 w księgach grodzkich kościańskich Lewek Moskowicz Żyd leszczyński, faktor kościański.

Title: Universal of the Ruthenian Voivode August Czartoryski regarding the selection of a new Ruthenian trustee
Manifest: In connection with a vacancy in the office of the trustee of Jews of the Ruthenian province, not occupied since the death of Marek Rabinowicz, Ruthenian Voivode August Aleksander Czartoryski, orders Ruthenian Jews to choose a successor to Rabinowicz during this year’s convention, reserving for himself the right to confirm the future elect.

Srokowski.

Title: Universal of Jan Kazimierz to Crown Jews regarding money for an envoy to Turkey
Manifest: King Jan Kazimierz orders Crown Jews to pay immediately the assignation of 6 thousand zlotys to Colonel Sebastian Machowski, the Commonwealth’s envoy to Turkey. Otherwise, they will be punished and their property confiscated.

Title: Universal of Jan III Sobieski on the settlement of the tax bills of Jews from Bełz voivodeship
Manifest: King Jan III Sobieski orders Ruthenian rabbis from Zhovkva, Lviv, and Dubno, acting as arbitrators, and his factor Chona Markowicz to appear with the delegates from Jewish communities (two elders from each town) at the appointed place to settle and arrange the tax bills of Jews from the Bełz voivodeship and at the same time to reduce tax for the poorest.

Title: Letter of Adam Mikołaj Sieniawski to Jan Władysław Wyrozębski regarding the community in Międzyrzec Podlaski
Manifest: Adam Mikołaj Sieniawski, the grand hetman of the Crown, the heir of Międzyrzec Podlaski, indicates in a letter to the royal prosecutor and fiscal commissar Jan Władysław Kunath-Wyrozębski, that his Międzyrzec Jews were classified by a clerical error as belonging to the Podlasie land and not to the Zamość Enatiled Estate. Therefore, he claimed, the assignation amounting to 6,000 zlotys which was received by the tax commissioner was erroneously issued by the Lviv commission. He demands that the amount mentioned in the assignation be transferred to Podlasie Jews for payment.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Archiwum Woronieckich z Huszlowa

Title: Declaration of Wulf Pietruszka against Heszel Majorowicz regarding the failure to resign from the office of the scribe
Manifest: Wulf Pietruszka, Hrubieszów elder and delegate to the regional council of all communities in the Bełz voivodeship and Chełm region, declares against the previous scribe of the Chełm Jews’ council, Heszel Majorowicz, whom he accuses of holding the office of the Chełm-Bełz scribe for 10 years against the principle of alternation. He also protests againts the sum of 70 zlotys, which the communities of the Bełz voivodeship pay annually to the communities of the Zamość Entailed Estate.

Title: Summons to the treasury tribunal for the Ostróg kahal
Manifest: The nobles of the Kiev voivodeship are suing the Ostróg kahal in the Radom treasury tribunal regarding the excessive tax burden on the voivodeship’s Jews, demanding that they be excluded from the Ostróg jurisdiction and the creation of a separate land of the Kiev voivodeship.

Title: Resolution of the Jewish council in Nowe Miasto and an acknowledgement for Jewish elders
Manifest: The Greater Poland elders gathered at the regional council have determined the amount of tax for each community and have decided that all deputy assignations without signature, above the amount established at the regional council, are invalid. They also stated that if the representatives of Kalisz and Krotoszyn tried to issue assignations without the signatures of representatives of other cities, it was allowed to appeal to the protection of the castle authority. A poll tax receipt document for Złotów elders for the years 1694-1697 was attached.

Title: Decree of the Chełm-Bełz elders, settling the dispute between the Maciejów and Luboml communities for the supply of etrog
Manifest: Chełm-Bełz elders at the regional council in Hrubieszów issued a decree regarding the refusal to receive the annual supply of etrog from the Luboml kahal by the Maciejów kahal as well as avoiding the payment of dues owed to the main community. The community of Maciejów under the threat of a curse cast by the elders of Luboml was obliged to pay for the agreed deliveries and pay all its debts.

Title: Declaration of Krotoszyn Jews against Greater Poland land elders
Manifest: IIciek Lewek and the Syndic Lewek Salamon, elders of Krotoszyn, come out against the Greater Poland land elders and especially Marshal Józef Lewkowicz in the matter of issuing an allocation without the signature of Krotoszyn elders, in violation of old laws according to which the allocation should be signed by the elders of three communities: Leszno, Krotoszyn, and Kalisz, and, in addition, regarding the encumbrance of Krotoszyn Jews with 3,000 zlotys. Józef Lewkowicz is additionally accused of occupying the marshal’s office and blocking other candidates, contrary to law and custom.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)

Surnames: Iciek Lewek, Józef Lewkowicz, Lewek Salamon

Title: Approval of the consent for rabbi of Płock, Icek Lewkowicz, by the Greater Poland elders
Manifest: The elders of Greater Poland prolong for the coming years the consent of Icek Lewkowicz, the rabbi of Sierpc, for the rabbinate of Płock. Jews from Płock and neighbouring towns were ordered to be completely obedient to him under the penalty of a curse. They confirm the earlier consent issued in 1714 during the land council in Koźmin.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 329, s. 156v, 159r
Geographical Names: Kalisz, Kozmin (Koźmin), Krotoszyn, Leszno, Poznan (Poznań), Płock

Title: Settlement between Ruthenian land elders and the Świrz rabbi regarding the land marshal’s term of office
Manifest: Marshals of the Ruthenian lands at the council in Krupiec in the presence of the general marshal and Crown elders made a settlement with Pinkas Abrahamowicz, the rabbi of Świrz and a Jew from Zhovkva, under which the current marshals Berek Rabinowicz and Joś Lejbowicz were to hold the office of land marshals for three years, and after this time they should invite the Świrz rabbi to participate and govern together with them. In the event of the death of one of them or departure for another city, the office of the marshal should be held by two Jewish delegates, one from Zhovkva and the other from Brody. Jewish councils should be called in order to establish the poll tax assessment every other year in the different estates owned by local magnates.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Busk castle court files (Księgi grodzkie buskie)
Reference Number: CDIAL, Fond 3, op. 1, sp. 34, s. 529-531
Surnames: Abramek, Berko Rabinowicz, Herszko Bekowicz, Joś Lejbowicz, Pinkas Abramowicz, Radziwiłł Michał Kazimierz
Notes: Tyt.: Complanationis infidelium Pinsach atque Herszko Berkowicz oblata. W aktach grodzkich buskich tłumaczenie na jęz. polski oblatowali 16 VI 1752 Pinkas Abramowicz rabin świrski i Herszko Berkowicz syn Berka Rabinowicza marszałka województwa ruskiego

Title: Summons to the Bełz sub-voivode court for Busk kahal elders as a result of failure to pay a salary to the sub-voivode
Manifest: Due to the unpaid annual salary (the so-called annuata) for the Bełz subvoivode, the Bełz Voivode Antoni Michał Potocki summoned Busk elders to appear on 5 February 1733 in the Bełz sub-voivode court or in front of a Bełz Jewish judge to pay the overdue sum together with a fine. The voivode assumes that the Busk kahal, by refusing to pay the salary to the sub-voivode, included in the allocation prepared by the elders of Bełz kahal, deviated from the authority of the Bełz voivodeship elders.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Busk castle court files (Księgi grodzkie buskie)
Reference Number: CDIAL, Fond 3, op. 1, sp. 30, s. 331, 332
Surnames: Moszko Wulfowicz, Potocki Antoni Michał
Notes: Tyt.: Synagoga Buscensis per Bełzensem citatur. Relacja położenia pozwu w domu starszego buskiego Moszka Wulfowicza w aktach grodzkich buskich 5 II 1733.

Title: Correspondence of the elders of the Volhyn voivodeship and the elders of Łuck and Mielnica kahals with the Kowel kahal
Manifest:
1) The elders of the Volhyn voivodeship order the leaseholders from the village of Hołoby to obey the kahal and the rabbi of Kowel. They oblige them to conduct their services and other religious practices in the Kowel synagogue and to pay taxes through the Kowel community, and they forbid them to move under the threat of a curse under the suzerainty of the communities in Łuck and Mielnica.
2) The elders of the Łuck kahal confirm the right of the Kowel kahal to rule over the leaseholders of the village of Hołoby and their exclusive competence to collect taxes and other contributions.
3) In response to a letter from the kahal of Kowel and a letter from the provincial elders to the kahal elders in Mielnica attached to that letter, the elders of the kahal in Mielnica state that they are unable to supervise the leaseholders of the village of Hołoby, who recognise the authority of various kahals and celebrate services and Jewish holidays in the various communities according to their needs. The Mielnica elders willingly enter into an agreement with the provincial elders and accept the leaseholders of the village of Hołoby only with their knowledge and written consent and on the conditions specified by the Kowel kahal and the senior rabbis of the Volhyn province.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)
Reference Number: CDIAK, Fond 28, op. 1, sp. 170, s. 719r-720v
Geographical Names: Dubno, Kovel, Kremenets, Lutsk, Mielnica (Volhynia), Volodymyr-Volynsky (Włodzimierz Wołyński)
Notes: Tyt.: Oblata kopii trzech z hebrajskiego pisma na polskie, jak się w sobie mieli przetłumaczonych, pierwszej od rabinów starszych synagogi wołyńskiej, drugiej od rabina i starszych kahału łuckiego, trzeciej od kantora i wiernika miasta Mielnicy wyrażających w sobie moc i władzę układania wszelkich podatków do skarbu Rzeczypospolitej należących. Tłumaczenia na jęz. polski w księgach grodzkich włodzimierskich oblatował 5 V 1751 Pejsach Enochowicz starszy kahału kowelskiego.

Title: Protest of a Sochaczew Jew against the Greater Poland elders regarding avoiding the payment of debt
Manifest: Jakub Naselewicz, a Jew from Sochachew, protests against the Greater Poland elders, especially those from Kalisz, regarding the fact that they are reluctant to repay the money owed to him, which he paid for the authorities of the land for the purpose of paying taxes. First, they exposed him to costs, forcing him to settle accounts in Borkow with the participation of the Poznań rabbi, and then they did not appear in Przygodzice with the elders from other cities.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 306, s. 371, 372
Surnames: Jakub Naselewicz
Notes: Hebrew signature.

Title: Assurance of Lejba, rabbi of Krzemieniec, to the Jews of Kowel
Manifest: Lejba, the rabbi of Krzemieniec, announces that he has undertaken to fulfil the duties of the Volhyn trustee. He promises the Kowel kahal elders that he will not issue assignments to the Kowel community or to its villages, and in particular add financial arrears to other Volhyn communities without their consent expressed by their signature, according to the allocation of Volhyn Jews.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)
Reference Number: CDIAK, Fond 28, op. 1, sp. 155, s. 607r-608r
Surnames: Lejba, Zuszman Wulfowicz
Notes: Oblatował w aktach grodzkich włodzimierskich 15 IX 1733 Zuszman Wulfowicz obywatel kowelski.

Title: Letters of magnates to Abraham Izaak Fortis
Manifest: Entry of three letters of magnates to Isaac Fortis with a warning and threats, in which they demand that he resign from competing for the office of the marshal of Crown Jews and stop violating the laws and old customs to the detriment of the land elders of Chełm and Bełz.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Grabowiec castle court files (Księgi grodzkie grabowieckie)
Reference Number: APL, Grabowieckie RMO 114, s. 1330-1332, Grabowieckie RMO 263, akta luźne, s. 226rv
Surnames: Izaak Fortis, Kopel, Potocki  Michał, Potocki Józef, Potocki Stanisław Władysław, Rzewuski Stanisław Mateusz
Notes: Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich grabowieckich podał arendarz grabowiecki Kopel 25 IV 1725.

Title: Privilege of Treasurer Karol Sedlnicki for the office of the general scribe of the Bełz voivodeship and the Chełm land
Manifest: Accepting the settlement concluded by Crown elders in Radom, Grand Crown Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki appoints to the office of general scribe (trustee) of the Bełz voivodeship and the Chełm land Wulf Pietruszka, a Hrubieszów Jew and the Witków rabbi, representing the Bełz voivodeship. After the death of the current scribe, Heszel of Chełm, his function was to be performed alternately with Dawid, a Zamość Jew. The scribe’s term of office began with the Jewish congress in Konstantynów. Dawid of Zamość, delegated by Jews from the Zamość Entailed Estate, was to hold the office after Wulf Pietruszka.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Belz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie bełskie)

Notes: Tyt.: Instrumenti certi oblata. W księgach grodzkich bełskich oblatował 16 VIII 1751 Ejzyk Józefowicz.

Title: Declaration of Abraham Józef, the marshal of the Crown Jews, against the Crown metricant
Manifest: Abraham Józef, a Jew from Leszno, and the marshal of Crown Jews, declares against Ignacy Ludwik Nowicki, the prefect of the Crown sub-chancellery in the case of his claim against Crown Jews, in which he charged them with the nonpayment of 1,000 ducats on the basis of a script received in 1739 at the Jewish council from elders through Commissioner Działyński and transferred to the Treasurer Jan Ansgary Czapski. Czapski did not have any financial grievances and promised to return the script, but because of his death he never did. On the other hand, Nowicki had an unfounded claim against the elders and made a settlement with Jakub Icik, the Jewish scribe in Kraków, acting without the authorisation of the marshal and the elders. The marshal attests to the invalidity of Nowicki’s claims and the settlement made with him.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Koscian castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kościańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kościańskie Gr. 174, s. 110r-111r
Surnames: Abraham Józef, Czapski Jan Ansgary, Działyński Jakub, Jakub Icik, Nowicki Ignacy Ludwik, Łagodziński Jan Franciszek
Notes: Tyt.: Infidelis Judaeus Abraham mareschalcus Judaicus contra generosum Nowicki manifestatur.

Title: Universal of Crown Treasurer Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski on the conflict between the Jews of the land of Chełm-Bełz and the Jews of the land of Zamość
Manifest: Grand Crown Treasurer Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski responded to the complaint of Chełm and Bełz land elders on the separation from the land of Jews living in the Zamość Entailed Estate and the necessity of establishing tax dues. Lubomirski orders both sides to appoint two delegates each and one arbitrator to solve the existing disagreements.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Grabowiec castle court files (Księgi grodzkie grabowieckie)
Reference Number: APL, Grabowieckie RMO 102, s. 226, 227

Tags: ugoda, uniwersał, ziemstwo chełmsko-bełskie, ziemstwo ordynacji zamojskiej

Title: Universal of King Jan III Sobieski for Crown Jews
Manifest: King Jan III Sobieski exempts Crown Jews from paying the merchant’s donativum and taxes passed at land dietines as a result of introducing the Jewish poll tax of 105 thousand zlotys and a one-time extraordinary hiberna tax of 50 thousand zlotys for maintaining the army. If they refuse to pay the taxes passed by the diet, they must not be protected by landlords and clergy. Moreover, he confirms the following legal acts: a) the Constitution of 1685 guaranteeing Jews and their merchandise safety on the roads and during markets and fairs; and b) the Constitution of 1679 forbidding magistrates to sue Jews in courts with no jurisdiction over them. He rules that the Jewish community is not responsible for private Jewish debts.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie), Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)

Notes: Published: Żydowski samorząd ziemski w Koronie (XVII -XVIII wiek). Źródła, wstęp i oprac. A. Kaźmierczyk, P. Zarubin, Księgarnia Akademicka, Kraków 2019, pp. 138-140.

Title: Nomination privilege of Antoni Lubomirski establishing Abraham Chaimowicz as the land marshal of Lublin
Manifest: Antoni Lubomirski, the voivode of Lublin, grants the Jew Abram Chaimowicz from Lublin the function of land marshal of the Lublin voivodeship Jews, confirming his right to judge and to manage income until the next term of office.

Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)

Title: Declaration of Bełz land elder against other land elders
Manifest: Ajzyk Józefowicz, a Bełz land elder, declares against the Land Elders Szmujło of Chełm and Herszko of Luboml that, contrary to the Tribunal decree, they made an allocation without his signature as Bełz land elder; he also comes out against the usurpation of the marshal’s title.

Fond: Belz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie bełskie)

Title: Asekuracja starszych drohobyckich dla urzędników grodzkich lwowskich
Manifest: Starsi drohobyccy zobowiązują się do zapłacenia Wojciechowi Łosiowi chorążemu sanockiemu, rotmistrzowi JKM, sędziemu grodzkiemu lwowskiemu i Stanisławowi Korytkowi podczaszemu czernihowskiemu, pisarzowi grodzkiemu lwowskiemu, że ewentualnie zapłacą 24 VI 1715 r. 800 złp z ich pogłównego żydowskiego, które naznaczył Jan Jerzy Przebendowski podskarbi wielki koronny asygnacją we Lwowie z dn. 30 I 1715 r. Ponieważ starsi drohobyccy uważają, że zostali pokrzywdzeni w ostatnim dyspartymencie starszych ziemskich uprosili poborcę Franciszka Celińskiego, aby wstrzymał się z egzekucją podatku do św. Jana Chrzciciela [24 VI], w tym czasie zamierzali starać się o ulgę podczas kongresu starszych, gdyby zaś jej nie otrzymali, zobowiązali się uiścić kwotę wyrażoną w pierwotnej asygnacji.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Lviv castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lwowskie)

Title: Pozew do trybunału skarbowego radomskiego dla Berka Rabinowicza oraz innych starszych ziemskich
Manifest: Anszel Lejbowicz, Oszyja Moszkowicz z Drohobycza, Icko Szmujłowicz i Wolio Herszkowicz z Doliny, Nota Nohymowicz z Rożniatowa, starsi gmin żydowskich z dóbr posiadanych przez Wacława Rzewuskiego wojewodę podolskiego, hetmana polnego koronnego, starostę chełmskiego, dolińskiego, łanowieckiego pozywają do trybunału skarbowego radomskiego Berka Rabinowicza oraz Icka Brodzkiego, Borucha Mendlowicza, Pinkasa Chaimowicza i innych starszych odpowiedzialnych za ustanowienie taryfy podatków synagog województwa ruskiego w sprawie nadmiernego obciążenia swoich gmin.

Title: Pozwy do Komisji Skarbu Koronnego dla starszych ziemskich ruskich z oskarżenia Ossolińskiego wojewody wołyńskiego
Manifest: [Józef] Ossoliński wojewoda wołyński pozywa do sądu Komisji Ekonomicznej Skarbu Koronnego  Berka Rabinowicza marszałka Żydów województwa ruskiego i pisarza generalnego starszych, Josyfa Ickowicza  rabina i starszego kahału żółkiewskiego, Icka Moniuszewicza starszego ziemskiego lwowskiego oraz wszystkie kahały i całe pospólstwo żydowskie w województwie ruskim w sprawie spłacenia dwóch kwot dłużnych 20 000 i 4000 złp wraz z prowizjami 10% rocznie.

Title: Universal of Crown Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki, ordering Jews of the Ruthenian poviat to convene a congress
Manifest: In response to numerous complaints from Ruthenian communities dissatisfied with an excessive tax burden, Grand Crown Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki instructs Ruthenian land elders to convene a new congress to arrange a new sympla (general allocation). The individual kahals are obliged to send their own appraisers.

Notes: Tyt.: Illustris M[agnifici]. Odrowąż thesaurarii Regni universalis oblata. W księgach grodzkich buskich oblatował 8 VI 1753 Fajbisz Abramowicz.

Title: Confirmation of the decree of the land rabbi and the Greater Poland land elders regarding the dispute between the rabbi of Kcynia and the local kahal
Manifest: Naftali ha-Kohen, the land rabbi of Poznań, and the Greater Poland elders during the regional council of the land of Greater Poland in Osieczna (1702), confirm the decree issued in the previous year regarding the matter between the Kcynia kahal and the local rabbi. They recognize that the Kcynia kahal should pay the rabbi 600 zlotys of the amount of debt and cover his procedural costs (100 zlotys) and pay him the outstanding annual rabbi’s salary for the years 1701-1702 (the so-called jurgielt).
