Notes: Tłumaczenie na jęz. polski do akt grodzkich poznańskich podał 20 VI 1702 Lewek Salamon Żyd poznański (wraz z dekretem z 5 IX 1701 i atestacją o wykonanej przysiędze).

Title: Ordinance of Treasurer Jan Jerzy Przebendowski on poll tax deputies for the Jews of Greater Poland
Manifest: Grand Crown Treasurer Jan Jerzy Przebendowski recommends treasury assignation holders not to force the issuing of special allocations but to use those which were issued by the land scribe. He decides on the size of the delegation (3 horses) and of the costs they could demand from Jews: 30 zlotys per day and 1 grosz from every paid zloty. Moreover, he gives his protection to the Jewish land scribe and he confirms that the Jewish land scribe is granted immunity.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 316, s. 140rv
Surnames: Iciek Kuśnierz, Mienta Fabian, Przebendowski Jan Jerzy
Notes: W księgach grodzkich kaliskich oblatował 6 V 1710 Iciek Kuśniarz Żyd kaliski.

Title: Declaration of Poznań elders against the land elders of Poznań and Kalisz on the election of the land rabbi
Manifest: The elders of the Poznań kahal declare against the elders of the Poznań and Kalisz voivodeships due to their postponement of the election of the Greater Poland land rabbi and so also of the rabbi of Poznań in spite of the mandates of the Poznań and Kalisz voivodes, thus exposing the Poznań community to losses caused by the lack of a rabbi.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)

Notes: Hebrew signatures.

Title: Universal of Bełz Starost Franciszek Salezy Potocki on the equality of Chełm and Bełz land elders
Manifest: Franciszek Salezy Potocki, Bełz starost, with the consent of Antoni Michał Potocki, Bełz voivode, issues a universal due to instances of disobeying the decision of Grand Crown Treasurer Jan Jerzy Przebendowski, from September 18, 1724, by Chełm land elders. In that decision Przebendowski ordered that an equal number of elders be appointed by Jews from the Bełz voivodeship and the Chełm land to participate in land councils. During the Crown Jews’ councils, Jews from the Chełm-Bełz land should be alternately represented by a Chełm or Bełz elder and trustee.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Belz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie bełskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 1, op. 1, sp. 324, s. 724, 725
Surnames: Hulewicz Ludwik, Potocki  Franciszek Salezy, Potocki Antoni Michał, Przebendowski Jan Jerzy
Notes: W aktach grodzkich bełskich 17 IX 1735 oblatował Ludwik Hulewicz.

Title: Privilege of protection of the Halicz Starost Józef Potocki for the Karaites of Halicz
Manifest: Considering the influx of Karaites to the destroyed Halicz, Józef Potocki, Kiev voivode and Halicz starost, orders the land elders of Ruthenia to take care of the Karaites and to not let them be sued in Halicz voivodeship court but only in starost court. He also forbids the Jews of Halicz to extend their supremacy over local Karaites, and he gives the Karaites his protection from charges of extraordinary taxes.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Halych castle court files (Księgi grodzkie halickie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 5, op. 1, sp. 246, s. 1361, 1362

Notes: Tyt.: Litterarum libertationis a Potocki in rem Caraimirum Halicensium emanatum oblata. Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich halickich 12 VIII 1741 podał karaimski kupiec Samuel Józefowicz.

Title: Settlement between the Chełm and Bełz elders and elders of Zamość Entailed Estate
Manifest: Plenipotentiaries of the Chełm-Bełz land and Zamość Entailed Estate on the basis of the ruling of arbitration court in Piaski of May 21, 1721, established that the entailed estate Jews should pay 360 zlotys, while the Chełm and Bełz Jews should pay 640 zlotys for every one thousand zlotys in tax. Towns appropriated by the Chełm and Bełz land, i.e. Biłgoraj, Krasnobród, Modliborzyce, Pilaszkowice, Gorzków, and Łaszczów are to return to the estate and be recognized in its assessment of poll tax. In the case of Sieniawa, evidence was ordered to prove that it was subordinate to Tarnogród two years before the separation of the estate from the Chełm-Bełz region. The parties were also supposed to settle their accounts during the Jewish council in Ryczywół in 1722 from the wyderkauf (purchase of annuity) debts contracted by the communities, commissions paid to the creditors, and other obligations. Depending on which side took over particular communities, wyderkauf debts were added to the poll tax tariff of one of the parties. Accordingly, the tariff for the other party was reduced by this amount. The land elders or the elders of Zamość Entailed Estate could be punished with a fine of 100 ducats and the loss of seniority for non-compliance with the settlement.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Horodlo castle court files (Księgi grodzkie horodelskie)
Reference Number: APL, Horodelskie RMO 43, s. 1032-1035

Title: Copy of a letter from the Crown Treasury to the Tax Commissioner for the Jewish Assembly in Pilica
Manifest: A copy of the letter, probably by the Crown Treasury scribe, to the Crown Treasury Commissioner for the Jewish Assembly in Pilica concerning the Jews from Końskowola and the leaseholders from Puławy and Włostowice. Because of the intervention of the voivode of Ruthenia, August Czartoryski, to the Crown Treasurer concerning his Jews, he recommends the Commissioner not to accept the tax tariffs according to which the Czartoryski’s Jews would have to pay the poll tax for the army, and he also recommends to warn the elders not to raise the amount of the tax.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Potockich z Radzynia
Reference Number: AGAD, Arch. Potockich z Radzynia 570
Surnames: Czartoryski August, Wessel Teodor

Title: Resolution of Jan III on taxes and safety of Crown Jews
Manifest: King Jan III orders Crown Jews to pay only Jewish poll tax in the amount of 105 thousand zlotys in current coin as it is written in the diet constitution, and he exempts them from paying other commitments established on noble dietines. He confirms that in criminal and civil cases they are under the jurisdiction of voivodeship courts, and they can appeal to court of assessors. As for safety, he orders municipal authorities to prevent anti-Jewish riots, and if they happen, to catch participants in those incidents and take them to castle courts for judgment and punishment.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv, Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv, The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Belz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie bełskie), Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie), Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)

Title: Protest of Łachman Moszkowicz against Tewel Fiszlowicz, the Łokacze rabbi, and his sons
Manifest: Łachman Moszkowicz, a Jew from Kowel, protested against Tewel Fiszlowicz, the Łokacze rabbi and former trustee of the Volhyn region, and his sons Gerszon and Wol, who in agreement with the Dominicans from Targowica and in an attempt to recover their debt from the Kowel kahal (based on Tewel’s illegal assignation), attacked him on the road from the Jewish council in Dubno, confiscated his horse, humiliated him, caused his permanent disability, and finally imprisoned him in a monastery prison.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 28, op. 1, sp. 152, s. 483v-484v
Surnames: Gerszon Teweleowicz, Tewel Fiszlowicz, Wol Tewelowicz, Łachman Moszkowicz

Title: Declaration of Szowel Jakubowicz, the general scribe of Volhyn Jews, regarding suspicions about making an unfair allocation of poll tax
Manifest: Refuting the charges of minor communities and Jewish settlements from the Volhyn region regarding poll tax overestimation, Szowel Jakubowicz, the rabbi of Włodzimierz and the general scribe of the Crown and Volhyn Jews, justifies himself and Lejba Szmojłowicz, the rabbi of Krzemieniec and second general scribe of the Volhyn Jews. Jakubowicz referred to the general instruction for general scribes [trustees] and an earlier declaration of 30 March 1741, stressing that the competence of general scribes is only to allocate the general (flat-rate) amount of poll tax for the main cities of Volhyn, i.e. Ostróg, Włodzimierz, Łuck, Krzemieniec, Dubno, and Kowel, because the detailed allocation of the tax amount per individual villages was carried out without the intervention of general scribes, by elders from appropriate superior kahals, to whom it is precisely where the aggrieved Jews should address their claims. As an additional argument for his innocence, he cites an example from 1748, when the allocated amount of Jewish poll tax for 1749 was collected by the elders of Włodzimierz Wołyński from their villages and with the consent of the general scribes, without their countersignature. The amount was sent directly to the Crown treasury.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 28, op. 1, sp. 168, s. 316v-317r
Geographical Names: Dubno, Kovel, Kremenets, Lutsk, Ostroh (Ostróg), Volodymyr-Volynsky (Włodzimierz Wołyński)
Surnames: Lejba Szmojłowicz, Szowel Jakubowicz

Title: Decree of the Crown Treasury Commissioner Kazimierz Granowski regarding the dispute between Jews in Komarów and the kahal in Tyszowce
Manifest: The Crown Treasury Commissioner Kazimierz Granowski examined the case between Jews from the newly founded city of Komarów belonging to Michał Wielhorski, the Sielec starost, and the rabbi and elders from the community of Tyszowce, who imposed the Jewish poll tax on innkeepers from the hereditary villages of the noblemen, i.e. on Brzozowa Wola and Księżostany. Referring to the verdict of the Radom treasury tribunal of June 9, 1751, and the resolution of Grand Crown Treasurer Karol Sedlnicki of August 17, 1751, the commissioner ordered the Jews of Komarów to pay the Jewish poll tax in the amount of 60 zlotys for 10 years to the Tyszowce kahal, and after that period in accordance with the new tax allocation established by the Bełz community. He ordered the elder of Komarów to take an oath before the castle court of Grabowiec, to assure that the leaseholders from Brzozowa Wola and Księżostany were contributing to the poll tax imposed on the Jews of Komarów. He also confirmed the sovereignty of the Tyszowce and Zamość communities over the Jews of Zubowice, Dub, Siemnice, Śniatycze, Wólka Śniatycka, Dzierążnia, Łabunie, and Wólka Łabuńska. For the loss of jurisdiction over Jews from Księżostany and Brzozowa Wola, he obliged the Jews of Komarów to pay the Tyszowce rabbi 30 zlotys of annual compensation and also abolished mutual financial claims.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Grabowiec castle court files (Księgi grodzkie grabowieckie)
Reference Number: APL, Grabowieckie RMO 235, akta luźne, s. 514r-515r
Geographical Names: Derazhnia, Dub, Jarosław, Komarów, Konstantynów, Księżostany, Radom, Tyszowce, Wolica Brzozowa, Zamosc
Surnames: Granowski Kazimierz, Krajewski Józef, Lejbka Moszkowicz, Mendel Abramowicz, Rostkowski, Sedlnicki Karol Odrowąż, Wielhorski Michał
Notes: Oblatowany w księgach grodzkich grabowieckich 2 XI 1753 przez Lejbkę Moszkowicza starszego komarowskiego.

Title: Declaration of Berko Rabinowicz regarding his resignation of the office of the Ruthenian land marshal
Manifest: Icko Abramowicz, on the authority of Berko Rabinowicz, a Brody Jew and Ruthenian land marshal and general scribe of the Crown Jews, declares that although his principal was elected for another term of office of the marshal of the Ruthenian land, he resigned from the office in 1755 and presented the accounts for the previous term before the commissioners and Jews.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Busk castle court files (Księgi grodzkie buskie)

Surnames: Berek Rabinowicz, Icko Abramowicz

Title: Letter of Józef Potocki, voivode of Kiev, regarding the election of the land elders in Brody
Manifest: Józef Potocki, voivode of Kiev, changes his previous disposition of June 27, 1724 (in which he ordered an election of land elders directly after the customary election of kahal elders); confirms the position of the current land elders, Jakowka and Marek Rabinowicz; and allows the election of land elders to be conducted according to the old custom.

Title: Privilege of August II on factorship for the Poznań land rabbi, Naftali Izaakowicz
Manifest: King August II Wettin announces the Poznań Land Rabbi Naftali Izaakowicz as royal court factor and confirms Izaakowicz’s judicial competence as the highest Jewish judge. He releases him from the jurisdiction of all court instances (including Jewish councils), except those of royal courts and the courts of the grand marshal of the Crown and the grand marshal of Lithuania. He guarantees Izaakowicz safety during Crown and Lithuania diets and dietines. Izaakowicz is free to settle in royal towns.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Poznańskie Gr. 817, s. 16r-17r
Surnames: August II Wettyn, Benedykt  Markowicz, Naftali ben Icchak Kohen
Notes: Tyt.: Oblata privilegii pro Naphtalef Izaakowicz. Do akt grodzkich poznańskich podał 3 lub 4 IX 1698 Benedykt (Baruch) Markowicz syndyk poznański. Na s. 14v, 15r znajduje się oblata łacińskiej wersji przywileju.

Title: Resolution of the commissioners’ court in the treasury tribunal on tax relief for Crown Jews
Manifest: The commissioners’ court of the treasury tribunal in Lviv promises Crown Jews to grant them a tax relief when they prove that they have been fiscally overcharged but at the same time orders them to pay current treasury assignments.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Acta terrestria Lwoviensia (Fond 10)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 10, op. 1, sp. 260, s. 1490, 1491
Notes: Tyt.: Deklaracyja Żydom koronnym. W księgach ziemskich lwowskich oblatowano 30 III 1708.

Title: Supplement to the voivode’s instruction for the Jewish council of the Podole voivodeship
Manifest: The Jewish council of the Podole voivodeship is to be convened in the voivode’s land in June or July. The term of land marshal elected by the land elders lasts 3 years. The general rabbi pays the voivode a one-time fee (60 to 110 ducats) for the privilege he received. He also pays his officials (sub-voivode and judge 22 ducats each). For example, the elected general rabbi paid 100 ducats to the treasury of the voivode Humiecki for consent. The land elders send the allocation of the poll tax to the Crown treasury only through the voivode. The general allocation (sympla) for the communities of the Podole voivodeship was raised from 6,000 zlotys to 13,086 zlotys due to adding the different expenditures of the Ruthenian land (which was temporarily joined to the Podole land). Annual salaries paid by land Jews to officials (after the New Year) have been also agreed upon: voivode – 2000 zlotys, sub-voivode and judge – 400 zlotys each, secretary – 100 zlotys.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Archive of Lanckoronski family (fond 181)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 181, op. 2, sp. 991, s. 13r-14r
Surnames: Humiecki Stefan Kazimierz, Sieniawski Adam Mikołaj
Tags: sejmik żydowski, ziemstwo podolskie, ziemstwo ruskie

Title: Universal of the Podole voivode on a Jewish council
Manifest: The Podole voivode calls Podole land elders to come to an upcoming council in Sołobkowce to prepare a proportional allocation of the poll tax and to work on the land budget. During the council the last year’s land income and expenditures were supposed to be settled and the treasury assignation payment checked. The voivode declared his approval of both the previous and newly elected general rabbi at the office. A commissioner was to be appointed to watch the land council resolutions. Those land elders who would not participate in the council could lose their offices for life. If the delegates did not come to the council, the poll tax tariff could not be challenged by their kahals.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Archive of Lanckoronski family (fond 181)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 181, op. 2, sp. 991, s. 8v, 9r.
Surnames: Humiecki Stefan

Title: Declaration on behalf of the Żmigród kahal against the Kraków-Sandomierz land elders
Manifest:
Jan Strzałkowski, the steward of the Żmigród estate of Michał Kazimierz Radziwiłł, the voivode of Vilnius, declares on behalf of the Żmigród kahal against the Kraków-Sandomierz land elders in connection with their breach of the contract concluded in Radom between them and the Żmigród kahal and presents
the amount of 1250 zlotys representing half of the Żmigród kahal’s dues.

Title: Universal of Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki on improving the execution of the treasury assignation
Manifest:
Grand Crown Treasurer Karol Józef Odrowąż Sedlnicki forbids elders of the Crown’s kahals entitled to prepare allocations to include insolvent and unknown towns in the allocations, and he sets the minimum limit for the required tax from each of these towns to 30 zlotys. Deputies of the Crown army are obliged
to collect money based on assignations issued by the quarter treasury, which specifies the Jewish towns to which the deputies should go. If collecting the tax in a town was impossible or there were no Jews there, the deputies could request the amount from general trustees and land elders.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)

Title: Rescript of King Jan III Sobieski repealing the universal against the elders of Bełz voivodeship and Chełm land
Manifest: After new circumstances came to light, King Jan III Sobieski overrules the universal published by Crown chancellery that ordered the rabbis and elders of the Bełz voivodeship and Chełm land to resign and to verify the land’s bills upon the request of Chona Markowicz. He orders the communities in the Bełz voivodeship and Chełm land, represented by Chona Markowicz and those represented by elders and rabbis, to settle at the next Council of the Four Lands in Jarosław. Until then he orders the elders and rabbis, whom he confirms in their offices, to gather at the council in Hrubieszów and to choose two delegates for the Council of the Four Lands.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Grabowiec castle court files (Księgi grodzkie grabowieckie)

Notes:
Tyt.: Ex parte Judaeorum palatinatus Belzensis litterarum universalium oblata. W aktach grodzkich grabowieckich oblatował 13 VIII 1680 Icko
Żyd chełmski w imieniu swoim oraz starszych kahałów województwa bełskiego i ziemi chełmskiej.

Title: Summons to the Radom treasury tribunal for the elders of Chełm and Bełz from Busk Jews
Manifest: Busk Jews, represented by the community Elder Pinkas Kałuski, are suing the land elders of Chełm and Bełz as well as the elder of the Witków community in the treasury tribunal in Radom due to the excessive burden imposed on them at Jewish councils. i.e., a higher than usual rate of poll tax which did not correspond to the former treasury assignations. As the basis of their suit, Busk Jews claimed that the villages separated from their community (Kutkorz, Ostrowiec, Niesłuchów, Żelechów, Milatyn, Firlejówka, and Pietrycze) were not included in their allocation, so they did not intend to pay contributions for them; they demanded compensation or a financial discount.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin

Title: Declaration on behalf of the Ruthenian land elders against the imprisonment of the marshal of the Ruthenian land
Manifest: Moszko Jankielewicz, a Jew from Brody, on the authority of Berko Rabinowicz and Joś Lejbowicz, marshals of the Ruthenian land, declares against Rogulski, the commissioner of Eustachy Potocki, the Crown cupbearer and the Tłumacz starost, on the illegal imprisonment of Berko Rabinowicz first in Radzyń in violation of the Sabbath day and then in Kurów and forcing him to sign an obligation in accordance with which 1) Berko Rabinowicz was to try to cancel the increase in the poll tax for Lublin Jews, passed at the Jarosław Council of the Four Lands; 2) Jews from the Lublin voivodeship should be represented at the council by two elders and should have two appraisers; 3-4) due to a fire, the communities of Radzyń Podlaski and Budzanów in the Potocki estate should pay half of the former poll tax contribution; and 5) accordingly, the poll tax rate should be reduced for Jews from the town of Krzywcze (belonging to the Podole land) and Jews from the city of Tłumacz, which is a minor kahal under the jurisdiction of the Tyśmienica kahal.

Title: Universal of Stanisław Małachowski, Kalisz voivode, commanding the Jews of Greater Poland to execute the sentence of the rabbinical court
Manifest: Stanisław Małachowski, Kalisz voivode, orders all Jews to obey the rabbinical court ruling which settled the accounts of the Greater Poland land elders and orders them to accept and pay the assignations issued to particular communities.

Title: Universal of the Podole voivode regarding the establishment of sympla (general allocation)
Manifest: The Podole voivode convenes the elders of the Podole land to come to the council to be held in order to prepare the allocation (22 October).

Title: Resolution of the Jewish council regarding the office of the land marshal of Greater Poland
Manifest:
The Crown elders gathered at the Council of the Four Lands determine that a land marshal can only be a person who previously held the office of a land elder and at the same time withdraw the candidacy of Dawid Abrahamowicz, a Krotoszyn elder and former syndic. The resolution was confirmed by land
rabbis.

Title: Universal of King Michał Korybut Wiśniowiecki on usury
Manifest: At the request of Crown Jews, King Michał Korybut Wiśniowiecki specifies the resolutions of the diet constitution of 1670 which forbids Crown Jews from granting loans against items on a percentage higher than 20%. This rule will not apply to loan agreements made under previous rules before passing the above legislation. In the case of loan agreements for items pledged for less than 100 zlotys or short term agreements (less than 3 months) pledged for amounts of several hundred or few thousand zlotys, Christian debtors should compensate Jewish usurers for their losses caused by earlier debt payment. After one year and six weeks, which is the time to pay the loan, Jews possessing pledged items are allowed to bring them to the sub-voivode to estimate their value and to sell afterwards.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)

Title: Declaration of the Lviv syndic against Noson Abrahamowicz
Manifest: Izrael Lewkowicz, general syndic of Lviv, declares against Noson Abrahamowicz, previously a Jew of Lviv, and then a resident of Zhovkva, who had left Lviv along with his property and despite his commitments never returned, exposing the community to significant losses. Noson did not execute the judgments of Jewish courts, including the last one, from the Council of the Four Lands in Jarosław in 1718. At the same time, the syndic, on receiving the news about Noson Abrahamowicz’s illness, declares against the Zhovkva kahal, who had protected Noson, and advises that his body must not be buried until the claims of the Lviv Jews have been met.

Fond: Lviv castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lwowskie)

Title: Letter of Seweryn Rzewuski, the referendary of the Crown, to the Chełm elders regarding the Luboml kahal
Manifest: In connection with the complaint of the Luboml Jews, Seweryn Józef Rzewuski, the great referendary of the Crown and the starost of Chełm and Luboml, orders the elders of Chełm, according to the principle of alternation, to allow the Luboml kahal elders to hold the offices of the marshal, elders, trustees, and appraiser in the Chełm-Bełz land and participate in Councils of the Four Lands in Jarosław on equal terms with the Chełm kahal. Under the threat of undertaking legal measures, he prohibits the Chełm elders to collect poll tax from Luboml above the sum of 1000 zlotys and demands the return of an excessively collected tax; the arrangement of a new allocation; and the conducting of financial calculations.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie)

Notes: Tyt.: Pro parte infidelium seniorum synagogae Lubomlensis litterarum oblata. W księgach grodzkich chełmskich oblatował Irsz Abelowicz Żyd lubomelski.

Title: Universal of Adam Sieniawski, great Crown hetman, on assignment of Przemyśl poviat Jews
Manifest: Adam Mikołaj Sieniawski, great Crown hetman and Bełz voivode, forbids the land elders of the Ruthenian voivodeship to issue assignments for Przemyśl poviat Jews who have been excluded from their supremacy. Deputies should use treasury assignments only in the communities assigned by trustees of the Przemyśl poviat, based on the allocation created by the elders of that poviat.

Notes: Tyt.: Oblata universalium pro parte Judaeorum terrae Premislensis. Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich przemyskich podał 28 VI 1708 Żyd przemyski Aron Józefowicz.

Title: Decree of Crown elders settling the dispute between the communities of Kowel and Łuck over minor towns
Manifest: Crown elders gathered at the Jewish council in Konstantynów on the basis of the testimony of the Grodno rabbi and Kowel community documents decided that the leaseholders from the villages of Hołoby and Byteń would belong to the kahal in Kowel. The Kowel kahal had sued the Łuck community in connection with the failure of Łuck elders to appear in Brody before the court of Volhyn land elders, under the leadership of the Krzemieniec rabbi, and then before the arbitration court in Kaszówka with the participation of a designated mediator, i.e. the Nieśwież rabbi.

Title: Universal of Crown Treasurer Karol Sedlnicki to the land elders of Greater Poland
Manifest: Grand Crown Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki orders the land elders of Greater Poland to come to Kobylin on July 24, 1760, to arrange a new sympla (general allocation) and to settle the repayment of the debts of the Greater Poland communities, especially the heavily indebted Leszno kahal. In addition, the universal establishes the procedure for the selection of appraisers. Each community paying at least 1,000 zlotys tax will automatically be entitled to one appraiser. The other municipalities will select their appraisers by lot.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Wschowa castle court files (Księgi grodzkie wschowskie)

Notes: Tyt.: Oblata litterarum universalium olim illustris magnifici supremi Regni thesaurarii pro parte Judaeorum terrestrium Maioris Poloniae. Dokument oblatowany 7 V 1762 już po śmierci podskarbiego wielkiego koronnego w księgach grodzkich wschowskich przez Lebla Jakuba Żyda wschowskiego.

Title: Assurance of Ruthenian land elders to Józef Ossoliński
Manifest: Berko Rabinowicz, the marshal of the Ruthenian Jews and the scribe of the Crown Jews; Józef Ickowicz, rabbi and land elder of Zhovkva; and Icko Monyszowicz, land elder of Lviv, declare that they borrowed 4,000 zlotys from Józef Ossoliński, the Crown court standard-bearer, for the needs of the land (based on the plenipotency of land elders) and assure that they should pay 400 zlotys in commission on this debt (which is to come from the Jewish poll tax paid by the community of Lesko) and undertake that no assignations will be issued to Lesko Jews.

Title: Assurance of Jewish elders of the Ruthenian voivodeship regarding the repayment of wyderkauf contracted with Józef Ossoliński, Crown court standard-bearer
Manifest: The elders of the Ruthenian voivodeship concluded a contract for wyderkauf with Józef Ossoliński, the Crown court standard-bearer and the starost of Sandomierz, for the sum of 20,000 zlotys from which the annual commission was to amount to 10%. The total amount of 20,000 zlotys was to be returned after 15 years. To pay a commission of 2000 zlotys per year, the land elders appointed the kahal in Lesko; in exchange they pledged not to enter the Lesko Jews into the allocations sent to the Crown treasury.

Title: Assurance for the Ruthenian land to incur wyderkauf issued by the Busk Steward Aleksander Halecki
Manifest: Aleksander Halecki, the Busk steward and the commissioner of the estate of Stanisław Potocki, the voivode of Kiev, assures on behalf of the Kiev voivode, who is unwell, that the debt with Józef Ossoliński, Crown court standard-bearer by the designated marshal Berko Rabinowicz, and other Ruthenian land elders (based on the plenipotency granted to them in Lviv by the other land elders) will be appropriately secured and that the money borrowed will be used to pay off the urgent debts of the land.

Title: Plenipotence of Jewish elders of the Ruthenian voivodeship regarding the incurrence of debt with Józef Ossoliński, the court standard-bearer of the Crown
Manifest: The elders of the Ruthenian voivodeship appoint Berko Rabinowicz, marshal and scribe of the Ruthenian Jews; Józef Ickowicz, Zhovkva rabbi; Szmujło, rabbi of Drohobycz; and Józef Cymeles, Lviv elder as their plenipotentiaries to take a loan and establish an annual rent (wyderkauf) charged to the community in Lesko on behalf the Ruthenian land with Józef Ossoliński, the Crown court standard-bearer.

Title: Universal of Podole Voivode Stefan Humiecki to Podole Jews
Manifest: The Podole Voivode Stefan Humiecki reports that he ordered Samuel Markowicz, the rabbi of Żwaniec, to convene a meeting of the land elders of Podole communities to end the subordination of Jews from the Podole voivodeship to the land of the Ruthenian voivodeship and to choose their representative who will attend the next Jewish council of the Ruthenian land together with the Żwaniec rabbi. The Żwaniec rabbi will lobby for the independence of Podole Jews at this next Jewish council.

Title: Declaration on behalf of the Chełm-Bełz land elders against Moszek Majorowicz and Józef Izrael regarding the unlawful allocation
Manifest: Józef Chaimowicz, a Jew from Hrubieszów and marshal of the Bełz voivodeship, and Wulf Nochimowicz, the Witków rabbi and a land elder of Chełm, declare on behalf of the Chełm-Bełz land elders against Moszek Majorowicz and Józef Izrael, the rabbi of Luboml and Chełm Jew, for ignoring the principle of alternation, on the basis of which the land marshal’s duties should now be performed by a Hrubieszów elder. Moreover, without the knowledge of the appropriate marshal, Majorowicz and Józef Izrael had unlawfully made the poll tax allocation. The permission to do so, supposedly granted to them by previous land elders, is considered to be invalid by the current elders.

Title: Decree of the Poznań land rabbi in the case between the rabbi of Kcynia and Kcynia elders
Manifest: Naftali Kohen, the land rabbi of Poznań, ordered the Kcynia elders under the penalty of excommunication to pay the Kcynia rabbi 600 zlotys of his outstanding salary and his other expenses, obliging them to deliver the money to Poznań and fulfil their oath there, and for several weeks to pay the wife of the rabbi the amount established by an earlier contract.

Title: Declaration of the Ruthenian land elders against Crown elders regarding inflated debts of the land
Manifest: Ruthenian land elders declare against the marshal general and Crown elders, who did not comply with the decree of the Radom tribunal of 1740 which suspended the repayment of Jewish debts and commissions for five years. In addition, they did not take into account the recommendations of the Crown treasurer’s commissioners from the Jarosław council in 1739, ordering the repayment of Jewish debts in three installments for 1740-1742. They considered the sum assigned for them to pay during the council in Tyszowce (1742) excessive. They declare that they may pay only the Jewish poll tax for 1743 allocated to the Ruthenian land.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin

Notes: Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich grabowieckich 29 VIII 1742 przedłożył Lejba Zelikowicz.

Title: Declaration of the Bełz voivodeship elders against the trustees of Chełm land
Manifest: Abram Judkowicz, rabbi of Krystynopol and trustee of the Bełz voivodeship, along with other Bełz land elders, declare against the Chełm land trustees, Moszek Majorowicz and Józef Izraelowicz (who is also the the rabbi of Luboml), who illegally made an allocation in Konstantynów detrimental to the Bełz voivodeship and took a loan, allegedly to pay off debts that they did not repay. The amount was spent for an unknown purpose. At the same time those making the declaration state that they have cancelled the dispositions of both trustees, removed them from office, and put together a new allocation, which they sent to the Crown treasury.

Title: Decree of the Jewish council and land rabbi, issued in Pyzdry, regarding the dispute between the rabbi and the Koło community
Manifest: The land elders, in response to the complaint of the Koło rabbi, order the elders of the Koło community to enforce the previous decree, to compensate for the losses and wrongs inflicted on the rabbi, and forbid the election of a new rabbi until the previous claims have been satisfied. In the event of the lack of enforcement, they allow the rabbi to hand over the execution of this decree to a nobleman.

Notes: Do akt grodzkich kaliskich podał 12 VIII 1694 Jelonek Salamonowicz w imieniu Salamona Abramowicza rabina kolskiego.

Title: Supplication by the Krakow-Sandomierz land elders with a complaint against the land rabbi of Krakow
Manifest: The land elders explain that they were unable to appear before the Voivode of Sandomierz because the Land Marshal, Haszkiel Wulfowicz, was busy during the takeover of the town by Duke Sanguszko. They claim they want to present themselves, but because the rabbi and his supporters say that they will be treated badly, they are afraid to come, so they ask for protection and accuse the rabbi [Samuel Lewkowicz] of drunkenness, public scandals, getting the land into debt and persecution, adding that their landlords forbid them to go to the rabbinical court of this rabbi and recognize his jurisdiction. They referred to an earlier suplication handed over by the land trustee, the rabbi of Nowy Korczyn.

Title: Act of execution of the decree of the Radom tribunal in Brody
Manifest: Act of execution of the decree of the Radom treasury tribunal of 24 May 1752 (judgment in absentia imposed on Berko Rabinowicz and Joś Lejbowicz, marshals of Ruthenian Jews, and Chaim Marek Rabinowicz, general scribe) regarding the excessive burden on kahals in their allocation, at the request of Michał Rzewuski, the Crown field scribe and heir to the estates of Chodorów, Rozdół, Brzozdowce, and Kniehynicze. The execution was rejected by Berko Rabinowicz and Joś Lejbowicz, who claimed that they knew nothing about the lawsuit and judgment in absentia, and by Marek Rabinowicz, who claimed that for several years he was not a general scribe; therefore, the case was sent back to the treasury tribunal.

Title: Project of voivode’s instruction for the Jewish council of the Podole voivodeship
Manifest: Stefan Humiecki, Podole voivode, prepared an instruction for his commissioners going to the upcoming Jewish council. The sub-voivode and voivodeship judge have been obliged to make sure that all the points from the instruction have been accomplished. The land marshal is obliged to account for his incomes and expenditures from last year. Treasury assignations were supposed to be signed by the general rabbi, marshal, land elders, and syndic. Land elders from previous councils are not allowed to serve as new land authorities. The allocation for communities in the Podole voivodeship should be 13,086 zlotys (including yearly salaries of the sub-voivode – 400 zlotys; voivodeship judge – 400 zlotys; and secretary – 100 zlotys), and, after the allocation is signed by land elders, it should be sent back to the voivode. Moreover, yearly salaries for Jewish officials (general rabbi – 300 zlotys, marshal – 250 zlotys, syndic – 200 zlotys) have been agreed upon. It was also agreed that Jewish elders arriving to the land council should receive between 12 and 15 zlotys per week. The voivode forbade the payment of debts drawn from the prepared allocation without his permission. The voivode also decided that he will receive 2,000 zlotys salary a year with a bonus of 590 zlotys for travelling to the Radom tribunal. The voivode’s estate, Sokolec, was supposed receive a discount from the amount of the poll tax.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Archive of Lanckoronski family (fond 181)

Surnames: Humiecki Stefan

Title: Decree of the rabbis of the land of Greater Poland on the division of the debts of the land per kahals
Manifest: The rabbis of the main kahals of the land of Greater Poland, gathered at the congress in Zduny to calculate the loans taken out by the land, considered the case between the elders of the Greater Poland communities and the Greater Poland land elders and established the amount of debt for each town, issuing an assignation for each of them.

Title: Settlement between the Luboml kahal and the Włodzimierz kahal regarding the affiliation of minor towns
Manifest: In order to end the ongoing dispute, under the threat of curse and under oath, the elders of the kahal in Luboml and of Włodzimierz Wołyński, along with the land elders of Włodzimierz, made a settlement based on which the Jews from the settlements of Hajki, Jachodne, Turyczany, Stawki Wielkie, and Duliby were subject to the supremacy and jurisdiction of the Luboml community and its rabbi. In particular, they were obliged to bury their dead there; arrange circumcision ceremonies, weddings, and wedding receptions; and participate in services taking place in the Luboml synagogue. Conversely, the inhabitants of Owłoczym were to recognize the supreme authority and jurisdiction of the community in Włodzimierz Wołyński. Each party declared that it would not accept Jews from the villages belonging to the other party. The agreement was approved by the Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin

Title: The mandate of Crown Treasurer Karol Józef Odrowąż Sedlnicki to the Jews of Greater Poland
Manifest: Karol Józef Odrowąż Sedlnicki orders the land elders of Greater Poland to pay Abraham Józefowicz, the previous marshal, one third of the debt established at the Jarosław Council of the Four Lands and also orders the reimbursement of costs incurred by Józefowicz.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Wschowa castle court files (Księgi grodzkie wschowskie)
Reference Number: APP, Wschowskie Gr. 216, s. 270rv

Notes: Oblatował 5 II 1756 w aktach grodzkich wschowskich Lewek Jakub. Tyt.: Ovlata literarum intimationis illris Mci supremi thesaurarii Regni pro parte infidelis Abrami Józefowicz.

Title: Universal of General Starost of Greater Poland Jan Opaliński on ceding Jewish debts
Manifest: Jan Opaliński, general starost of Greater Poland and the Brześć-Kujawy voivode, forbids loanholders from ceding those liabilities to the nobles as a result of taking loans with merchants by Jews from the Greater Poland and Kujawy voivodeships.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Wschowa castle court files (Księgi grodzkie wschowskie)
Reference Number: APP, Wschowskie Gr. 149, s. 333rv

Title: Universal of Paweł Karol Sanguszko to land elders regarding the Kraków land rabbi
Manifest: Paweł Karol Sanguszko orders the governors of Opatów and Tarnów to announce the ban on paying debts to the former land rabbi and forbids Jews to consider him a rabbi and be subject to his jurisdiction; at the same time he recommends the publicizing in the synagogue of his approval of the new rabbi Józef Jona Ickowicz and orders all Jews to obey him under the penalty of 200 ducats.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Archive of Tarlo Family (Fond 254)

Notes: Mikrofilm: The Central Archives for the History of the Jewish People (CAHJP), HM3/ 250.47

Title: Decree of Crown elders for the rabbi and the Płock community
Manifest: Crown elders gathered at the Jarosław Council confirm the rights of the kahal and the rabbi of Płock. Jews living in the towns of Sierpc, Wyszogród, Maków, Szreńsk, Drobin, Płońsk, Ciechanów, Mława, Iłów, Dzierzgowo, Różan, Radziki, and villages from the Narew river to the suburb of Gdańsk – Szkotland are under the authority of the Płock rabbi, including the rabbis of these towns. The elders also determine the amount of salary due to the rabbi of Płock from the Jews of these towns and allow him to place a curse and sequester persons and goods in the event of non-compliance of the rights of the kahal and rabbi of Płock.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Castle court files of Plock
Reference Number: ​AGAD, Płockie Gr. Rel. 52, s. 28v-30v

Notes: Polskie tłumaczenie dekretu oblatowali 3 XII 1743 starsi płoccy Szymon Salamonowicz, Lewek Aaronowicz, Marek Józwowicz. Hebrew subscriptions.

Title: Universal of Crown Treasurer Marek Matczyński on deputies of Jewish poll tax
Manifest: Grand Crown Treasurer Marek Matczyński forbids Crown Jews to avoid paying the Jewish poll tax as a result of accepting by the Sejm additional Jewish poll tax of 50 thousand zlotys for hiberna. He also orders the immediate payment of the tax to treasury deputies who arrived with assignations in accordance with the allocation prepared by Crown elders. Moreover, the treasurer specifies the size of the deputies’ delegation as three horses that the Jews should take care of until the tax is collected. He also forbids representatives to take from the kahal more than 30 zlotys’ worth food per week during the period of enforcing claims on Jews.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Poznańskie Gr. 1232, s. 133rv

Notes: W księgach grodzkich poznańskich oblatował ok. 24 VIII 1690 [data nieczytelna, tekst uszkodzony] Salamon Jakubowicz syndyk generalny Żydów poznańskich.

Title: Resolution of the Radom treasury tribunal on the participation of Crown Jews in the wine trade
Manifest: The Radom treasury tribunal entitles treasury officials and landed gentry to confiscate and arrest goods that Jews are not allowed to sell. It was decided as a result of persistent violations of the law forbidding wine production and trade by Jewish merchants. Jewish merchants were selling fake liquors with artificial flavors, and they were selling cheaper and worse quality liquors to Christian customers.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Lviv castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lwowskie), Sanok castle court files (Księgi grodzkie sanockie)

Title: The resignation of Kopel Majorowicz from the office of the trustee of the Jews of Przemyśl poviat
Manifest: At the regional council of Jews from the Przemyśl poviat held in Łańcut in 1710, the Przemyśl land elders received from Kopel Majorowicz the resignation from the office of the trustee of the Przemyśl poviat after the expiration of his one-year term, and freed him from all claims.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv

Title: Consent of Jan Tarło for Józef Icyk Jonowicz, the Sandomierz and Kraków land rabbi
Manifest: Sandomierz Voivode Jan Tarło appoints Józef Icyk Jonowicz to the office of land rabbi in Kraków and Sandomierz voivodeships.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Archive of Tarlo Family (Fond 254)

Title: Universal of Sandomierz Voivode Jan Tarło on the court case between land elders and other Jews and the Kraków land rabbi
Manifest: Jan Tarło orders land elders and all those who have claims against Dawid Szmelka to come to Tursko [Tursko Wielkie] on October 24, 1742, and present proofs against the land rabbi of Kraków and Sandomierz. The rabbi should appear in person with witnesses and documents. The voivode annuls all the curses that had been cast and guarantees safety for both parties.

Title: Universal of Sandomierz Voivode Jan Tarło to land elders on the Kraków land rabbi
Manifest: Jan Tarło orders land elders and all those who have claims against Dawid Szmelka to come to Tursko on October 24, 1742, and present proofs against the land rabbi of Kraków and Sandomierz.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv

Title: Letter of King Władysław IV Vasa to Treasurer Jan Mikołaj Daniłowicz on the hearth tax of Crown Jews
Manifest: In response to a supplication from Crown Jews, King Władysław IV Vasa charges the Grand Crown Treasurer Jan Mikołaj Daniłowicz with the supervision of tax collectors, instructing him to adhere to the previous universal and refrain from collecting from Jews more than one unit of the hearth tax. King Władysław IV Vasa also commands Daniłowicz to let the Crown Jews pay the required taxes in installments.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)

Title: Declaration of Ejzyk Józefowicz regarding the regional council in Tartaków
Manifest: The Bełz Jew Ejzyk Józefowicz declares that at the spoken order of the treasurer he informed the Jews of the Bełz voivodeship about the convening of the regional council in Tartaków on 15 February 1754, but it did not take place because of the Jews of Chełm and of the Zamość Entailed Estate.

Tags: manifestacja, sejmik żydowski, ziemstwo chełmsko-bełskie, ziemstwo ordynacji zamojskiej

Title: Act of execution of the decree of the Radom tribunal in Lviv
Manifest: Act of execution of the decree of the Radom treasury tribunal of 24 May 1752 (judgment in absentia imposed on the marshals of Ruthenian Jews Berko Rabinowicz and Joś Lejbowicz and the general scribe Chaim Marek Rabinowicz) regarding the excessive burden on kahals in their allocation at the request of Michał Rzewuski, the Crown field scribe and heir to the estates of Chodorów, Rozdół, Brzozdowce, and Kniehynicze in Lviv in front of the private residences of Lewko Landes and Józef Rabinowicz and the wooden house in Przedmieście Krakowskie belonging to Berko Rabinowicz. After the rejection of the execution of the decree by Małka, Landes’ wife and by Józef Rabinowicz and Berko (they claimed that they were no longer land elders and had not signed the allocation), the case was sent back to the treasury tribunal.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv

Title: Agreement between Kalisz and Greater Poland elders on mutual financial settlements
Manifest: The elders of the Greater Poland province declared to pay 16,000 zlotys to the Kalisz community (200 red zlotys; and they were to pay 12,400 for four years, which the Kalisz Jews were to receive annually by assignations of 130 ducats; after 5 years the land elders were to give them assignations for the best cities that the Jews of Kalisz choose). Kalisz elders promised to sign a receipt at the Leszno estate chancellery, as well as to delete all convictions in absentia against the Leszno community in the Kalisz castle court and the Crown Tribunal. The Kalisz Jews were also take away all the papers from the heirs of Maciej Borzęcki, the Kalisz sub-viovode, and hand them over to the poviat elders, and if it turned out to be impossible, to invalidate them in the castle court. The assignations were to be returned in September during the allocation of the Jewish poll tax. Similarly, provincial elders should withdraw all suits and convictions in absentia, infamies, papers, and documents acknowledging debts against the Kalisz community.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Koscian castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kościańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kościańskie Gr. 164, s. 1138-1140

Notes: Tyt.: Oblata complanationis totius provinciae palatinatuum Maioris Poloniae. Oblatowana 17 XI 1740 w księgach grodzkich kościańskich przez Icika Kobylińskiego, Mośka Osiora i Judę Markiewicza plenipotentów gminy kaliskiej oraz Izaaka Elissa, Hersza Szlomę i Hersza Samuela starszych synagogi leszczyńskiej w imieniu starszych ziemskich wielkopolskich.

Title: Letter from Lublin Voivode Antoni Lubomirski ordering Lublin Jews to convene a congress
Manifest: In connection with the disorder in the Lublin kahal; the practice of violating the voivodeship jurisdiction; and the weakening of Jewish trade, Antoni Lubomirski, the Lublin voivode, orders Abraham Chaimowicz, the marshal of Crown Jews, and Lublin rabbi, the elders of the Lublin kahal, the trustees, and the shamesim to appear in Kozienice on the day of January 5, 1758, to resolve the crisis in the community as well as solve the problem of the regular payment of the commission from the incurred wyderkauf debts.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)
Reference Number: APL, CLRMO 341, s. 1637v-1639r
Surnames: Abraham Chaimowicz, Lubomirski Antoni
Notes:
Tyt.: Litterarum innotestentialium Judaeis Lublinensibus per illustrissimum Lubomirski P.L. datarum oblata. Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich
lubelskich 31 XII 1757 przedłożył Wojciech Sługocki.

Title: Universal of Kalisz Voivode Wojciech Breza on the debts of former land elders
Manifest: Wojciech Breza, Kalisz voivode, forbids executing debts of former land elders who allegedly drew them for their own needs and redirected the loan holders to newly elected elders. He commands all loan holders to claim their debts at his court.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 298, s. 714rv
Surnames: Breza Wojciech, Hers
Notes: W aktach grodzkich kaliskich oblatował Hers szkolny kaliski 14 VII 1687.

Title: Protestation of the Greater Poland land elders against the Jews of Kalisz and Leszno regarding the revolt in the land
Manifest: The Greater Poland Land Elders Joachim Smol and Mendel Herc protest against a group of Jews from Kalisz and Leszno, who in April 1686 invaded the room near the Kalisz synagogue, removing the authorities of the kahal by force and replacing them with elders elected by themselves. The rebels also undertook a number of actions against the legal authorities of the land and the local Jews. They turned to the nobility, demanding that the latter would no longer give the protestees more loans; they made it difficult for the Jewish common people to conduct commercial activities, refused to pay state taxes, and exposed the land elders to court costs. In addition, they violated the decree of the Kalisz voivode and encouraged the rebellion of Jewish towns, leading to the gathering of separatist authorities of the Greater Poland region at their own Jewish council.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)

Title: Declaration of Kalisz elders against their deputies to land councils
Manifest: The elders of Kalisz declare against their deputies to land council, who resigned from the precedence of Kalisz for the deputies from Krotoszyn and Leszno, enabling them to take resolutions against Jewish laws.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)

Title: Universal of Jan III on Jews of Greater Poland voivodeships
Manifest: At the request of Greater Poland land elders, King Jan III Sobieski forbids providing protection to Jews who are not willing to pay the Jewish poll tax. Moreover, he forbids military deputies pursuing their fiscal claims, which they should collect based on assignations issued by elders, directly from the elders.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)

Title: Order of Crown Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki regarding the minor kahals of the Łokacze community
Manifest: According to the instructions of Grand Crown Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki, Jews living in the villages of the Włodzimierz poviat, Buszkowice, and Woryszcz, who were currently paying the poll tax to the treasury through the elders of Łokacze, are to pay it to the Poryck kahal to which they were attached.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)

Surnames: Sedlnicki Karol Odrowąż, Wolski Franciszek

Title: Protection privilege of August II for his factor Naftali Izaakowicz
Manifest: King August II responded to the supplication of his factor Naftali Izaakowicz. He orders that Izaakowicz be assisted in executing debts owed to him, both private and from the land of Greater Poland. He erases all safety assurances that protected his debtors. August II releases Izaakowicz and his servants from any fees especially in towns such as Gdańsk, Toruń, Elbląg, and Wrocław.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)

Title: Decree of Michał Kazimierz Radziwiłł regarding Pinchas Abramowicz, the marshal of the Ruthenian land
Manifest: Michał Kazimierz Radziwiłł condemns Pinchas Abramowicz to the penalty of flogging 200 for breaking the conditions of privilege for the office of the marshal and the fine of 200 zlotys for forcing the return of money spent on consensus from the land. After the execution of the sentence, however, he is to be restored to the office. His messenger Abramko was sentenced to work in chains in the castle of Zhovkva until November 11, 1754, and Litman, for allegedly forging Pinchas’s signature on the plenipotence, to three years of work in chains in the castle of Zhovkva.
Archive: National Historical Archives of Belarus in Minsk
Fond: Archive of Radziwill Family (Fond 694)
Reference Number: NHAB, Fond 694, op. 4, sp. 1019, s. 2rv

Title: Decree of Michał Kazimierz Radziwiłł regarding Pinchas Abramowicz, the marshal of the Ruthenian land
Manifest: After an investigation by designated commissioners, Michał Kazimierz Radziwiłł orders to bring Pinchas Abramowicz along with his messenger and Litman to Łachwa, where he will decide about the penalty for breaking the terms of the privilege (instrument) for the office of the marshal of the land. Before arriving in Łachwa, Pinchas is to swear an oath that he had not signed a plenipotence on incurring debt with Józef Ossoliński by the land (galil) of Ruthenia. In addition, he recommends that the land receives 75 ducats from the Tarnopol rabbi, which were intended to pay the consensus for the rabbi of the land. The newly-proclaimed land rabbi is prohibited from interfering in matters belonging to his kahals until the rabbi receives the instrument from him. Finally, he imposes a fine of 400 zlotys on Józef, the rabbi of Gródek for signing the plenipotency without his consent.
Archive: National Historical Archives of Belarus in Minsk

Title: Privilege of Treasurer Jan Jerzy Przebendowski for Jews from Zamość and the Zamość Entailed Estate related to representation at Jewish councils
Manifest: Referring to privilege of king Jan III Sobieski for Zamość Jews, Grand Crown Treasurer Jan Jerzy Przebendowski confirms that the prerogatives of Zamość are equal to those of the Kraków, Lublin, and Poznań communities. The Zamość kahal, as one of the main kahals in the Crown, receives together with the Zamość Entailed Estate the right to send to Jewish councils one appraiser and one deputy each. They were authorized to participate in Jewish congresses according to agreed precedence and to make decisions on public treasury issues and on Jewish private matters.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Grabowiec castle court files (Księgi grodzkie grabowieckie)

Notes: Tyt.: Privilegii certi in personam synagogae Zamoscensis servientis oblata. W księgach grodzkich grabowieckich 10 I 1730 oblatował Szmul Szmerlowic starszy synagogi zamojskiej w imieniu swoim i całej synagogi zamojskiej.

Title: Universal of Kraków Voivode Teodor Lubomirski on the Kraków land rabbi
Manifest: Upon the request of Dawid Szmelka, the Kraków land rabbi, Teodor Lubomirski decides to provide Szmelka his protection from the schemes of Samson and his supporters and confirms Szmelka’s office.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv

Title: Consent of the Ruthenian Voivode August Czartoryski for the Przemyśl General Rabbi Michel Szmujłowicz
Manifest: Ruthenian Voivoide August Czartoryski appoints Michel Szmujłowicz as Przemyśl general rabbi for a six-year term after the previous rabbi’s contract had expired. Czartoryski confirms his jurisdiction over Przemyśl Jews and Jews from poviat communities that belong to the Przemyśl region. Czartoryski gives Szmujłowicz his protection and releases him from paying community taxes and debts made by the kahal with clergy and secular citizens.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Przemysl castle court files (Księgi grodzkie przemyskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów,  Fond 13 [Sąd grodzki przemyski], op. 1, sp. 558, s. 2287, 2288
Surnames: Czartoryski August Aleksander, Dawid Szmujłowicz, Michel Szmujłowicz
Notes: Oblatowany 20 VII 1742 r. w aktach grodzkich przemyskich przez brata Michla, Dawida Szmujłowicza.

Title: Universal of Łęczyca voivode, Rafał Leszczyński, on accounting for treasury assignations of the Jews of Greater Poland
Manifest: Rafał Leszczyński, Łęczyca voivode and general starost of Greater Poland, received complaints from treasury deputies, and, therefore, he commands the Jews of Kalisz and Poznań voivodeships to come with receipts and accounts to his hereditary city Leszno by December 12, 1693, to settle accounts and receive assignations. He also orders a clarification of the allegations regarding the land elder Wulf, a Jew of Kalisz accused of embezzling money taken from loans and the Jewish taxes that had been collected.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 304, s. 569v, 570r
Surnames: Jakub Wulf, Kluczyński Jan, Leszczyński Rafał
Notes:
W księgach grodzkich kaliskich oblatował 1 XII 1693 Jan Kluczyński, adnotacja o odebraniu oryginału przez Jakuba Wulfa starszego ziemskiego
wielkopolskiego i mieszkańca Kalisza.

Title: Protection letter of Jan III Sobieski for the elder of Bełz voivodeship
Manifest: Jan III Sobieski secures the trade interests of Irsz Samsonowicz, a Jew from Bełz, elder of the Bełz voivodeship and royal factor, and excludes him from the jurisdiction of all courts except the royal court. He also releases him from paying army contributions and from the obligation to pay treasury assignations from his personal wealth for insolvent Jewish towns.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Belz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie bełskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 1, op. 1, sp. 264, s. 1545, 1546
Surnames: Dura, Irsz Samsonowicz, Jan III Sobieski, Michajłowicz Jan, Potocki Feliks
Notes: Tyt.: Ex parte perfidi Irsz civis Bełzensis oblata. W aktach grodzkich bełskich oblatował 8 X 1674 woźny Jan Michajłowicz z Góry na życzenie obywatela i kupca bełskiego Irsza Samsonowicza. Zob. ibidem, s. 1546, 1547, Mandat Jana III do Feliksa Potockiego wojewody sieradzkiego, starosty sokalskiego w interesie Irsza, który został obrabowany, a jego żona uwięziona przez niejakiego Dura dzierżawcę starostwa sokalskiego, Żółkiew, 4 X 1674.

Title: Statement of royal commissioners on the land elder Wulf Jakub
Manifest: Members of the royal committee for settling debts in the land of Greater Poland, after hearing all complaints, issued a statement about the Kalisz land elder Wulf Jakub clearing him of all claims. They approved the receipt issued by loan holders and they assured his personal and trade safety.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 305, s. 747v, 748r
Surnames: Gałecki Franciszek Zygmunt, Miaskowski Franciszek, Modlibowski Andrzej, Molski Wojciech, Wulf Jakub
Notes: Do akt grodzkich kaliskich podał 28 IX 1695 Wulf Jakub Żyd kaliski, starszy ziemski wielkopolski.

Title: Universal of Crown Treasurer Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski on the poll tax of Volhyn Jews
Manifest:
Crown Treasurer Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski announces that claims addressed to the general scribe, Fiszel Lewkowicz, regarding unfair allocations toward Volhyn Jews are groundless. Lubomirski appoints a treasury commissioner, Kazimierz Mierzwiński, to judge the claims of Volhyn Jews and to accept the
particular allocation established by them. Moreover, he invalidates all letters from the treasury to the Jews due to the increasing of the Jewish poll tax by the Warsaw diet.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Lutsk castle court files (Księgi grodzkie łuckie)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 25, op. 1, sp. 424, s. 372r-373v
Surnames: Fiszel Lewkowicz. Fiszel Lejbowicz, Lubomirski Hieronim Augustyn, Mierzwieński Kazimierz
Notes: Tyt.: Oblata asygnacyjnego listu o retentach z miast, miasteczek od JW JM pana podskarbiego wielkiego koronnego do rozdziału pogłównego żydowskiego województwa wołyńskiego. W księgach grodzkich łuckich oblatował 12 XI 1699 Hirsz Gierszonowicz pisarz prowentowy starostwa łuckiego.

Title: Universal issued by Walerian Naramowski, sub-Voivode of Poznań concerning Jewish assemblies
Manifest: The sub-Voivode of Poznań orders the communities in the Poznań voivodeship to obey the land rabbi of Poznań and forbids any violation of his prerogatives to convene Jewish assemblies and compliance with the provisions of the universals of other jurisdictions convening the assemblies in the voivodeship.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Księgi wojewodzińskie poznańskie
Reference Number: APPozn, Księgi sądu i urzędu wojewody poznańskiego W.5, s. 64, 69
Surnames: Lipski Feliks Aleksander, Małachowski Stanisław, Naramowski Walerian
Notes: W księgach wojewodzińskich oblatował Benedykt Markowicz syndyk generalny Żydów poznańskich w dn. 27 VIII 1698.

Title: Universal of Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski for Kalisz Jews
Manifest: Considering the poverty of Kalisz Jews, the Crown Treasurer Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski ordered the treasury assignations holders to collect only 1/11 of the assigned amount and collect the rest of the amount together with a Jewish delegate in towns under the jurisdiction of the Kalisz community.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 307, s. 313, 314 [Rel. 59]

Notes: Oblatował 9 VI 1698 w aktach grodzkich kaliskich Tobias szkolny w imieniu starszych kaliskich.
Tags: asygnacja, pogłówne, sejmik żydowski, uniwersał, ziemstwo wielkopolskie

Title: Declaration of the Sandomierz voivode against the Crown treasurer
Manifest: Jan Wielopolski, voivode of Sandomierz and the starost of Lanckorona, declares against Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki, the grand Crown treasurer, whom he accuses of violating the rights of voivodes as he had issued a universal in Konstantynów (16 November 1753), in which he convened for 10 February 1754 the Jewish council to Pińczów and he instructed to prepare a general allocation (sympla) for the sum of 34,596 zlotys for communities located in the local voivodeship, as well as in the case of a summons against himself to the Radom treasury tribunal in which the treasurer accused him of violating the jurisdiction of the treasurer over Jews.
Archive: The National Archives in Krakow
Fond: Krakow castle court files
Surnames: Sedlnicki Karol Odrowąż, Wielopolski Jan
Tags: dyspartyment (taryfa), manifestacja, podskarbi, sejm żydowski (kongres), sejmik żydowski, sympla, ziemstwo krakowsko-sandomierskie

Title: Summons to the treasury tribunal for the voivode of Sandomierz regarding a violation of the rights of the treasurer
Manifest: Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki, the grand Crown treasurer, is suing Jan Wielopolski, the voivode of Sandomierz and the starost of Lanckorona, in the treasury tribunal in Radom, because of Wielopolski’s attempt to extend his power to matters concerning the Jewish poll tax and thereby violating the jurisdiction of the treasurer and the Constitutions of 1673 and 1717 and Sedlnicki’s right to establish the tariff for the Jews of the Sandomierz province. The voivode allegedly issued universals forbidding Jews from attending a regional council called by the treasurer, at which they were to pass an allocation.
Archive: The National Archives in Krakow
Fond: Krakow castle court files
Surnames: Sedlnicki Karol Odrowąż, Wielopolski Jan
Notes: Tyt.: Ex parte thesaurarii Regni super palatinum Sandomiriensem relatio. Relację położenia pozwu w ksiągach grodzkich krakowskich 20 V 1754. Pozew złożono we dworze w Przecławicach.
Tags: podskarbi, pogłówne, pozew, sejmik żydowski, trybunał skarbowy radomski, ziemstwo krakowsko-sandomierskie

Title: Judgment of the Kalisz Voivode Wojciech Miaskowski regarding the election of the Greater Poland rabbi
Manifest: Wojciech Maksymilian Miaskowski, the Kalisz voivode, with the consent of the Poznań Voivode Antoni Barnaba Jabłonowski, sets a new date for the election of the general rabbi of the land of Greater Poland, June 7, 1762. The Krotoszyn and Leszno communities, as the other two main communities in the land, received a fine of 300 ducats payable to the Kalisz voivodeship court for not appearing at the previous elections. The Poznań and Kalisz communities were freed from this obligation.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Wschowa castle court files (Księgi grodzkie wschowskie)
Reference Number: APP, Wschowskie 218, s. 180v-182v

Notes: Tyt.: Oblata decreti IMM palatini Calissiensis inter varias synagogas prolati. W księgach grodzkich wschowskich oblatował 19 V 1762 komornik graniczny wschowski Józef Sariusz-Gomoliński ekstrakt z akt wojewodzińskich.

Title: Universal of Crown Treasurer Jan Jerzy Przebendowski to Crown elders on private customs
Manifest: As a result of the establishment of a constitution annulling all private customs, Crown Treasurer Jan Jerzy Przebendowski orders the Jewish marshal Fortes and Crown elders to announce to all Jews that the leasing of customs other than those established by diet is no longer permitted. Przebendowski agrees to collect only 3 grosz per horse or ox under penalty of death by hanging to Jews who do not obey this order.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Lviv castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lwowskie), Terebovlia castle court files (Księgi grodzkie trembowelskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 9, op. 1, sp. 518, s. 350-351, CGIA Lwów, Fond 17, op. 1, sp. 172, s. 625-626
Surnames: Izaak Fortis, Lejba Moszkowicz, Lityński Jan, Moszko Jakubowicz, Przebendowski Jan Jerzy
Notes: Tyt.: Litterarum ab illustri magnifico Przebendowski oblata. W aktach grodzkich lwowskich 5 III 1727 oblatował Jan Lityński pisarz komory lwowskiej;

Title: Settlement between the Chyrów and Dobromil kahals regarding the Jewish poll tax
Manifest: The Dobromil elders made a settlement regarding the Jewish poll tax with the community of Chyrów (together with the leaseholders from the subordinate villages). The Jews of Chyrów together with the local leaseholders and those of Bąkowice pledged to pay 80 zlotys in two installments each year, whereas the leaseholders from Suszyca, Terło, and Krościenko pledged to pay 40 zlotys to the Dobromil kahal. The money due was to be delivered directly to Dobromil. The local kahal was not suppose to issue assignations to Chyrów and leaseholders for military deputies. The settlement was confirmed in 1744.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Przemysl castle court files (Księgi grodzkie przemyskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 13, op. 1, sp. 575, s. 590-593

Notes: Tyt.: Oblata complanationis pro parte Judaeorum in Nowe Miasto manentium serviens. W aktach grodzkich przemyskich w dn. 3 II 1748 r. oblatował Matys Mendlowicz.

Title: Statement of a committee for Krotoszyn Jews on debt relief of the land of Greater Poland
Manifest: The commissioners of the Kalisz royal committee state that, due to satisfying the claims of loan holders in the land of Greater Poland, they created a debts tariff depending on the wealth and financial situation of Jewish townlets. They state that they issued assignations for loan holders that entitle them to collect debts according to the tariff, and they also guaranteed safety to Krotoszyn Jews who had already paid off their loan holders.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Poznańskie Gr. 807, s. 33r-34r
Surnames: Benedykt Markowicz, Gałecki Franciszek Zygmunt, Miaskowski Jan, Modlibowski Andrzej, Molski Wojciech
Notes: W aktach grodzkich poznańskich 26 IX 1696 oblatował Benedykt Markowicz (Baruch Markowicz) syndyk generalny gminy poznańskiej w imieniu Żydów krotoszyńskich.

Title: Universal of Jan III commanding loan holders to pursue their claims in particular poviats and Jewish communities
Manifest: King Jan III Sobieski, following the constitution from 1678, rules on claiming liabilities from Jews. He forbids loan holders, in particular treasury court representatives, to pursue their claims from an individual land, and, according to the elders’ allocation, recommends they turn to the poviats and the elders of these poviats, to reclaim assignations from poviat elders and to go to particular Jewish towns to reclaim the debts. He forbids transferring debts to third parties.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 300, s. 92v, 93r
Surnames: Jan III Sobieski, Taranowski Krzysztof, Łazarz Izaakowicz
Notes: Do akt grodzkich kaliskich podał 26 V 1683 r. Łazarz Izaakowicz syndyk Żydów kaliskich.

Title: Approval by Crown elders of contracts between Jews from the Podzamcze jurydyka and the Lublin kahal
Manifest: The Crown elders approved the agreement between Jews from the Podzamcze jurydyka (an enclave in a town under a different jurisdiction) in Lublin and the Lublin kahal regarding the manner of passing the tariffs (symple), the proportion of the number of appraisers, tallymen, kahal members, and kahal electors. The parties agreed that every Jew who does not have his own property and does not pay 3 zlotys per day for trading will not be able to be appointed to any offices or functions in the community. Jews from Podzamcze were forbidden from separating from the Lublin kahal and were ordered to pay taxes to the Lublin community, with the exception of poll tax, castle rent, and military contributions. It was established that three ledgers of income and expenditure will be written down and stored, respectively, with the elders and community scribes and one at the Lublin castle.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Lublin castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lubelskie)
Reference Number: APL, CLRMO 285, s. 464-467

Notes: Tyt.: Punkta podzameckie dla dobrego porządku z kahałem lubelskim powtórnie postanowione. W księgach grodzkich lubelskich oblatowano polskie tłumaczenie w dn. 10 II 1742. Por. M.T. Wójciuk, Podstawy prawne relacji między ludnością żydowską a chrześcijańską w Lublinie i na Podzamczu Lubelskim od połowy XVI do połowy XVIII wieku, „Pogranicze. Polska–Ukraina” T. IV, 2012,s. 207-256.

Title: Royal privilege for Poznań and the Greater Poland Land Rabbi Naftali Izaakowicz
Manifest: August II Wettin confirms the rights and privileges of the Poznań Land Rabbi Naftali Izaakowicz and releases him from any responsibility for debts drawn by the land of Greater Poland. He appoints him the highest judge for Greater Poland communities (with a yearly salary from Greater Poland poviats) responsible for all the communities including those paying poll tax separately and Jews from nobility estates who were not allowed to be protected by local landlords to avoid the results of a rabbinical court ruling. Communities trying to avoid the supremacy of the land of Greater Poland will be punished with 2000 marks. The rulings of the land rabbi are undisputable and final. The rabbi’s arguments with other Greater Poland Jews should be determined at a Jewish council in Jarosław. Land elders are obliged to cover debts and give them back to the rabbi on behalf of their unreliable debtors from their towns.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Poznańskie Gr. 817, s. 17r-19r
Surnames: August II Wettyn, Benedykt Markowicz, Naftali Izaakowicz

Title: Universal of Jan Tarło regarding the jurisdiction of the Lviv land rabbi
Manifest: Jan Tarło forbids Jews from Jaryczów, Pomorzany, Kulików, Kukizów, and Złoczów to appear in the court of the Lviv land rabbi, and the land elders from these cities are forbidden to sit with him in court under the threat of harsh penalties and imprisonment. He orders them to submit their cases to the commissioner of the voivode of Sandomierz.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Archive of Tarlo Family (Fond 254)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 254, op. 1, sp. 88  [kopia]

Surnames: Tarło Jan

Title: Declaration of marshal Abram Pietruszka against the elders of the Chełm community
Manifest: AAbram Pietruszka, a Bełz Jew elected marshal of the regional council in Kryłów, who was to prepare the allocation of sums earmarked for the commissions from debts of the synagogues of the Chełm region and Bełz voivodeship, declares against the brothers Heszel and Moszek Rabinowicz and Zelik Irszowicz, the elders of the Chełm community, who collected monies from the communities of the Chełm region and did not pay them to creditors, but used them for their own purposes.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Belz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie bełskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 1, op. 1, sp. 336, s. 856, 857
Surnames: Abram Pietruszka, Heszel Rabinowicz, Moszko Rabinowicz

Title: Letter from Michał Czacki, a Volhyn castellan, to the rabbi and kahal of Łokacze
Manifest: Michał Czacki forbids the Łokacze kahal to impose curses on his Buszkowice and Woryszcze leaseholders, threatening, in the event of disobedience, to secede his estate from the Łokacze kahal and join it to the Poryck kahal.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 28, op. 1, sp. 171, s. 406rv
Surnames: Czacki Michał, Ługowski Lubicz Jan Stanisław
Notes: Tyt.: Oblata listu od niegdy JW JM Pana Michała Czackiego kasztelana wołyńskiego do kahału łokackiego pisanego. W księgach grodzkich włodzimierskich 27 V 1752 oblatował Stanisław Józef Lubicz Ługowski subdelegat grodzki włodzimierski.

Title: Plenipotency by the Krakow-Sandomierz land assembly for six land elders
Manifest: The land elders, gathered in Kolbuszowa at the regional council, explain the reasons for not appearing before the voivode of Sandomierz to present their complaints against the former Kraków-Sandomierz land rabbi and send six from among them to the voivode, whom they authorize to accept and satisfy their claims.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Archive of Tarlo Family (Fond 254)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 254, op. 1, sp. 1184, s. 1r-2v

Notes: Mikrofilm: The Central Archives for the History of the Jewish People (CAHJP), HM3/ 250.48

Title: Decree of the Jewish council regarding the office of the marshal of the Greater Poland land
Manifest: The tribunal operating at the Jewish Council in Jarosław resolved the dispute between the Krotoszyn community and the Greater Poland land elders. The Crown elders decided that the office of the marshal should be taken over from the community of Leszno by the Krotoszyn community. In order to settle the dispute, it was decided that a Krotoszyn elder should take the office of the land marshal from 15 December 1731 and at the latest from 1 January 1732. Krotoszyn elders,under the penalty of losing the office of the marshal, were obliged to come for a session of the land in the current month and settle financial arrears. The marshal’s term of office was set to be three years. Moszek Rabinowicz from Krotoszyn was recommended to take office as the marshal of the Greater Poland region when the term of office for the Krotoszyn community was due, as for seven years in a row he had been a land elder of Greater Poland. The syndic Dawid, a Krotoszyn elder and a former land elder, was excluded from the structures of the land and forbidden to hold any functions or offices because of the abuses that he had committed.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Wschowa castle court files (Księgi grodzkie wschowskie)
Reference Number: APP, Wschowskie Gr. 205, s. 144r-146r
Geographical Names: Cracow (Kraków), Kremenets, Krotoszyn, Leszno, Liuboml, Przemyśl, Tarnogród, Tykocin, Volhynia
Surnames: Dawid Mankiewicz, Hersz Jakub, Moszko Rabinowicz, Potocki Józef
Notes: Tyt.: Oblata decreti Judaici pro parte synagogae Lesnensis. Tłumaczenie na jęz. polski oblatował 18 XII 1730 w księgach grodzkich wschowskich Hersz Jakub starszy wschowski w imieniu starszych leszczyńskich.

Title: Universal of General Starost of Greater Poland Piotr Opaliński on the poll tax execution
Manifest: Piotr Opaliński, Łęczyca voivode and general starost of Greater Poland, orders the provision of all assistance to tax collectors travelling to Jewish towns together with Jewish delegates appointed by land elders and forbids disturbing them during execution proceedings in order to avoid providing protection by estate owners and tenants to Jews who are trying to avoid paying the annual Jewish poll tax.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Poznańskie Gr. 1231, s. 601rv
Surnames: Opaliński Piotr, Salamon Jakubowicz
Notes: Do akt grodzkich poznańskich podał 11 VII 1689 r. Salamon Jakubowicz syndyk generalny Żydów poznańskich.

Title: Declaration of Moszek Wulfowicz against Grochowski, the marshal of the Podole land and commissioner
Manifest: Moszko Wulfowicz, a Satanów Jew, declares on behalf of the Satanów community against Jan Grochowski, the special Jewish commissioner to the Radom treasury tribunal from the Podole communities to deal with Jewish poll tax; Moszek Judkowicz, the marshal; and Icek Majorowicz Cygan, the ex-marshal who put an excessive burden on the Satanów community; Wulfowicz also demands the annulment of a settlement conducted in Radom in which neither Grochowski nor Moszko Judkowicz had the authority to participate.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Terebovlia castle court files (Księgi grodzkie trembowelskie)
