Tags: manifestacja, pogłówne, trybunał skarbowy radomski, ugoda, ziemstwo podolskie

Title: Janusz Sanguszko's Universal concerning the land rabbi of Krakow
Manifest: Janusz Sanguszko instructs his steward to bond the debts of the former land rabbi [Dawid Szmelka] from Nowy Wiśnicz and forbids to pay them back under the threat of a fine of 100 red zloties until any claims against him are settled. At the same time he orders to proclaim in the synagogue his approval for the new rabbi, Józef Jona Ickowicz, and commands all the Jews to obey him under the threat of a fine of 200 red zloties.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Archive of Tarlo Family (Fond 254)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 254 [Arch. Tarłów], op. 1, sp. 1183, s. 3r [oryginał]
Surnames: Bedoński W., Dawid Szmelka, Józef Icek Jonowicz, Sanguszko Janusz Aleksander
Notes: Microfilm: The Central Archives for the History of the Jewish People (CAHJP), HM3/ 250.47

Title: Resolution of Jan III on Jewish poll tax
Manifest: As a result of the disruption of the diet in 1688, King Jan III Sobieski orders Crown Jews to pay 105 thousand zlotys of Jewish poll tax in current coin, and, at the same time, he exempts them from any other taxes.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)
Reference Number: CGIA KIjów, Fond 28, op. 1, sp. 133, 1291v-1294r, [ommitted 1292 ]
Surnames: Abraham Wulfowicz, Fancheł Józefowicz, Jan III Sobieski, Towiański Jerzy
Notes: Do akt grodzkich włodzimierskich podał 14 VI 1688 Fancheł Józefowicz syndyk włodzimierski. Oblatowany dokument był ekstraktem z ksiąg grodzkich grodzieńskich, do których został podany 29 III 1688 przez Abrahama Wulfowicza Żyda dubieńskiego.

Title: The decree of the land elders of Greater Poland in the case between Salamon Abramowicz, the rabbi of Koło, and the local kahal
Manifest: The elders of Greater Poland gathered in the regional council in Pyzdry together with the rabbi of Poznań, Naftali Ickowicz, ordered the Koło elders to pay rabbi Salamon Abramowicz a salary of 900 zlotys with a commission of 180 zlotys annually, which the rabbi was to recover, collecting half of the community’s income from cattle and poultry slaughter tax (the so-called “krupka”). In exchange they forbade him to do any trade in the city. In the event of renewing the contract for the office of the rabbi, elders of the Koło were to provide him with a higher income and help him execute his debts.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 305, s. 214r-215r
Geographical Names: Inowrocław, Kalisz, Kolo, Krotoszyn, Leszno, Poznan (Poznań), Pyzdry, Walcz (Wałcz)
Surnames: Dawid Idzkowicz, Fabiś Salamonowicz, Jelonek Salamonowicz, Lewek Izekiel, Lewek Lazarus, Mojżesz Lazarus, Salamon Abramowicz, Wigdor Abrahamowicz
Notes: Do akt grodzkich kaliskich podał 12 VIII 1694 Jelonek Salamonowicz w imieniu Salamona Abramowicza rabina kolskiego.

Title: Summons to the treasury tribunal for Michał and Karol Radziwiłł, Józef Potocki, Józef Skrzetuski, and Ruthenian land elders
Manifest: Franciszek Salezy Potocki, the Kiev voivode and the owner of Tulczyn, Trościaniec, Wierzchówka, Humań, and Sokołówka, together with Franciszek Gorzewski, the commissioner of these estates and the Winnica cupbearer, and local Jews sue in the Radom treasury tribunal Michał Radziwiłł, the voivode of Vilnius and hetman of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania; Karol Radziwiłł, the sword-bearer of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania and Lviv starost; Józef Potocki, the starost of Leżajsk; and Józef Skrzetuski, the starost of Mogielnica and the Lviv sub-voivode; as well as the land elders of the Ruthenian voivodeship from Brody, Zhovkva, and Lviv (the hereditary estates of the above magnates) in the matter of appearing in the court of the land elders, and the elders themselves for defaulting on the assurance and putting an excessive burden on Jews from Tulczyn and Trościaniec, as well as demanding the total cancellation of the allocation for the Jews from Wierzchówka, Humań, and Sokołówka destroyed by hajdamaks.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Lviv castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lwowskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 9, op. 1, sp. 590, s. 2400-2404
Geographical Names: Brody, Lviv (Lwów), Radom, Tulchyn (Ukraine), Uman, Zhovkva (Ukraine)
Surnames: Berko Rabinowicz, Borucho Mendlowicz, Gorzewski Franciszek, Herszko Berkowicz, Icko  Moniuszowicz, Josio Lejbowicz, Lejbka Rabinowicz, Oron Moniuszowicz, Pinkwas Abramowicz, Potocki Franciszek Salezy, Potocki Józef, Radziwiłł Karol Stanisław, Radziwiłł Michał Kazimierz, Skrzetuski Józef, Zelman Eliaszowicz

Tags: pozew, trybunał skarbowy radomski, ziemstwo ruskie

Title: Letter from the voivode of Czernihów regarding the dues of Luboml Jews from the Jews of Maciejów for etrog
Manifest: Piotr Miączyński, the voivode of Czernihów, orders Orzeszko, a Lithuanian army captain, to ensure that the amount of 4 ducats are paid by the Maciejów [Łuków, Ukraine] Jews for the delivery of etrog, which according to the two-year contract (2 ducats each year) were brought to them from the Luboml community. The final decision in the dispute was to be taken by the Jewish council and the Crown treasury.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie)
Reference Number: APL, Chełmskie RMO 138, s. 692v-693r
Surnames: Irsz Abelowicz, Josio Pejsachowicz, Miączyński Piotr, Orzeszko
Notes: Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich chełmskich przedłożyli 25 V 1741 Irsz Abelowicz i Josio Pejsakowicz Żydzi lubomelscy.

Title: Universal of Poznań and Inowrocław voivodes on assignments to Poznań Jews
Manifest: Franciszek Zygmunt Gałecki, Poznań voivode and Bydgoszcz starost, and Maciej Radomicki, Inowrocław voivode and Greater Poland starost general, forbid the Polish and foreign contingent deputies to demand the payment of treasury assignments for the Jewish community in Poznań because a separate assignment from the royal treasury is issued for the Poznań community together with the one for the Swarzędz community. Voivodes, in compliance with royal and hetman universals, recommend the deputies to go with their assignments to Kalisz where the land scribe of the Jews of Greater Poland lives. The land scribe will give them an allocation for particular Jewish communities.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Poznańskie Gr. 843, s. 43r

Notes: Do oblaty w księgach grodzkich poznańskich podał 1 IX 1710 r. Lazarus Iciek Żyd poznański. Tyt.: Oblata litterarum universalium m[agnificorum] senatorum Judaeis datam.

Title: Universal of Poznań Voivode Wojciech Konstanty Breza on convening a Jewish council
Manifest: As a result of complaints received from tax collectors and the necessity to evaluate and pay the debts of the nobility,Wojciech Konstanty Breza, Poznań voivode summons the land elders and rabbis of the Kalisz and Poznań voivodeships to a council in Zduny.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 305, s. 199v, 200r

Tags: sejmik żydowski, uniwersał, zadłużenie (długi), ziemstwo wielkopolskie

Title: Resolution of Crown elders during the Jewish council on the claims between Leszno Jews and Jews of Greater Poland
Manifest: Crown elders, in accordance with the Crown treasurer’s consent, settled the mutual claims of the Leszno Jews and the Greater Poland land elders. The Leszno Jews were to pay 1/10 of the land’s expenses for the previous 4 years. In the case of overdue land receivables from Jews living in minor towns, they ordered that Leszno Jews pay 3,000 zlotys and 1,600 zlotys for the assignation of the Inowrocław voivode, and 1,500 zlotys paid by Leszno Jews were credited for their debts from nobility. In addition, they freed the Leszno Jews from the claims of the land, concerning 7,000 zlotys of land debt on the basis of Barnecki’s assignation, while in the case of other debts from nobility they ordered the Leszno Jews to repay them according to the specified proportion.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Poznańskie Gr. 846, s. 92v-93v
Surnames: Barnecki, Gałecki Franciszek Zygmunt, Lubomirski Hieronim Augustyn, Mozes  Elias, Naftali Izaakowicz
Notes: Do akt grodzkich poznańskich podał 16 IX 1711  Mozes [Mojżesz] Elias syndyk generalny leszczyński.

Title: Decree in the Nowe Miasto between the Kalisz elders and other elders from the Greater Poland land
Manifest: Rabbis at the council in Nowe Miasto nad Wartą ruled against the financial grievances of Kalisz Jews towards other communities of the land, accepting their accounts only partially. They decided that despite fulfilling their obligations due to the urgent payment of treasury assignments, the Kalisz Jews should still cover some of the obligations of the land (commission for the Jesuits and one assignment for 2000 zlotys). All the obligations of the Jews of the land to Kalisz were to wait until the next council at which they were to be deducted from the receivables of the Kalisz Jews. The rabbis decided that the Kalisz Jews should be paid 500 zlotys in exchange for waiting for the repayment of the land’s obligations.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP,  Kaliskie Gr. 306, s. 884, 885

Notes: Do akt grodzkich kaliskich podał 18 I 1697 Lewek Abrahamowicz syndyk synagogi kaliskiej.

Title: General receipt for the Poznań land rabbi
Manifest:
Land elders of Greater Poland gathered in the regional council in Nowe Miasto nad Wartą, after reviewing the accounts of the Poznań land rabbi, declare that the accusations of alleged mismanagement and the embezzlement of the money of the land are untrue and threaten to curse all who continue to spread similar slanders.
Signed: Mendel of Kalisz deputy, Jakub Aszer of Kalisz deputy, Wulf of Kalisz, Tobiasz of Piła deputy, Jakub of Złotowowo deputy, Jachym D[…] deputy, Łazarz Krotowski of Międzyrzecz deputy, […]ff Złotny of Międzyrzecza envoy, Lewek of Wronki deputy, Heremiasz of Wryszocny [probably Wrześni] deputy, Mojżesz of Ch[odzieża] deputy, Lewek of Łobzinice [Łobżenica] envoy, Lewek of Gr[odzisko] envoy, Wulf of Skwirzyna [Skwierzyna] envoy, Aleksander of […] envoy, Samuel of Pyzdry envoy, Dawid of Osieczna envoy, Marek of Szamotuły envoy, Józef of Gniezno envoy, Jakub of Gniezno envoy, Szymon of Fordan [Fordon, now part of Bydgoszcz] envoy, Lewek of Jarocin envoy, Falcek of Kępno envoy, Szczęsny of Kępno envoy, Majer of Warta envoy, Izak of Warta envoy, Marek of Czochaczew [Sochaczew] envoy, Marek of Brześć Kujawski envoy Lewek Kazan envoy of idem, Janasz of Szrym [Śrem] envoy, Mnasiam of Szr]ym envoy, Mojżesz of Kcynia envoy, Jakub of Kcynia envoy, Samuel of Dobrzyń envoy, Byniamin of Dobrzyń envoy, Wulf of Litomiersk [Lutomiersk] envoy, Jochim of Lutomierz envoy, Fajbis of Oborniki envoy, Jakub Szkolny of Rogoźno envoy, Izak of Kobylin envoy, Mojżesz of Chodzież envoy, Mojżesz of Chodzież envoy, Marek of Kaźmierza [Kazimierz near Lutomiersk] envoy, Anszył of Kowal envoy, Szczęsny of Nowe Miasto envoy, Michał of Margolin [Margonin] envoy, Józef of Borek [onow part of Ostrzeszów] envoy, Michał of Kargowa envoy, Józef of Miłosław envoy

Title: Protective universal of King Jan Kazimierz to Crown Jews
Manifest: King Jan Kazimierz Vasa informs that due to the calming of the situation in the country he has issued universals encouraging Jews who fled to Silesia and Brandenburg because of war to come back and settle again. He forbids starosts and municipal councils to collect overdue rental fees and taxes for the time of the Jews’ absence.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Castle court files of Gniezno
Reference Number: APP, Gnieźnieńskie Gr. 141, s. 319rv
Surnames: Jakub, Jan Kazimierz Waza, Olszewski Andrzej, Samuel Słoma
Notes:
Tyt.: Oblata litterarum universalium SRM. Do oblaty w aktach grodzkich gnieźnieńskich podali 28 VI 1659 Samuel Słoma i Jakub Żydzi
gnieźnieńscy.

Title: Letter of Treasurer Sedlnicki on the argument between the Zamość Entailed Estate and the Chełm-Bełz land
Manifest: Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki received a complaint from the land elders of the Zamość Entailed Estate and, in response, he reprimands Heszel, a trustee of Crown Jews, and other Chełm-Bełz land elders for not informing the Jews of the Zamość Entailed Estate about the congress of Crown Jews in Konstantynów during which the delegates of the Bełz voivodeship and the Chełm land, together with the Jews of the Zamość Entailed Estate, should deliberate, prepare an allocation, and elect land officials from among themselves. He orders an immediate end to the existing conflict.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Krasnystaw castle court files (Księgi grodzkie krasnostawskie)
Reference Number: APL, CRRMO 43, s. 1381v-1382r, APL, CRRMO 55, s. 695rv
Geographical Names: Belz (Bełz), Chełm (Chelm), Konstantynów, Krasnystaw, Warsaw (Warszawa), Zamosc
Surnames: Heszel Rabinowicz, Sedlnicki Karol Odrowąż
Notes: Heszel, przyp. Heszel Rabinowicz z Chełma [Jehoszua Heszel syn Samuela z Krakowa], starszy chełmski, starszy ziemski chełmsko-bełski, w latach 1726-1747 pisarz generalny i wiernik generalny Żydów koronnych, na kongresie 1739 r. marszałek Żydów koronnych
Tags: dekret (wyrok), dyspartyment (taryfa), korespondencja, podskarbi, sejm żydowski (kongres), ziemstwo chełmsko-bełskie, ziemstwo ordynacji zamojskiej

Title: Oblata of Radom tribunal decree on the fiscal affiliation of Jews from the Owrucz poviat
Manifest: The Radom treasury tribunal, in compliance with the treasury resolution of 1718, forbids Jews from the Owrucz poviat at the Lithuanian border to pay the Jewish poll tax to the Pińsk kahal for Lithuanian army purposes. Moreover, the tribunal admits that the Ostróg kahal has unlawfully usurped jurisdiction over Jews from the Kiev voivodeship since 1647, and it decides to reestablish independent kahals in Cudnów and Chabno. The tribunal orders Ostróg Jews to prepare an allocation based on which the Crown treasury will issue assignations directly to those kahals.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Kiev castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kijowskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 2, op. 1, sp. 39, s. 284r-285r

Surnames: Żukowski Paweł
Notes: Ekstrakt z ksiąg ziemskich radomskich, podał do oblaty w księgach grodzkich kijowskich 4 XI 1747 r. Paweł Żukowski. Oblata dekretu radomskiego z wpisaniem deklaracyi in rem palatinatus Kijoviensis.

Title: Royal privilege for the general scribe of Crown Jews, Fiszel Lewkowicz
Manifest: King Jan III Sobieski issues a universal for the army in which he proclaims that Fiszel Lewkowicz, a Jew from Włodzimierz elected at the Jewish Council as general scribe, is protected by the king and that his house and wealth are free from any contributions for the military.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 28, op. 1, sp. 133, s. 1291rv
Surnames: Fiszel Lewkowicz, Jan III Sobieski, Taranowski Krzysztof
Notes: Do akt grodzkich włodzimierskich podał 14 VI 1688 r. Fiszel Lewkowicz obywatel włodzimierski, pisarz skarbowy ”do wybierania podatków od Żydów w państwach koronnych zostających obrany”.

Title: Protestation of the Jews from Dobromil against the land elders of the Przemysl region from Jarosław and Przeworsk
Manifest: Mendel Berkowicz from Dobromil, a senior of the Przemyśl poviat and region, on his behalf as well as the seniors of Dobromil: Wulf Berkowicz and Wulf Drohobycki, and the Jewish community of Dobromil protests against rabbi Mendel, Major Berkowicz and Janusz Józefowicz from Jarosław, rabbi Meloch Michałowicz, Hyrsk Józefowicz from Przeworsk, the poviat senior of Przemyśl, appointed to set the poll tax tariffs. In accordance with the mandates of the treasurer, the elders of Dobromil announced the elders of Jarosław and Przeworsk, who had convened an assembly to the village of Ostrowa where, in accordance with the mandates, they were to issue a disposition concerning the poll tax of 4,500 złp from Dobromil, while the elders of Przeworsk and Jarosław asked for the postponement of the regional assembly, however within two years the elders of Jarosław and Przeworsk did not convene any regional assembly and did not execute the provisions of the mandates. They protest, claiming that a deposit of 200 red zloties should be paid and that the community of Dobromil is not able to pay 4,500 złp of the poll tax due to poverty.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Przemysl castle court files (Księgi grodzkie przemyskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 13, op. 1, sp. 587, s. 451, 452
Surnames: Janusz Józefowicz, Major Berkowicz, Meloch Michałowicz, Mendel Berkowicz, Wulf Berkowicz, Wulf Drohobycki

Title: Declaration of the shames and cantor on behalf of the Włodzimierz kahal regarding treasury assignations
Manifest: Marek Lejbowicz, shames (szkolnik), and Ejzer Moszkowicz, cantor, declare on behalf of the Włodzimierz kahal that Włodzimierz Jews are ready to pay the treasury assignation of 700 zlotys issued by the crown treasury to their community, whereas the kahal is not responsible for the Rabbi of Włodzimierz Szowel Jakubowicz, the trustee of the Volhyn Jews, to whom the assignation for the amount of 1,600 zlotys was issued.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)

Surnames: Ejzer Moszkowic, Jaślikowski Antoni, Lejba Szmujłowicz, Marek Lejbowicz, Szowel Jakubowicz

Title: Declaration of August Sułkowski against Wojciech Miaskowski, voivode of Kalisz
Manifest: August Sułkowski, the starost of Nowy Dwór and the son of Aleksander Józef Sułkowski, heir of Leszno, declares against Wojciech Miaskowski, voivode of Kalisz in the matter of the violation of the heirs’ prerogatives by sending suits to the Leszno community and in the matter of the decree issued in Lubasz on 13 May 1762 and unlawful convocation of the Jewish regional council.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Wschowa castle court files (Księgi grodzkie wschowskie)
Reference Number: APP, Wschowskie Gr. 2018, s. 183r

Notes: Według oblaty w tych samych aktach grodzkich wschowskich dekret w Lubaszu został wydany 3 V 1762.

Title: Declaration of the Lviv community against the Czortków Jews
Manifest: Declaration of the Lviv elders Marek Bracławski and Moszek Menkis against Joachim Potocki, the general-lieutenant of the Crown army and heir to the Czortków estate, and Czortków Jews in the matter of unjustly involving the Lviv community in their case against the land elders of the Ruthenian voivodeship regarding the excessive burdening of the Jewish population of Czortków with poll tax in the Radom treasury tribunal (none of the Lviv Jews sits among the Ruthenian land elders).

Fond: Lviv castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lwowskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 9, op. 1, sp. 590, s. 2383-2384

Tags: manifestacja, trybunał skarbowy radomski, ziemstwo ruskie

Title: Resolution of Radom treasury tribunal on the general scribe of Greater Poland
Manifest: The Radom treasury tribunal, as a result of violating the prerogatives of the grand crown treasurer, forbids the appointment of Jews without the treasury’s permission to perform as general scribe. The Radom treasury tribunal also confirms Dawid Mankiewicz, the current general syndic of Jews from the Poznań and Kalisz poviats, as a scribe in the Greater Poland province based on treasurers’ appointments from December 2, 1719 and November 11, 1721.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Castle court of Inowroclaw files
Reference Number: APP, Inowrocławskie Gr. 75, s. 1005, 1006
Surnames: Dawid Mankiewicz, Iczek Mankowicz, Mikułowski Remigian, Przebendowski Jan Jerzy
Notes: W księgach grodzkich inowrocławskich oblatował 6 VII 1726 Iczek Mankowicz Żyd inowrocławski.
Tags: dekret (wyrok), trybunał skarbowy radomski, ziemstwo wielkopolskie

Title: Declaration of the Jews of the Zamość Entailed Estate against the Chełm and Bełz Jewish elders
Manifest: Lejba Aronowicz, the general plenipotentiary of the Jews of the Zamość Entailed Estate and elder of the Włodzimierz poviat Jews, declares in their name against the land elders of Chełm and the Bełz Voivodeship, and especially their marshal, Abraham, and Fiszel, the general scribe, regarding their failure to implement the decree of the Jewish arbitration court of 21 May 1721 and the settlement of 23 July 1721 approved by the Crown treasurer and the lack of response by the two abovementioned elders to the same treasurer’s letter in the matter of putting an unfair burden of wyderkauf and taxes on the communities of the Zamość Entailed Estate.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Horodlo castle court files (Księgi grodzkie horodelskie)

Title: Universal of Sandomierz Voivode Jan Tarło to land elders on the Kraków land rabbi
Manifest: Jan Tarło orders all land elders of the Sandomierz voivodeship, and particularly Haszkiel from Opatów, Haszkiel from Tarnów, and Major from Pińczów, to come to Opole on July 1, 1742, to explain the reasons for their disobedience towards the Kraków land rabbi.

Title: Testimony of Aaron Abramowicz accused of conspiracy against the land rabbi
Manifest: Interrogation of Aaron Abramowicz from Nowy Wiśnicz, a servant of the land rabbi, accused of conspiracy against the land rabbi of Kraków, on the basis of the questions prepared by the instigator of the Voivode court. He describes the activities of the rabbis of Nowy Korczyn, Stopnica, and Wodzisław who, together with the Ickowicz brothers, the leaseholders from Słuck, sought to remove Dawid Szmelka from the office and appoint Józef Icek Jonowicz, Szmujła Ickowicz's son-in-law. Aaron claimed that he had been forced by them to collect signatures against Dawid Szmelka and blamed Haskel Wulfowicz from Tarnów, the marshal of the land, who urged the land elders to sign and choose a new rabbi during the regional council in Tarłów.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv

Title: Attestation of Franciszek Lubomirski for the elders Przemyśl poviat
Manifest: Franciszek Lubomirski, a colonel of the Crown army and heir of Łańcut, at the request of the Przemyśl poviat elders, declares after the Jewish council in Łańcut that Józef Boruchowicz, removed from the office of poviat elder, had committed a tax offense and the receipts and assignations that he had issued should be considered void.

Title: Consent of Sandomierz Voivode Jan Tarło for Dawid Szmelka in the office of Kraków land rabbi
Manifest: Jan Tarło confirms Dawid Szmelka in the office of land rabbi as the charges against him were not confirmed and orders all Jews to obey Szmelka.

Title: Fragments of the voivode court record in the case of Dawid Szmelka, the land rabbi
Manifest: In view of the failure to appear before the voivode court of some of the land elders, led by Marshal Haszkiel Wolfowicz from Tarnów, in the court case regarding the attempt to dismiss the land rabbi, Dawid Szmelka, and establish a new one – Józef Icek Jonowicz, the court imposes banishment on them, orders the detention of their property, and removes them from their offices. In the case of Dawid Szmelka and other land elders, who did appear on the date appointed by the voivode, the court releases them from the charges, confirms them on their offices and orders the convocation of the Jewish assembly to Pińczów to select new elders in place of the removed ones within four weeks.

Manifest: Michał Kazimierz Radziwiłł wojewoda wileński, hetman wielki litewski i Żydzi żółkiewscy pozywają do trybunału skarbowego radomskiego Icka Rabinowicza, rezydującego w Tarnopolu bez zgody Radziwiłła, Berka Rabinowicza, Gdala Brodzkiego, Józefa Lejbowicza,  Marka Rabinowicza pisarza generalnego, starszych ziemskich w sprawie pozbawienia Żydów żółkiewskich urzędu marszałka ziemstwa, bowiem zgodnie z dawnymi prawami uchwalonymi na sejmiku ziemstwa starsi powinni wybrać marszałka spośród Żydów żółkiewskich.

Title: Re-protestation of the Nowy Sącz kahal against the Kraków Steward Stanisław Łętowski and Jews from Bobowa
Manifest:
The elders of the Nowy Sącz community re-protest against Stanisław Łętowski, the Kraków steward and the heir of the town of Bobowa, and the Jews from Bobowa regarding the minor kahal breaking away from their jurisdiction. The Nowy Sącz elders complained that the Jews of Bobowa stopped paying Jewish
and public taxes, as well as debts and wyderkauf (about 5 thousand zlotys paid annually for 5 years, 1000 zlotys a year) incurred by the superior community, making all payments directly to the hands of the Kraków-Sandomierz land elders. In addition, they accused them of unlawfully setting up their own Jewish
cemetery and burying their dead without the consent of the Nowy Sącz community and land elders.
Archive: The National Archives in Krakow
Fond: Nowy Sącz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie sądeckie)
Surnames: Herszla Aranowicz, Herszla Jachymowicz, Icyk Jeleniowicz, Jakob Józefowicz, Jakob Mojżeszowicz, Jakob Szymonowicz, Matusz Berkowicz, Łętowski Stanisław

Title: Letter from Grand Crown Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki to the marshal of the Kraków-Sandomierz land
Manifest: Crown Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki orders Marshal Marek Dukielski and the land elders of Kraków and Sandomierz not to singlehandedly impose new tax burdens on communities in the land, especially on Opatów. The land elder whose actions lead to a trial in the treasury tribunal is to be held personally responsible. The treasurer also prohibits the marshal from paying for the expenses of land elders without his consent.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Gospodarcze Wilanowskie

Notes: Kopia uwierzytelniona z podpisem wójta Antoniego Opackiego i pisarza opatowskiego Antoniego Sowińskiego, druga kopia, ibidem, s. 8.

Title: Letter of Chaim Lewkowicz to Marcin Zamoyski, the Crown treasurer
Manifest: Chaim Lewkowicz, on behalf of the Crown elders, informed Marcin Zamoyski, the Crown treasurer, that they were waiting with the return of the allocation of the Jewish poll tax to the Crown Treasury until their meeting. He asked for directions where he should come, and in the event of postponing the meeting until the treasurer arrived from Radom, he suggested sending back the allocation of the May payment to the treasury. He asked for the protection of the treasurer against the activities of noble dietines, which imposed taxes on Jews.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Zamoyskich (AZ)
Reference Number: AGAD, AZ 491, s. 57r-58v
Surnames: Chaim Lewkowicz, Plaskowski Franciszek, Zamoyski Marcin

Title: Decree of the Kraków-Sandomierz elders with the approval of the treasurer regarding the dispute between the Działoszyn community and their leaseholders
Manifest: The elders at the regional council in Pacanów responded to the complaint of Działoszyn elders regarding the arendators from nearby villages, who refused to pay the double poll tax because of impoverishment, and confirmed the old land judgements, under which all Jews living within 4 Polish miles of Działoszyn were subordinated to the Działoszyn community. In addition, they were obliged to pay taxes through their own community, where they also had to attend religious services. The land decree provided that the Działoszyn elders will be free to issue to their leaseholders assignments to pay the poll tax of the same amount as those issued by the tax administration. Under the threat of a curse, Jews from neighboring villages were forbidden to perform private religious services. Land elders stressed that one should not give protection to those Jews who do not want to pay taxes in their land or conduct religious practices in a city that is not part of the Kraków-Sandomierz land. The decree was approved by the grand treasurer of the Crown, Jan Jerzy Przebendowski.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Księgi grodzkie wieluńskie
Reference Number: AGAD, Wieluńskie Gr. Rel. 68, s. 120rv

Title: Letter of Plaskowski, the Trembowla cupbearer, to Marcin Zamoyski, the treasurer, in the matter of the Jewish poll tax
Manifest: Franciszek Plaskowski reported that Jews in the entire Crown, relying on the treasurer’s universal, do not want to pay poll tax in a good coin (silver), but only in copper coins; he advises repealing the universal.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Zamoyskich (AZ)
Surnames: Plaskowski Franciszek, Zamoyski Marcin, Zamoyski Marcin

Title: Letter of Chaim Lewkowicz to Marcin Zamoyski, the Crown treasurer
Manifest: Chaim Lewkowicz, on behalf of other Crown elders, confirmed the readiness to come and reward the treasurer for his protection (grace), but, he explained, that they could not come because of Zamoyski’s departure to Warsaw when the king was in Jaworów. He also reported that they had allocated 6,000 zlotys from the May installment for the treasurer, and that they were ready to hand over to him, personally, the assignations to the Jews of Kraków, Lublin, and Chełm. Regarding the allocation of the Jewish poll tax, he reported that the allocation into the May installment was sent back, while the August installment would be sent back after the meeting with the treasurer.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Zamoyskich (AZ)

Title: Letters from the Crown treasury regent to Marek Dukielski, marshal of the Kraków and Sandomierz land
Manifest: The Crown Treasury Regent Stanisław Płoszczyński informs Marek Dukielski that numerous complaints regarding land elders are being voiced to the Crown treasurer. Płoszczyński orders that the land elders be closely supervised and warns that bad governance in the land may lead to a special order of the treasury. In addition, due to the intervention of the Lublin voivode in the case of the Opatów Jews, he advises concluding a settlement with them.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Gospodarcze Wilanowskie

Title: Declaration of Nowy Sącz elders against the Kraków-Sandomierz land elders regarding the failure to keep their promise and overestimation of the poll tax rate
Manifest: Nowy Sącz elders declare against Marshal Marek Chaimowicz and Kraków--Sandomierz land elders for breaking the agreement between the parties concluded during the land congress in Dąbrowa Tarnowska (1746). According to this agreement, the Nowy Sącz community should pay annually no more than 1,300 zlotys in one unit of account (the so-called komput paid for the annual poll-tax amount) together with the Bobowa community 160 zlotys and Nowy Sącz elders could allow land elders to collect taxes directly from the Bobowa community bypassing the community of Nowy Sącz. After two years, the land elders, breaking this agreement, ordered the Nowy Sącz community to pay 2,000 zlotys to the quarter tax treasury, and the latter, refusing, turned to Stanisław Lubomirski, the Crown steward and the starost of Nowy Sącz. The Nowy Sącz kahal sent its plenipotentiaries to the land congress to Stopnica (1754), but the elders of the land delayed the congress, exposing delegates to the accommodation costs of 80 zlotys and forcing them to leave. Thanks to the efforts of Józef Michałowicz Bunel, a Nowy Sącz elder who was the only one to remain at the regional council, another agreement was concluded, according to which the Nowy Sącz kahal would be obliged to pay 10 units of account (komputy) of 150 zlotys each annually and would be released from paying additional sums by land elders. However, this agreement was not kept either, because they were required to pay more than 20 units of account.
Archive: The National Archives in Krakow
Fond: Nowy Sącz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie sądeckie)
Geographical Names: Bobowa, Dabrowa Tarnowska, Nowy Sącz, Stopnica
Surnames: Józef Michałowicz Bunel, Lubomirski Stanisław, Marek Chaimowicz

Title: Universal of Tomasz Antoni Zamoyski, heir of the Zamość Entailed Estate, on increasing the number of delegates for Jewish conventions
Manifest: In response to Jewish supplications, Tomasz Antoni Zamoyski, the heir of the Zamość Entailed Estate, established that Jews from the towns of the Zamość Entailed Estate, i.e. Zamość, Tomaszów, Tarnogród, Szczebrzeszyn, and Turobin, will always choose two representatives (these could also be people related to each other with the exception of brothers and stepbrothers). He also held to the principle that the remaining communities which so far had not had this privilege should not send representatives to councils and set the allowance rates for delegates to cover the costs of their travel and meals of 20 zlotys (the former to be paid from the treasury of the affiliated community and the latter from the land budget).
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Zamoyskich (AZ)
Reference Number: AGAD, AZ 610, s. 8, 9

Title: Decree of the Greater Poland elders regarding the Płock rabbi
Manifest: Greater Poland elders gathered at the regional council in Krotoszyn in connection with the complaint concerning the rabbi of Płock, submitted to them by the Sierpc kahal, ordered both parties to come to the September council to explain their case to the court. In the event that the curse imposed on the town of Sierpc turned out to be unjustified, land elders decided to nullify it, ordering the rabbi of Płock to revoke it in the synagogue through the Płock shames. Jews from Sierpc were ordered to pay the refundable deposit of 150 zlotys, which would be paid to the rabbi of Płock if their complaint turned out to be unfounded.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Księgi grodzkie łęczyckie
Reference Number: AGAD, Łęczyckie Gr. Rel. 201, s. 409rv

Surnames: Józef Aron, Lewek Lejba, Lewek Markowicz, Masio syn rabina, Maśko Zelkowicz, Szmul
Notes: W księgach grodzkich łęczyckich oblatowano 1 VI 1726.

Title: Resolution of the treasury tribunal in Radom on the Jewish poll tax
Manifest: The Radom treasury tribunal forbids Crown Jews from border communities to pay the Jewish poll tax to the Lithuanian treasury. Due to the location of border kahals in the Lithuanian allocation and Volhyn Jews, the court orders the Volhyn elders to send on St. Michael’s Day (September 29th) two or three appraisers to any town in the Kiev voivodeship and, together with appraisers from the Kiev communities, they should make a new poll tax allocation in a proportional way. In accordance with the treasury order from 1747, the poll tax from Volhyn Jews should be divided for six poviats. In the case of problems with paying assignations, deputies should make claims against local Jews and not appeal to Volhyn elders.
Archive: The National Archives in Krakow
Fond: Archiwum Mlynowskie Chodkiewiczow (AMCh)

Notes: Widymus z ksiąg grodzkich owruckich, do których podał ekstrakt z akt trybunalskich 13 XI 1749 Lejba Lemowicz.

Title: Universal of Jan Stanisław Jabłonowski, Ruthenian voivode, on convening a Jewish council
Manifest: As a result of the attachment to the Ruthenian land of the previously separated kahals, which temporarily formed a separate Podolian land, Ruthenian Voivode Jan Stanisław Jabłonowski, in agreement with the Podole voivode Stefan Humiecki, summons a Jewish council on June 10 to Bóbrka near Lviv to regulate tax issues and to create a new allocation of the Jewish poll tax.

Title: Certificate of the Włodzimierz elders granted for the benefit of the Łokacze kahal
Manifest: During the Jewish council in Świniuchy, called to establish the tariff of poll tax, land elders of the Włodzimierz poviat testify that insubordinate leaseholders (innkeepers from the villages of Buszkowice, Woryszcze and Wola Zahorowska) are under the authority of the Łokacze kahal and are obliged to pay taxes through it.

Title: The resolution of the Greater Poland elders maintaining the authority of the Łęczyca kahal over rural leaseholders
Manifest: Greater Poland land elders gathered at the Jewish council in Leszno forbade the kahals of the Jewish towns near Łęczyca the practice of separation of local rural leaseholders from the community of Łęczyca and ordered obedience to the local rabbi. Under the threat of a curse, Jews from these towns were obliged to pay their fiscal burdens as well as wyderkauf dues of the Łęczyca community.

Title: Treasury ordinance on executing the Jewish poll tax in the Volhyn land
Manifest: Grand Crown Treasurer Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski forbids treasury deputies (so called assignation holders) to charge Volhyn land elders with the cost of the implementation of treasury assignations. Deputies with Crown treasury assignations had been obliged to address Volhyn land elders first. Only after receiving an allocation from them were they allowed to collect taxes from particular Jewish town and townlets. Particular communities had been obliged to pay the provision for the deputy and his men and horses (during the time of execution of assignations, 8 złotys per day) and to compensate their work and cover their travel costs with 30 zlotys per week.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 28, op. 1, sp. 141, s. 705v-707r
Surnames: Lejba Kielmanowicz, Lubomirski Hieronim Augustyn
Notes: W księgach grodzkich włodzimierskich oblatował 7 V 1696 Lejba Kielmanowicz syndyk włodzimierski.

Title: Resolution of the Radom tribunal on the Jewish poll tax
Manifest:
The Radom treasury tribunal forbids land elders to overcharge particular kahals (according to Jarosław tariff and voivodeship allocations); the inclusion in allocations of places where Jews do not live and of insolvent communities; and the joining and detaching of minor settlements. Deputies of the company who
have assignations are obliged to execute taxes directly in small towns and not from land elders. In cases of land owners helping Jews to avoid paying the poll tax, deputies should act against them in castle courts and sue them in the Radom tribunal. Kahals should act similarly against land elders if the poll tax is inflated. Land elders are obliged to give their allocations to the Crown treasury on September 15th under the threat of executing the amounts from land elders themselves.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Archive of Potocki Family (Fond 49)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 49, op. 2, sp. 1658, s. 1r-2v

Title: Universal of Crown Treasurer Mikołaj Daniłowicz on the Jewish taxes
Manifest: Grand Crown Treasurer Mikołaj Daniłowicz, exempts Crown Jews from paying all other taxes as a result of their payment of the agreed upon amount of the poll tax to the treasury.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Poznańskie Gr. 670, s. 1404v, 1405r
Surnames: Daniłowicz Mikołaj
Notes: W księgach grodzkich poznańskich oblatowano 19 X 1621.

Title: Universal of Zygmunt III Vasa on the Jewish poll tax
Manifest: King Zygmunt III forbids the tax collectors from collecting any taxes from Crown Jews since the Warsaw diet in 1631 has imposed on them a Jewish poll tax of 45 thousand zlotys.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Poznan castle court files (Księgi grodzkie poznańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Poznańskie Gr. 677, s. 600rv
Surnames: Zygmunt III Waza
Notes: Oblatowany 16 VI 1631 w aktach grodzkich poznańskich.

Title: Manifestacja deputata chorągwi Cieńskiego przeciw marszałkowi i starszym ziemskim chełmskim
Manifest: Maciej Bielewicz towarzysz i deputat choragwi pancernej [Wojciecha] Cieńskiego miecznika żydaczowskiego manifestuje przeciw Maciejowi Gorlickiemu byłemu towarzyszowi tej chorągwi oraz marszałkowi Hajzykowi rabinowi wodzisławskiemu, Zelkowi Hirszowiczowi, Zawelowi Szymonowiczowi starszym ziemskim chełmskim. Gorlicki mając pretensje do chorągwi nałożył bezprawny areszt na należne od starszych ziemskich pieniądze, ci zaś nie wypłacili pod tym pretekstem pogłównego żydowskiego na podstawie asygnacji skarbowej.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie)
Reference Number: APL, KGCH 51, s. 386rv [dok. 228]
Surnames: Bielewicz Maciej, Cieński Wojciech, Gorlicki Maciej, Hajzyk, Zawel Szymonowicz, Zelko Herszowicz

Title: Resignation of Marek Józefowicz from the office of the Greater Poland land scribe
Manifest: Abram and Hersz, shamesim (szkolnicy) of the Kalisz kahal, listened to a solemn oath made by Marek Józefowicz resigning from the function of the Kalisz land scribe. Marek Józefowicz declared that he would come to the summons of Poznań’s elders to Poznań on 5 VIII 1686 to settle his accounts. He promised to hand over all receipts and debt securities to the Kalisz elders, as well as books of contributions and tariffs from 1672, and cancel the charges against them. He also assured that in November 1686 he would appear at the arbitration court to settle mutual disputes between himself, the main kahals of the land, and private Jews. He promised that he would not sue the Greater Poland elders in the court of Crown elders. In order to ensure that the conditions of his oath were met, he agreed on a deposit of 2,000 ducats payable respectively to the treasury of the Kalisz voivode and poor Jews. Until the dispute was settled by the arbitral tribunal, the house, shops, and claims of the former scribe were to be secured with a record for the benefit of the Kalisz land elders.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 298, s. 633r-634v
Surnames: Abraham, Hersz, Marek Józefowicz, Pigoński Stanisław
Notes: W księgach grodzkich kaliskich oblatował 12 IV 1687 Hersz szkolnik kaliski w imieniu Żydów kaliskich i starszych ziemskich wielkopolskich.

Title: Pozew do trybunału skarbowego dla starszych ziemskich chełmsko-bełskich względem zawyżenia wymiaru podatku gminie w Tarnogórze
Manifest: Dawid Szajowicz starszy tarnogórski pozywa do trybunału skarbowego w Radomiu Abrama Chaimowicza marszałka Żydów koronnych, Hajzyka z Wodzisławia, Wulfa Pietruszkę rabina witkowskiego, Herszka z Lubomli starszych ziemskich chełmsko-bełskich, którzy mimo wydanego dekretu sądu asesorskiego (1743 r.) podjęli na kongresie żydowskim w Jarosławiu (1754 r.) o podwyższeniu zruinowanej gminie w Tarnogórze stawki pogłównego. Starsi ziemscy nie uwzględnili faktu, że dotychczasowa, korzystniejsza stawka obowiązywała w okresie, gdy Żydzi z Tarnogóra znajdowali się w lepszej kondycji ekonomicznej, a w międzyczasie część domów uległa zniszczeniu (nie zdołano ich odbudować), zmuszając Żydów do opuszczenia swojego miasteczka.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie)
Reference Number: APL, KGCH 154, s. 53v-54r
Geographical Names: Belz (Bełz), Chełm (Chelm), Jarosław, Liuboml, Radom, Tarnogóra, Witków
Surnames: Abraham Chaimowicz, Dawid Szajowicz, Hajzyk, Herszko, Wulf Pietruszka
Tags: pogłówne, pozew, sejm żydowski (kongres), trybunał skarbowy radomski, ziemstwo chełmsko-bełskie

Title: Judgment of the Jewish council in the case between the Jews of Lviv and Noson Abrahamowicz
Manifest:
Crown elders at the Council of the Four Lands in Jarosław recognized the grievances of the elders of both Lviv communities against Noson Abrahamowicz, a former Lviv Jew residing in Zhovkva, who pledged to live in Lviv and pay all his duties there. After honoring the oath confirming the validity of the claims by
two Lviv elders, they obtained the right to pursue their claims against Noson, his heirs, or the Zhovkva elders and the local burial society. The Crown elders forbade the burial of Noson until his obligations were paid.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Lviv castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lwowskie)

Title: Pozew do trybunału radomskiego przeciwko starszym ziemskim chełmsko-bełskich i ich protektorom z powództwa synów kasztelana słońskiego Miera
Manifest: Bracia Józef Mier starosta trzciński i Jan Mier kasztelanic słoński, synowie zmarłego Wilhelma Miera kasztelana słońskiego pozywają do trybunału skarbowego w Radomiu Franciszka Salezego Potockiego wojewodę kijowskiego, starostę bełskiego i hrubieszowskiego, Wacława Rzewuskiego hetmana polnego koronnego i wojewodę podolskiego, starostę chełmskiego, Franciszkę z Potockich Rzewuską wdowę po wojewodzie wołyńskim Sewerynie Rzewuskim a zarazem starościnę lubomelską, Michała Łosia kasztelana lwowskiego i dziedzica dóbr Narol, Adama Rostowskiego starostę tyszowieckiego oraz Józefa Izraelowicza rabina [lubomelskiego], Herszka Abrahamowicza z Lubomla, Ejzyka Jaskowicza, Wolfa Nochymowicza Pietruszkę i innych starszych ziemskich chełmsko-bełskich mieszkających w głównych gminach, tj. w Chełmie, Bełzie, Lubomlu, Tyszowcach, Narolu, z żądaniem wypłaty sumy wyderkafowej wraz z prowizją, zgodnie z okazanymi dokumentami (pod groźbą infamii i wolnym chwytaniem), kosztami procesowymi, do której uiszczenia zobowiązali się starsi ziemscy chełmsko-bełscy w kontrakcie zawartym ze zm. kasztelanem słońskim Wilhelmem Mierem, a której windykację utrudniają w/w magnaci, jako dziedzice tych dóbr.

Title: Ugoda pomiędzy gminami w Lubomlu i Maciejowie
Manifest: Rabin i cała gmina lubomelska zawarła ugodę z gminą w Maciejowie [ob. Łuków, Ukraina], w wyniku której uwolniła gminę maciejowską spod swojej jurysdykcji i zrezygnowała z wszelkich należności oraz zrezygnowała z dostarczania rajskich jabłek (etrog) do Maciejowa. Podpisani: Józef rabin lubomelski, Jersz Abrahamowicz starszy ziemski chełmski, Jochen Rabinowicz Moszkowicz starszy kahalny lubomelski, Wolf Boruchowicz starszy kahalny lubomelski, Mendel Hirszowicz starszy kahalny, Berko Bercowicz starszy kahalny, Dawid Froimowicz starszy kahalny, Noech Abraamowicz.

Title: Declaration of the Jews of the Włodzimierz poviat against the trustee of the Volhyn land
Manifest: Icko Oszer Lejbowicz and Berko Aronowicz, on behalf of the elders of the Włodzimierz poviat and kahal, declare against Lejba Szmojłowicz, the rabbi of Krzemieniec and marshal and trustee of Volhyn, who did not arrive at the Jewish council in Tartaków on the appointed date and instead of dividing the amount of 60,000 zlotys owed to the Crown treasury for individual communities of the Volhyn land, he demanded the repayment of the wyderkauf debt owed.

Title: Universal of Kazimierz Włostowski to the Jews of Greater Poland
Manifest: Kazimierz Włostowski, treasury scribe, extends the deadline of a council that he convoked by six weeks, since the delegates of the Greater Poland communities had not appeared. He orders them to go to the land scribe in Kalisz first to settle mutual accounts and afterwards to go to Warsaw on August 7, 1705.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)

Title: Pozew do trybunału radomskiego dla starszych ziemskich chełmskich i bełskich w sprawie Żydów z Cieszanowa
Manifest: Michał Wielhorski starosta sielecki, rotmistrz JKM, podkomorzy JKM, dziedzic Cieszanowa oraz Żydzi cieszanowscy przypozywają do trybunału skarbowego radomskiego Oszyję Heszela i Szlomę chełmskich, Hajzyka Pietruszkę, Elko Haszkielewicza bełskich, Nocha, Hirzszka, Berka tyszowieckich i Józefa rabina witkowskiego, starszych ziemskich w sprawie aprobowania i wprowadzenia w życie dekretu komisarskiego z 1753 r. w Jarosławiu, w którym określono wysokość płaconego przez Żydów cieszanowskich pogłównego żydowskiego.

Title: Universal of King Jan Kazimierz to Crown Jews on those avoiding paying the poll tax
Manifest: At the request of Crown Jewish elders, King Jan Kazimierz Vasa forbids the protectionof Jews in towns and villages who are not paying the Jewish poll tax to their elders and their collectors. He orders that all assistance be provided to the elders and warns that those who do not obey this universal will be sued by the Crown prosecutor.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Castle court files of Gniezno
Reference Number: APP, Gnieźnieńskie Gr. 141, s. 442rv
Surnames: Bąkowski Jan Ignacy, Hers Isaakowicz, Jan Kazmierz Waza

Title: Manifestacja poborców gminy chełmskiej przeciw prokuratorowi bonifratrów w Zamościu
Manifest: Erszko Aronowicz i Dawid Zelkowicz poborcy i mieszkańcy Chełmu manifestją przeciwko prokuratorowi konwentu bonifratrów zamojskich, który odebrawszy 24 IX 1754 r. prowizję od kwoty 3000 złp pożyczonej od tegoż konwentu przez starszych ziemskich nie wydał pokwitowania. Gmina chełmska została wyznaczona w dyspartymencie starszych ziemskich do zapłacenia tejże prowizji.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie)

Title: Protective universal of King Jan Kazimierz to Crown Jews
Manifest: Considering acts of war, military requisitions, robberies, and fatalities that have forced many to flee the country, King Jan Kazimierz Vasa, orders both secular and clergy officials and also officers to protect Crown Jews and their wares in cities, towns, and on public roads. For this purpose he orders the severe punishment of those who act against the law and the return of confiscated Jewish items to their rightful owners.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Castle court files of Gniezno
Reference Number: APP, Gnieźnieńskie Gr. 141, s. 318rv
Surnames: Jakub, Jan Kazimierz Waza, Samuel Słoma
Notes: Do oblaty w aktach grodzkich gnieźnieńskich podali 28 VI 1659 Samuel Słoma i Jakub Żydzi gnieźnieńscy.

Title: Protest against the Chełm and Bełz elders regarding unlawful collection of Jewish poll tax from Jews from Uhnów
Manifest: Sebastian Dunin submitted his protest against the Chełm and Bełz elders due to unlawful attack and collection of Jewish poll tax from Uhnów Jews in the amount of 95 zlotys during the Jarosław fair, despite the fact that they were exempt from tax due to harm by fire.

Title: Re-protestation of the Kalisz elders against a Sochaczew Jew in relation to the failure to meet the deadline
Manifest: Mendel Herc, Osier Gitlin, and Marek Korzennik, elders of the Kalisz community, on behalf of the Greater Poland communities re-protest against the creditor of the Greater Poland region, the Sochaczew Jew Jakub Naselewicz, that instead of appearing in Przygodzice in order to settle accounts with them, as agreed with the rabbi of Poznań, he did not keep the agreed deadline and he made an unjust protestation against them in the Kalisz castle court.

Title: Dyspozycja podskarbiego koronnego w sprawie pogłównego od Żydów z Dubienki
Manifest: Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki podskarbi wielki koronny w związku z zawartą ugodą na trzy lata w sprawie wysokości pogłównego żydowskiego przez Żydów z Dubienki z generalnością [Sejmem Czterech Ziem] i ziemstwem chełmsko-bełskim poleca pisarzom skarbu koronnego, aby nie przyjmowali dyspartymentu od starszych ziemskich chełmskich i bełskim, w którym kwota przypadająca na Dubienkę byłaby większa niż 600 złp.

Title: Summons to the treasury tribunal for the rabbis of Ostróg and Krzemieniec and Kiev voivodeship elders regarding tax embezzlement
Manifest: Felicjan Burzyński, the standard-bearer of Owrucz and heir to the Borowa estate, sues in the Radom treasury tribunal those responsible for preparing the poll tax tariff – the Jewish rabbis from Ostróg and Krzemieniec and the kahal elders of Berdyczów, Cudnów, Żytomierz, Owrucz, Wieledniki, Bohusław, Korsuń, and Narodycze – for embezzling the money from this tax and the unlawful (under the pretext of repayment of wyderkauf) increase of the poll tax amount for Borowa, a village of twenty Jews.

Title: Kondemnaty trybunału skarbowego na starszych ziemskich
Manifest: Wyrok trybunalu skarbowego radomskiego nakładający kary infamii : 1 na starszych ziemskich lubelskich z oskarżenia Żyda Chaima za nadmierne obciążenie dóbr Łęczna; 2. Berka Rabinowicza [marszałka ziemstwa ruskiego] z oskarżenia starszych lwowskich o nadmierne obciążene, uwolnienie od płacenia asygnacji wystawionych przez Berka (zwłaszcza dla kolegium jezuitów lwowskich); 3. w sprawie starszych ziemskich lubelskich i marszałka Chaima Abramowicza.

Title: Universal of Jan Kazimierz on overdue poll tax to Volhyn Jews
Manifest:
King Jan Kazimierz announces that treasury matters have been temporarily entrusted to Aleksander Sielski, castellan of Łęczyca. The king orders the elders of the Volhyn voivodeship to arrive in Lviv in two weeks’ time to give an account of the Jewish poll tax established in 1655 which is overdue (including an
additional tax levied for the general levy).The king commands the payment of these taxes under threat of property confiscation for the benefit of the army. He orders that the universal be sent to all places where the elders of Volhyn are gathered, in particular to Dubno.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Lutsk castle court files (Księgi grodzkie łuckie)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 25, op. 1, sp. 128, s. 24v-25v
Surnames: Jan Kazimierz Waza, Sielski Aleksander
Notes: Oblatowany w aktach grodzkich łuckich 16 I 1657.

Title: Pozew do trybunału skarbowego dla starszych chełmsko- bełskich z oskarżenia starszych Ordynacji Zamojskiej
Manifest: Starsi ziemscy Ordynacji Zamojskiej pozywają do trybunału koronnego radomskiego starszych ziemskich ziemi chełmskiej i województwa bełskiego w sprawie kasacji bezprawnie uzyskanej kondemnaty, przywrócenia sprawy do poprzedniego stanu, zwrócenia kosztów i wypłacenia wadiów. Sprawa dotyczyła wyroków z 1 VI 1756 r. pomiędzy [Franciszkiem Salemym] Potockim wojewdą wołyńskim z jednej strony, starszymi ziemskimi Małopolski z drugiej oraz choragwią pancerną [Franciszka Ferdynanda] Lubomirskiego starosty olsztyńskiego z trzeciej strony.

Title: Universal of Crown Treasurer Marek Matczyński on collecting Jewish poll tax in towns subordinated to the Włodzimierz kahal
Manifest: Grand Crown Treasurer Marek Matczyński orders military deputies going to the Jews of Włodzimierz Wołyński to collect the Jewish poll tax to collect only the right amount from the Włodzimierz community based on the regulation passed by Volhyn land elders in the local kahal and only after receiving the assignations based on the tariff created by Włodzimierz kahal elders with the countersignature of the local rabbi. He orders them to collect money from other towns subordinated to the Włodzimierz kahal. The treasurer forbids the deputies to execute the entire tax amount from the Włodzimierz Jews and to overcharge them with lodging fees and provisions for people and horses.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 28, op. 1, sp. 136, s. 1029rv
Surnames: Matczyński Marek
Notes: W księgach grodzkich włodzimierskich oblatował 30 VII 1691 Moszko Izraelowicz syndyk kahału włodzimierskiego.

Title: Pozew do trybunału koronnego lubelskiego
Manifest: Klemens Zamoyski ordynat zamojski, starosta płoskirowski oraz Abram rabin tarłowski i Icko Rabinowicz starsi ziemscy zamojscy [Ordynacji Zamojskiej] przypozywają do trybunału koronnego lubelskiego Stanisława Kostkę Zielińskiego stolnika łomżyńskiego, Jacka Bieleckiego chorążyca czernihowskiego oraz Ejzyka bełskiego, Józefa rabina lubomelskiego, chełmskiego, starszych ziemskich oraz synagogi chełmską i bełską [prawdopodobnie chodzi o tzw. synagogi ziemskie czyli ziemstwa] w sprawie dekretu trybunału koronnego z 1730 r., w tym starszych ziemskich o wypłacenie pozostałej przysądzonej kwoty.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie)

Title: Resolution of the Radom treasury tribunal on improving the collection of the Jewish poll tax
Manifest:
The Crown treasury tribunal forbade land elders to include in allocations insolvent communities and forbade land owners to make poll tax collection more difficult. The deputies could appeal to land elders if the tax is not paid and in contentious cases. The Tribunal prohibited different kahals or lands to enter into
the tax tariff the same minor kahals and so confirmed the right of the Ostróg kahal to supremacy over the sub-kahals of Pików, Winnica, and Lipowiec, which were previously taken by the Jews of the Podole land. Volhyn land elders are not allowed to charge Jewish towns with poll tax over the limit accepted in 1745 at the council of the Jews from the Volhyn voivodeship. It was also agreed that Jews from Nowe Miasto nad Pilicą and from Rawa Mazowiecka will not belong to the Greater Poland land but to the Lublin land.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Kyiv
Fond: Wlodzimierz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie włodzimierskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Kijów, Fond 28, op. 1, sp. 166, s. 1322r-1323v
Geographical Names: Lypovets (near Vynnytsia), Nowe Miasto nad Pilicą, Ostroh (Ostróg), Pikiv (Ukraine), Radom, Rawa Mazowiecka, Vinnytsia (Ukraine)
Surnames: Pacewicz Michał Florian
Notes: W aktach grodzkich włodzimierskich 7 XII 1747 ekstrakt deklaracji trybunału skarbowego radomskiego z 22 VI 1747 oblatował Michał Florian Pacewicz.

Title: Konnotata Marka Rabinowicza pisarza Żydów ruskich na rozkaz pisarza koronnego
Manifest:
Marek Rabinowicz odsyła konnotatę (rozkład wysokości pogłównego żydowskiego na miasta województwa ruskiego), którą sporządził na polecenie pisarza koronnego [prawdopodobnie chodzi o Jerzego Ignacego Lubomirskiego, który zrezygnował w 1732 r., a nie  jego następcę Wacława Rzewuskiego - Leszniów należał do Lubomirskiego] podane przez rabina w Leszniowie, zięcia Marka Rabinowicza na łączną kwotę 12 280 złp.

Title: Protest on behalf of the Jews of the Zamość Entailed Estate against the scribe of the Crown Jews and the elders of the Chełm-Bełz land
Manifest: Mendel Samsonowicz, syndic of Zamość and Izaak Markowicz, Szczebrzeszyn elder, on behalf of the communities of the Zamość Entailed Estate, protest against Fiszel Lewkowicz, the general scribe of the Crown Jews and the elders of the Chełm land and the Bełz voivodeship. The latter allegedly sabotaged the command of the Crown treasurer, Hieronim Augustyn Lubomirski, delaying sending their representatives to the joint commission to conduct a review of the Jewish poll tax allocation and to solve current problems. The new grand Crown treasurer, Jan Jerzy Przebendowski, ordered the general scribe of the Crown Jews to refrain from announcing a new poll tax tariff pending the settlement of mutual disputes by the arbitral tribunal. However, Fiszel Lewkowicz, showing partiality as one of the arbitrators of the court, encouraged an unfavourable sentence for the Jews of the Zamość Entailed Estate. Therefore, disagreeing with him, they demanded he be deprived of his judicial competence and excluded from participation in the procedure of the allocation of poll tax.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Krasnystaw castle court files (Księgi grodzkie krasnostawskie)
Reference Number: APL, CRRMO 40, s. 1012rv
Surnames: Fiszel Lewkowicz, Izaak Markowicz, Lubomirski Hieronim Augustyn, Mendel Samsonowicz, Przebendowski Jan Jerzy
Tags: manifestacja, ziemstwo chełmsko-bełskie, ziemstwo ordynacji zamojskiej

Title: Pozew do trybunału skarbowego dla starszych ziemskich chełmskich i bełskich z oskarżenia gminy w Świrzu
Manifest: Boruch Chaimowicz arendarz, Wolo Gabryrelak, Szmujło Judkowicz, Irszo Hellanowicz mieszkańcy Świrza pozywają do trybunału skarbowego radomskiego Ejzyka rabina wodzisławskiego, Moszka Rabinowicza, Herszko Chamulca, Mendla Herszkowicza i [Józefa Izraelowicza?] rabina lubomelskiego, Ejzyka Josiowicza oraz [Wolfa Nochimowicza Pietruszkę] rabina witkowskiego, a także pozostałych starszych ziemskich ziemi chełmskiej i województwa bełskiego w sprawie nadmiernego obciążenia ich gminy wbrew zawartej 16 VI 1732 r. ugodzie, zgodnie z którą Żydzi w Świrzu winni płacić jedynie 160 złp.

Title: The instrument of the Ruthenian Voivode August Czartoryski for the commissioner for the Jewish regional council in Przemyślany
Manifest:
Ruthenian Voivode August Aleksander Czartoryski announces that he appointed Jan Mikołaj Cieszkowski, a Stężyca pantler, to be his commissioner for the Jewish council (6 October 1752) in his hereditary town, Przemyślany. Due to the financial mismanagement of land elders, the encumbrance of communities
belonging to the voivode’s property with an excessive rate of poll tax, and the drawing of wyderkauf debts without the knowledge of the voivode, the commissioner received special powers to audit the finances of the Ruthenian land. The land marshal was obliged to present him with a statement of land accounts.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Lviv castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lwowskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 9, op. 1, sp. 565, s. 1229, 1230
Surnames: Cieszkowski Jan Mikołaj, Czartoryski August Aleksander, Kuczyński Jan
Notes: W księgach grodzkich lwowskich oblatował 2 V 1753 Jan Kuczyński.

Title: Deklaracja trybunału skarbowego w sprawie egzekucji pogłównego żydowskiego
Manifest: Trybunał skarbowy koronny zabrania asygnatariuszom wybierania całej kwoty pogłównego żydowskiego wyrażonej w asygnacji, ale nakazuje wybierać je w ratach, tak jak zaznaczono to w asygnacji. Popdisany marszałek trybunału Janusz Korybut Wiśniowiecki wojewoda krakowski.

Title: Universal of Treasurer Karol Sedlnicki to the land elders of Greater Poland
Manifest: Under the threat of the imposition of a double tax rate and after arranging a general tariff at the Council of the Four Lands in Jarosław (26 October 1753), Grand Crown Treasurer Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki orders the land elders of Greater Poland to go to Pyzdry on 15 January 1754 to arrange the general allocation (sympla) and the allocation for the city of Poznań and Poznań poviat. He also orders them, with the assistance of the tax commissioner, to calculate and separate from each other the debts attributable to the Crown Jews from the debts owed to the land. He also establishes the method for choosing appraisers (communities paying more than 1000 zlotys tax will be entitled to one appraiser ex officio; communities paying less will select appraisers from among themselves by lot).
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Kalisz castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kaliskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kaliskie Gr. 382, s. 1362, 1363
Surnames: Płoszczyński Stanisław, Sedlnicki Karol Odrowąż, Wróblewski Bartłomiej
Notes: Dokument oblatowany w księgach grodzkich kaliskich przez Bartłomieja Wróblewskiego kustosza skarbu koronnego 14 XII 1753 r.

Title: List Józefa Aleksandrowicza rabina opolskiego do pisarza skarbu koronnego
Manifest: Józef aleksandrowicz rabin opolski, wiernik ziemstwa lubelskiego informuje o odesłaniu dyspartymentu [partykularnego] na przypadającą z podziału pisarzy generalnych kwotę 12 893 złp. Informuje o staraniach Żydów kozienickich o ulgę z powodu pożaru i prosi, aby im nie udzielać dalszej. Jednocześnie prosi, aby bez wiadomości starszych nie dopisywać tzw. partykularzy do dyspartymentów posczególnych kahałów, jak się to stało w przypadu Ryczywołu (dwóch arendarzy po 130 złp w dyspartymencie z poprzedniego roku) z powodu ewentualnych procesów sądowych.
Archive: Diaspora Research Center Tel Aviv
Fond: Raphael Mahler collection P-66
Reference Number: Diaspora Research Center, P-66, 927, 157-2, s. 55, 57
Surnames: Józef Aleksandrowicz

Title: Decision of the congress of the Ruthenian land regarding the amount of poll tax paid by the Lviv community
Manifest: The Jewish marshals of the Ruthenian land, Berek and Józef Czaczkis confirm the resolution of the congress in Bóbrka regarding the amount of Jewish poll tax paid by the Jews of Lviv. Due to the necessity to repay the debts of the land, the amount of the poll tax paid by the community of Lviv, established earlier at the Brzeżany council, was increased by 500 zlotys, with the reservation that this amount will be paid until the debts are paid.
Archive: Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine in Lviv
Fond: Lviv castle court files (Księgi grodzkie lwowskie)
Reference Number: CGIA Lwów, Fond 9, op. 1, sp. 571, s. 3827-3829
Surnames: Berek Rabinowicz, Josef Cymelis, Józef Czaczkis, Rachmil Monaszewicz, Ulanowski Jakub
Notes: Tłumaczenie sporządzone i potwierdzone 19 XI 1755 r. przez burmistrzów [starszych] lwowskich Rachmila Monaszeficza i Josefa Cymelisa oblatował tego samego dnia w aktach grodzkich lwowskich Jakub Ulanowski.

Title: Akt egzekucji przed domem wiernika chełmskiego
Manifest: Tomasz Gorzkowski subdelegat grodzki łucki na zlecenie Michała Józefa Kajetana Majowskiego pisarza grodzkiego łuckiego w związku z kondescencją (sądem zjazdowym) odbytą w Lublinie dn. 10 X 1748 r. w sprawie głównych kahałów, tj. krzemienieckiego, bełskiego, chełmskiego i włodzimierskiego, których starsi nadmiernie obciążyli podatkiem gminy w Horochowie i w Cieszanowie, na rekwizycję Michała Wielhorskiego starosty sieleckiego, dziedzica w/w wzmiankowanych dóbr oraz poszkodowanych Żydów przeprowadził w Chełmie dn. 23 VI 1749 urzędową egzekucję (w obecności świadków Józefa Soroczyńskiego, Mikołaja Parczewskiego, woźnego Hrehorego Uniatskiego) przed otwartymi drzwiami i domem Oszyi Heszela wiernika [ziemskiego] i starszego ziemskiego chełmskiego [chełmsko-bełskiego]. Reprezentując starszych ziemskich chełmsko-bełskich i zarazem w zastępstwie swojego nieobecnego zięcia Oszyi Heszela wystąpił Lejba rabin z Dubienki sprzeciwiając się egzekucji: "[...] Heszla samego w domu nie masz, interes ten do nas nie należy i nie jesteśmy winni nic, więc WMM Pan czyń, co chcesz". Sprawa została więc odesłana celem rozpatrzenia do trybunału koronnego w Lublinie.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin

Surnames: Gorzkowski Tomasz, Lejba, Majowski  Michał Józef Kajetan, Oszyja Heszel, Parczewski Mikołaj, Soroczyński Józef, Uniatski Hrehory

Title: Manifestacja deputata chorągwi pancernej przeciwko starszym ziemskim chełmsko-bełskim i kahałowi chełmskiemu
Manifest: Piotr Koc cześnik latyczowski, deputat chorągwi pancernej [Antoniego Michała] Potockiego wojewody bełskiego manifestuje przeciwko starszym ziemskim chełmsko-bełskim oraz kahałowi chełmskiemu (i innym kahałom), którzy wydali dyspartyment  pogłównego żydowskiego, na podstawie którego udało mu się tylko częściowo wybrać podatek od Żydów z Kryłowa, a inne gminy, zwłaszcza kahał chełmski narazili go na szkody, gdyż niezgodnie  z deklaracją trybunału radomskiego wypłacili wyłącznie dukatach [w czerwonych złotych].

Title: Relacja z egzekucji przeprowadzonej egzekucji przed domem starszego ziemskiego chełmsko-bełskiego
Manifest: Jan Juda Tadeusz Olszewski vicesgerent grodzki grabowiecki przeprowadził w Chełmie dn. 28 IV 1749 r. urzędową egzekucję przed domem starszego ziemstwa chełmsko-bełskiego (i hrubieszowskiego) Heszela Rabinowicza na zlecenie Wilhelma Miera kasztelana słońskiego w obecności świadków Jana Szklińskiego i woźnego Stanisława Nowińskiego w związku kondemnatą trybunału skarbowego radomskiego z 18 VI 1748 r. zasądzoną względem niezapłacenia przez starszych ziemskich chełmsko-bełskich sumy dłużnej wraz z prowizją. Heszel Rabinowicz oświadczył, iż: "Ja nie wiem o żadnym długu anim się podpisywał JW JPanu kasztelanowi słońskiemu na żaden skrypt", udaremniając przeprowadzenie egzekucji i tym samym sprawa została odesłana do trybunału radomskiego.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Chelm castle court files (Księgi grodzkie chełmskie)

Title: Manifestacja starszych ziemskich chełmskich w sprawie długu Męcińskim
Manifest: Zelko Herszowicz, Heszel i Moszeczko Rabinowicze starsi ziemscy chełmscy oraz Daniel Senderowicz syndyk chełmski w swoim oraz innych starszych ziemskich chełmskich i bełskich manifestują przeciw Wojciechowi Męcińskimu i jego żonie Annie z Głogowskich, starostom wieluńskim, spadkobiercom Franciszka Głogowskiego starosty grabowieckiego w sprawie kondescencji w Zamościu nakazanej dekretem trybunału skarbowego radomskiego z 7 VI 1749, na której mieli m.in. przedłożyć oryginał kwitacji za wypłaconą jakoby kwotę 7721 złp (którą dopiero muszą znaleźć wśród papierów poprzednich starszych).

Title: Aprobata przez podskarbiego ugody pomiędzy starszymi ziemskimi bełskimi a kahałem dubienieckim
Manifest: Podskarbi wielki koronny Karol Odrowąż Sedlnicki aprobuje ugodę zawartą pomiędzy starszymi ziemskimi bełskimi a kahałem z Dubienki, dodając, że Żydzi z Dubienki przez trzy kolejne lata będą otrzymywać ulgę w wysokości z 100 złp, od sumy wyznaczonej w dyspartymencie generalnym.

Title: Declaration on behalf of the Włodzimierz kahal against the Łokacze kahal over the sabotage of the new sympla (general allocation)
Manifest: Izrael Lejbowicz, syndic of the Włodzimierz kahal, on behalf of all communities of the Włodzimierz poviat, declares against the Łokacze kahal, which, contrary to the universal of Crown Treasurer Franciszek Maksymilian Ossoliński, refused to participate in the preparation of the new sympla (general allocation) of the poll tax for Włodzimierz poviat in November 1732 and did the same in 1733 at the congress in Ostrożec.

Surnames: Izrael, Izrael Lejbowicz, Ossoliński Franciszek Maksymilian

Title: Summons to the Radom treasury tribunal for the marshal and elders of the Leszno community
Manifest: Summons to the Radom treasury tribunal for the land elders of Leszno and the entire Leszno community and Józef Lewkowicz, the marshal of the Jews of Greater Poland, and the elders of the Kalisz kahal based on accusations of Lejbuś Markowicz, Dawid Mankiewicz, Józef Jachymowicz, and Eliasz Masiek, elders of the Krotoszyn community, who accuse Józef Lewkowicz of occupying the office of the marshal for nine years against law and customs, blocking other candidates, and, in addition of exposing the Krotoszyn community to costs and losses, and of escaping from Krotoszyn when he was to start calculating [them]. The Krotoszyn elders accuse the Leszno land elders and the Leszno community of encumbering 3,000 zlotys in the allocation on the Krotoszyn community.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Wschowa castle court files (Księgi grodzkie wschowskie)
Reference Number: APP, Wschowskie Gr. 204, s. 202r-203v, 205r
Surnames: Dawid Mankiewicz, Eliasz Masiek, Józef Lewkowicz, Józefa Jachymowicz, Lejbuś Markowicz
Notes: Relacja położenia pozwu w aktach grodzkich wschowskich 2 V 1729. Kopia pozwu s. 202r-203v, relacja 205r.
Tags: pozew, trybunał skarbowy radomski, ziemstwo wielkopolskie

Title: Protection letter of Maciej Radomicki, voivode of Inowrocław, for the general syndic of the land of Greater Poland
Manifest: Maciej Radomicki, the voivode of Inowrocław, the general starost of Greater Poland, declares that Dawid Mankiewicz, an Inowrocław citizen, general syndic of the Greater Poland Jews, who in connection with his function decided to settle in Leszno (to facilitate the correspondence with the Crown treasury) is still under his jurisdiction and remains under his protection. Any grievances against the syndic should be directed to him, and he promises to settle them justly.
Archive: The State Archive in Poznan (APP)
Fond: Koscian castle court files (Księgi grodzkie kościańskie)
Reference Number: APP, Kościańskie Gr. 147, s. 157v, 158r
Surnames: Dawid Mankiewicz, Radomicki Maciej
Notes: Oblatował 20 VIII 1723 w aktach grodzkich kościańskich Dawid Mankiewicz.

Title: Letters regarding the Jews of the Zamość Entailed Estate
Manifest: Three letters: In the first one (Zamość, 25 November 1721), the voivode of Kraków, Janusz Antoni Wiśniowiecki, instructs Fiszel Lewkowicz, the general scribe of the Crown Jews, that he should not charge the Zamość Entailed Estate Jews with a higher tariff of the poll tax, because otherwise he would prevent his son from becoming rabbi. In the next two letters, from the Crown treasury scribe [Kasper] Wagner to Fiszel (Warsaw, 6 November 1721) and to the Chełm-Bełz elders (Warsaw, 6 November 1721), Wiśniowiecki demands an end to the dispute between the Zamość Entailed Estate and the Chełm and Bełz elders which was continuing in spite of the concluded settlements (Piaski, 24 May 1721 and Lublin, 20 July 1721), resulting in non-payment of the assignations. He points out that the elders of Chełm and Bełz included in their allocation the communities that did not belong to them, i.e. Krasnobród, Modliborzyce, and Piaski. He reminds that the Crown treasury should receive monetary compensation for the abovementioned villages in accordance with the arrangements made by the parties involved in the dispute. He emphasizes the fact that in the matter of the excessive poll taxation of Biłgoraj Jews, the wife of the Lithuanian sub-chancellor [Izabela Czartoryska, nee Morsztyn] has already filed complaints with the Crown treasury.
Archive: The State Archive in Lublin
Fond: Horodlo castle court files (Księgi grodzkie horodelskie)
Geographical Names: Belz (Bełz), Chełm (Chelm), Cracow (Kraków), Krasnobród, Lublin, Modliborzyce, Piaski, Volodymyr-Volynsky (Włodzimierz Wołyński), Zamosc
Surnames: Czartoryska Izabela, Fiszel Lewkowicz, Tewel Fiszlowicz, Wagner Kasper, Wiśniowiecki Janusz Antoni
Notes: W księgach grodzkich horodelskich oblatował 4 XII 1721 Żyd Nosanowicz. Tytuł: Litterarum Ilustrissimi ducis Wiszniowiecki oblata.

Title: Universal of Adam Mikołaj Sieniawski to Jews from his Podole estates
Manifest: Adam Mikołaj Sieniawski, Kraków castellan, the grand Crown hetman, in connection with the issuance of a privilege in Warsaw on June 1, 1713, by King August II, orders Jews from his Podole estates to obey the Podole voivode and refrain from appealing to the Ruthenian land elders. He orders the Jews from Satanów, Zinków, and Międzybóż to choose land elders from among themselves.

Surnames: August II Wettyn, Humiecki Stefan, Laskowski Antoni, Sieniawski Adam Mikołaj
Notes: Odpis XIX-wieczny z akt grodzkich kamienieckich, Oblatował Antoni Laskowski 20 VI 1713, nr 3963 , s. 293r-294r]

Title: Declaration of the Greater Poland land elders regarding the disobedience of Jews living in the land
Manifest: SGreater Poland land elders report on the disobedience of Jews living in the land of Greater Poland, who, despite universals published three times, did not attend the congress in Osieczna on January 17, 1702, during which the land elders and land rabbi together with delegates of Greater Poland towns were to deal with the problem of repayment of the debts of the land.

Title: Declaration of Greater Poland land elders regarding the invalidity of the claims against the land
Manifest: The land elders of Greater Poland declare the invalidity of all financial claims against them that were not reported during the sitting of the the royal commission for debts of the land, which took place six years before.

Title: Protest against the Włodzimierz kahal and the Volhyn general scribe regarding an unjust distribution of the assignations for the Jews of Kisielin
Manifest: Antoni Pawiliński, the courtier of Wilhelm Eustachy Grothus, the Żmudź castellan, protests against the rabbi, Włodzimierz elders, and Fiszel Lewkowicz, the marshal and the trustee of the Volhyn Jews, in the matter of the excessive burden put on Kisielin Jews during the Jewish council in Łokacze.

Title: Protestation of deputies of the Crown artillery against the land rabbi of Poznań and Kalisz and Krotoszyn land elders
Manifest: Deputies Franciszek Kazimierz Sariusz Kałowski and Kazimierz Wolicki, appointed to collect the Jewish poll tax by the General of the Crown artillery Marcin Kątski, protest against the land rabbi of Poznań and the Kalisz and Krotoszyn land elders, gathered at the regional council in Nowe Miasto nad Wartą, for dividing the tax into 72 Jewish towns in Greater Poland, not taking into account their economic condition and directing them with assignations to collect money from insolvent towns, destroyed by fire or depopulated (Dobra, Lutomiersk, Ostroróg, Margonin, Jastrów, Mrocza, Wolsztyn, Chodzież, Czarnków, Rogoźno, and Oborniki), in which Jews used the protection of the local nobility and magnates, effectively preventing them from execution and thus exposing them to travel-related costs.

Title: Declaration of Kazimierz Łukawski on behalf of the Kaszowski brothers against the Łuck kahal
Manifest: Kazimierz Łukawski declares on behalf of the Kaszowski brothers, the owners of the city of Kaszówka, against the Łuck Jews, whose envoy Lejba Pejsachowicz persecuted Jews and townsmen from Kaszówka during the Żydyczyn fair under the pretext of collecting the due Jewish poll tax.

Title: Manifestation regarding the illegal execution of taxes from the Jews of Włodzimierz Wołyński
Manifest: Manifestation by Jan Makowski on behalf of Jan Kaszowski, the starost of Włodzimierz and the Jews from Włodzimierz against Hieronim Popowski, a companion of the cavalry unit of the Crown Treasurer, Kazimierz Wolski the tax collector, and Szmujło Dawidowicz, a Jew from Ostróg who, in Makowski’s opinion, tried to illegally enforce taxes based on the tariff of the Ostróg Jews. Additionally, Popowski and Wolski invaded the synagogue of Włodzimierz, which they defiled, and caused a lot of damage to the local Jews (about which a report from a local vision by the court beadle was attached).

Title: Certificate of Leopold Winkler, the crown treasury scribe for the Jews of Poznań
Manifest: Leopold Jan Winkler, the Crown treasury scribe, certifies that tax assignations are issued separately to the Poznań community and the Greater Poland land, and that the former are not responsible for the debts of the latter.

Title: Declaration of Baltazar Śliwicki, the Crown treasury scribe, against the Łuck kahal and its patrons regarding the poll tax
Manifest: Baltazar Śliwicki, the Crown treasury scribe sent to collect Jewish poll tax from the Volhyn province, testified against the Łuck Jews and the burgrave of Łuck, who did not allow the payment of the due tax. The Łuck Jews initially offered only 2,000 zlotys and wanted the rest of the tax to be collected from their subordinate towns. In addition, he comes out against Kisielin Jews and their patrons in a similar case.

Title: Register of documents regarding the Land Scribe of Kalisz Marek Józefowicz
Manifest: Marek Józefowicz, land scribe, protested against the land elders of Kalisz, Szymon and Szmajer Gielow, who did not want to return the debt of 20,000 zlotys to him. In addition, the land elders of Kalisz sought to remove him from the office of the scribe, forced him to sign for the receipt of the debt, attacked his house, and expelled his family. In an earlier statement, Marek Józefowicz said that all receipts and oaths in the case with the Jews from Kalisz and Leszno who wanted to remove him from the office of the scribe and refused to pay back the debt were made under duress and were therefore invalid by law.
