Title: Adam Niesiołowski to Zofia Maria Denhoffowa
Manifest: Niesiołowski informs that the Jewish Marshal asked him for the permission to convene a Jewish Assembly in Jaroslaw, but the Ruthenian Voivode would like to have it convened in his province
Archive: The Czartoryski Library in Krakow
Surnames: Denhoff Zofia Maria, Jabłonowski Jan Stanisław, Niesiołowski Adam

Title: Adam Niesiołowski to Jan Królikiewicz
Manifest: Niesiołowski informs that the Jews from Brzeżany went to Warsaw with a supplication, among others with a complaint against the land elders, and asks for support of their postulates, such as the complaint against the Ruthenian land elders; he also writes that previously he had received a condemnata in the Radom tribunal against the Ruthenian land elders for the excessive burdening of the Jews from Brzeżany
Archive: The Czartoryski Library in Krakow
Surnames: Królikiewicz Jan

Title: Mateusz Iliak's letter to NN [probably Franciszek Szumanczewski]
Manifest: Mateusz Iliak, the governor of Satanów, intercedes on behalf the Jew, Nota, conflicted with Mendel, highly appreciating his merits for the property of Sieniawska. As the Marshal at the Assemblies in Sołobkowce, he obtained a reduction of 400 złp for Międzyboże and of 200 złp for Satanow as well as the incorporation of the town of Koźmin
Archive: The Czartoryski Library in Krakow
Surnames: Iliak Mateusz, Sieniawska Elżbieta, Szumanczewski Franciszek

Title: ​Protestation against the land elders of Volhynia concerning and illegally incurred debt
Manifest: Jakub Grochowicki, a plenipotentiary of Paweł Karol Sanguszko, Great Marshall of Lithuania, protests against the agreement concluded by some of the land elders of Volhynia with Stefan Czacki, Volhynian Master of the Hunt. He considers the agreement to be unlawful because, according to him, the land elders have no right to incur debts without the consent of the landlords. He declares, on behalf of his principal, that he does not allow to collect any money for this debt in his property. In the event of the breach of this prohibition he promises to reclaim his rights at court
Archive: The National Archives in Krakow
Fond: Archive of Sanguszko family
Reference Number: ANKr, ASang. teka 21, plik 29
Surnames: Czacki Stefan, Grochowicki  Jakub, Sanguszko Paweł Karol

Title: Universal by Jan Ansgary Czapski, Treasurer of the Crown, regarding the distribution of the Jewish poll tax
Manifest: Jan Ansgary Czapski, Minister of the Crown Treasury, announces to the elders of the Crown and scribes Council of the Four Lands that during the forthcoming assembly, promissory notes must be issued for military expenses, ordering that Jewish poll-tax be distributed no later than August. In addition, he issues a warning that there should be no repetition of the situation which occurred in the community of Ostróg in Volhynia in previous years; the military tax collector was sent to distant villages where there were no longer any Jews since they had all been murdered by hajdamaks and so the deputies could not collect the sums due. Also, he warns Jewish elders of Przemyśl, Tykocin and Węgrów that they themselves should deliver to the military tax collectors the their tax; they are not to send them to village leaseholders, but should instead collect the tax themselves.
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Zamoyskich (AZ)
Reference Number: AGAD AZ sygn. 3077, s. 10
Place of Origin: Warszawa, Warsza, Varsovia, Mokotów, Monkitów k. Warszawy, Monkotów, Praga,  Zbarzy Wielkie, Marywil
Surnames: Czapski Jan Ansgary
Tags: arendarz, pogłówne, uniwersał, wyderkaf, ziemstwo wołyńskie

Title: Register of documents pertaining to the Kozienice community
Manifest: A register of documents pertaining to the matter of whether or not sub-kahals belong to the kahal of Kozienice, and the matter of the extent of the Jewish poll-tax, including a protest against a directive passed at the Jewish assembly. The conclusion states that complaints should be directed to the Treasurer of the Crown, asking him to confirm that Grójec and other townships belong to the Kozienice kahal
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Kameralne
Reference Number: AGAD, Archiwum Kameralne 200, s. 84-88, AGAD, Archiwum Kameralne, s. 89-90.
Geographical Names: Grójec, Jarosław, Kozienice, Lublin, Nowe Miasto nad Pilicą
Surnames: August II Wettyn, Ossoliński Franciszek Maksymilian, Sedlnicki Karol Odrowąż
Notes: Dokument niedatowany, po 4 XI 1754

Title: Letter by Piotr Gordon, vice-viovode of Cracow to Jan Klemens Branicki, Great Crown Hetman, voivode of Cracow
Manifest: Piotr Gordon, vice-voivode of Cracow, on behalf the Kazimierz kahal, asks Jan Klemens Branicki, voivode of Cracow, to address a letter to the judges of the Crown Treasury Tribunal in Radom, requesting the confirm the ruling passed by the Jewish assembly and pertaining to the expansion of the territorial competence of the Kazimierz kahal to include the Jews residing within two miles of the town
Archive: The Central Archives of Historical Records in Warsaw
Fond: Archiwum Roskie
Reference Number: AGAD, Archiwum Roskie, VII/8, s. 156-157

Surnames: Branicki Jan Klemens, Gordon Piotr, Lanckoroński Maciej

Title: A register of documents from the Treasury Tribunal court case between the kahal of Siemiatycze and the kahal of Sarnaki regarding their territorial competence
Manifest: A register of legal documents from the case of the landlords of Siematycze, princes Jabłonkowskis along with the kahal of Tykocin versus the landlord of Sarnaki, Butler, the starost of Mielnik along with the regional kahal, with the parties contesting the current territorial competence of the kahals. The register contains a short abstract of the documents, and, among others,  the rulings of the elders of the Crown Jews, the land rabbi and the Crown Tribunal
Archive: The Lviv National Vasyl Stefanyk Scientific Library of Ukraine
Reference Number: Lwowska Naukowa Biblioteka im. Stefanyka, Fond 915, оp. 1, sp. 1, s. 169-171

Title: Letter by M. Ryppowa to Adam Sieniawski with a request for an order to the Jews from his estates
Manifest: Widow M. Ryppowa asks Adam Sieniawski to force the Jews from his estates to pay overdue order of payment for her husband, on the basis of the poll tax distribution by land elders
